loans.name: Rose's Leaf Group

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages11, 6, and 3 years old. Rose sells fish. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 6.30am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $10 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Mwaija, Eliza, Anna and Zubeda, who have cooking businesses and sell clothing and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase of tablecloths, cushions, and ornamental plants to retail in her community

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria is 45 years old. She was able to complete her elementary education. She speaks Spanish and Aymara (indigenous language) and is married to Don Lucio Yupanqui Condori. They have three children that are students; one of them studies in Arequipa and two in Yunguyo. She lives in Villa Queñuani, Yunguyo Duistrict.

Beforehand, she used to sell clothes which she will also took to Tacna and Arequipa. Since young she has been dedicated also to sell potato starch, potatoes, and quinoa which she actually does athe markets of Tacna and Arequipa

She belongs to the "Vista Alegre" Communal Bank and at the beginning she obtained a S/. 300.00 nuevos soles(Peruvian currency) loan which she invested in buying sheep. With the new loan of S/. 1,500.00 (Peruvian currency), which she promises to pay back in 4 payments, she will buy potato starch, potatoes, and quinoa in larger quantities.

Gregoria has also learned to be responsible with ther payments. Her biggest wish is to be able to buy a house in Arequipa and another one in Yunguyo, give a good education to her children and lately be able to buy a car.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Gregoria tiene 45 años de edad, logro estudiar primaria completa, habla castellano y aymará, es casada con don Lucio Yupanqui Condori, con quien tiene tres hijos, de los cuales los tres estudian, uno en Arequipa, dos en Yunguyo, ella vive en Villa Queñuani, Distrito de Yunguyo. Antes se dedicaba a la venta de ropa, que también llevaba hacia Tacna y Arequipa, actualmente, ella se dedica a la venta de chuño, papa, quinua, oca, que lo vende en mercados de Tacna y Arequipa inicio el negocio desde muy joven. Pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vista Alegre” a un inicio tuvo un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de ovejas. Con este crédito de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, compró chuño, papa y quinua en mayores cantidades. Aprendió a ser responsable en sus pagos. El gran anhelo que ella tiene es, comprar una casa en Arequipa y Yunguyo, darles una buena educación a sus hijos, posteriormente comprarse un volvo.

loans.use: Buying tubers and cereal.

loans.name: Groupement Des Femmes De Aynoumane

texts.fr:
These women are part of the large Lingueres de Mbour association. They have a good history with the IMCEC credit organization, dating from two years ago. They buy vegetables, fish, oil and second-hand clothes, which they resell in their neighborhoods around the village of Mbour. They are mothers of families, very lively and hardworking. They will use this loan to augment their working capital, thereby increasing their stock and diversifying the products they carry.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Elles font parti du grand groupement des Lingueres de Mbour. Elles ont une bonne expérience avec l’IMCEC (deux ans). Elles achètent des légumes, du poisson, de l’huile et de la piperie qu’elles revendent dans leurs quartiers situés à la périphérie de la commune de Mbour. Elles sont des mères de familles très dynamiques et travailleuses. Elles vont investir le crédit dans le renforcement de leur fonds de roulement et ainsi, améliorer le niveau de les stocks et la diversité de leurs produits

loans.use: Supplementation of working capital

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Kossi .A. est un commerçant dynamique  âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. Il tient une boutique de prêt à porter au quartier commercial de Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo à 120 Km de Lomé la capitale Togolaise. Kossi est un client fidèle de FECECAV et désire par ce troisième crédit renforcer son  fond de roulement permettant de renouveler à une fréquence régulière son stock. Avec cette chance de Kiva, il pourrait désormais faire face à une clientèle exigeante en tissus de marque, gagner plus d’argent et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kossi A. is an energetic merchant, 32 years old, married, and the father of two children. He has a shop of ready-to-wear clothing in the commercial district of Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo and about 120 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Kossi is a loyal client of FECECAV and would like to use this third loan to bolster his working capital. This would allow him to renew his inventory on a regular basis. With this Kiva opportunity, he would then be able to cope with his demanding customer base regarding name-brand fabrics. He would also be able to earn more money and to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ready-to-wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel A. is a 47-year-old man, married with three children. All the children are in school. Emmanuel A. enjoys selling and takes pride in serving his customers. He has been selling maize for two years to support his family. He obtains his supplies from the farming communities, and sells at retail to his customers. He wants to use the loan to buy bags of maize to meet the daily demands of his customers in his community and the surrounding markets. He hopes to use part of his profit to pay his children's educational fees. Emmanuel A. is a member of a community group called "Nyame Mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha B. T. is a member of the community bank Llapanchik, which is a Quechuan word meaning ‘everyone together’. Bertha lives in Ayacucho with her husband and their 2 children, aged 15 & 14. Bertha travels to the fairs daily to sell cereals and grains.

With her loan of 2400 soles, Bertha will invest in her business purchasing corn and wheat from the country. Her goal is to have a bigger business and ensure her children attend the university to earn their degrees and become professionals.

loans.use: purchase corn and wheat from the country

loans.name: Savi

texts.es: La señora Savi tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto  Su actividad diaria es la venta de abarrotes, labor que viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es estar en contacto directo con sus clientes y desde luego darles una buena atención para que regresen en otra oportunidad. Le es rentable porque cuenta con una clientela que la apoya desde el primer momento que puso este negocio, por lo que no muestra dificultad alguna.a su conviviente y sus 3 hijos,  quienes están estudiando y son su razón de seguir adelante. Esta es la cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, mostrándose puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado quiere ampliar y ambientar adecuadamente su negocio, para así dar una buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Savi is 30 years old and lives with her family. Her daily activity is grocery sales, work she has done for 6 years. She likes being in direct contact with her clients and of course likes to give them good service so that they come back. The business is profitable since she is able to depend upon a client base that has helped her from the start. For this reason, she has had no troubles to mention. She lives with her domestic partner and their three children, who are students and are also her reason to persevere in her efforts. This is the fourth loan that she has solicited from Kiva field partner MFP, and she has demonstrated punctual repayments. With the solicited loan proceeds she would like to expand and decorate her business adequately, for her clients' benefit.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To decorate and expand a store.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes M. is married to a blacksmith and has 5 dependents. She has received schooling through junior high school. Since 1994, Agnes has been selling a local meal popularly known as 'Kenkey' which is made out of corn. It is one of the most commonly eaten foods in the country and it is normally eaten with hot sauce and fried fish at Ataabadze near Elmina. Agnes uses her income to assist her husband in meeting the family's financial needs. Agnes will use the loan to increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which she uses to prepare the Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes plans to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To increase her purchase of maize, fresh fish and other ingredients which are used to prepare the Kenkey.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en: Naila A. is 50 year old woman who has bred sheep for the last ten years. Naila and her husband are very responsible parents of their four dear children, and they work very hard breeding sheep so they can give their children the opportunity to finish school – an opportunity they never had due to poor finances. Naila has been working in agriculture since getting married. She and her husband buy and sell sheep in order to cover the family’s most urgent needs. Even so, Naila now finds herself with more expenses than income, and she would like a loan in order to increase production. Naila and her family are counting on your help.

loans.use: Purchase ten sheep and fodder

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Danaya sont tous des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans de familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec les frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Elles résident tous dans le village de Coni sous préfecture de Fana région de Koulikoro république du Mali. 
Par des relations de mariage, ces femmes se sont connues et font majoritairement l’achat vente des condiments alimentaires. 
Dans l’intention d’agrandir la taille de leur commerce elles ont intégré l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur quatrième prêt après avoir remboursé tous les trois prêts précédents.
Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt, 100kg de sel de cuisine, 10 boites de 2 kg de concentrée de tomate  et une grande quantité de condiments divers. 
Elles s’approvisionnent dans le marché de Marka-Coungo et viennent revendre sur le marché local de Coni et ses environnants. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 25 000 F CFA chacune et se proposent d’utiliser ce bénéfice pour assurer une bonne alimentation  de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Danaya group are all married women with an average age of 29 and on average, 5 children. They live in traditional extended conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands. They all reside in the village of Coni, Sous-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali.

These women are acquainted with each other because they are in-laws and for the most part, they buy and sell condiments.

With the intention of increasing the size of their businesses, they joined the micro-finance institute Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth loan, after having reimbursed the three preceding loans correctly.

With this loan they intend to buy 100 kg of cooking salt, 10 cans of 2 kg of tomato concentrate, and a large quantity of various other condiments. They do their buying in the market of Marka-Coungo and come to sell their merchandise in the local markets of Coni and its surroundings. They expect to make a profit of 25,000 F CFA each and intend to use this profit to nourish their children well.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Blanca Obdulia

texts.es:
Blanca es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Blanca es casada, tiene 56 años, cuatro hijos de 28, 24, 19 y 17 años, loa mayores trabajan y los últimos van a empezar a estudiar.  
Blanca empezó vendiendo plátanos en un puesto alquilado, hoy en día  su puesto es propio su esposo, vende fruta de primera calidad, se levanta a las seis de la mañana para comprar en la parada, ella trabaja con su esposo todo el día. 
Blanca necesita 1800 soles, para la compra de frutas de la estación de primera calidad.
Desde que está en Finca, gracias a los préstamos pudo invertir y salir de las deudas que tenia.  
El sueño de Blanca es tener una casa propia y que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
Blanca is a member of the “Mujeres Progresando” (“Women Making Advances”) cooperative bank. Blanca is married, 56 years old, and has four children ages 28, 24, 19 and 17. The older ones are working, while the younger ones are studying. Blanca started out selling bananas from a rented location. These days, she owns her own site and sells high-quality fruit. She rises at 6 am to make her purchases at the street market. She works all day with her husband. Blanca needs 1,800 soles to buy high-quality seasonal fruits. Since she has been with Finca, she has thankfully had the loans to invest and to get out of the debt she was in. Blanca’s dream is to own her own home, and for her children to be able to study.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Blanca needs 1800 soles to buy high-quality seasonal fruit.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: Raúl vive con su madre y su hijo de 10 años en casa de sus padres. Se dedica al servicio técnico dental, realiza todo tipo de postizos dentales de diversas calidades y según la necesidad de sus clientes, actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace más de medio año. Previamente se preparó estudiando para poder desarrollar esta actividad, y en la actualidad ha notado que tiene buenos logros por la calidad de los productos que realiza. Su trabajo le da mucha satisfacción, porque siente que es el oficio le permite desarrollar todo su potencial, razón por la cual está planeando abrir en los próximos meses su laboratorio dental en una zona céntrica de su ciudad. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y se compromete a ser puntual en los pagos, así como a participar activamente en su banco comunal. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de los materiales necesarios para su oficio, como cera dental, yeso, moldes, entre otros, ya que necesita cubrir los últimos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Raúl lives with his mother and his 10 year old son in his parent’s house. He works as a dental technician, putting in all types of dental prosthetics according to the needs of his customers, a job he has worked at for more than 6 months. Previously he undertook studies to develop this skill, and now he has had success because of the quality of the products he makes. His work gives him a lot of satisfaction, because he feels that the job has allowed him to develop to his full potential and because of this he is planning to open his own dental laboratory in the center of the city in the coming months. This is the first time that he has had a loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he promises to be punctual with his payments and also to actively participate in his communal bank. The money that he is asking for is for the purchase of the items necessary for his office and also for dental wax, plaster, molds, among other things, as he needs to cover his recent orders.

Translated from Spanish by Donna Yates, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for the manufacture of dental prosthetics

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr: Monsieur A. ayao exerce dans la mécanique, il a ouvert  un garage dans lequel il exerce son activité, il a associé  à   son activité de mécanique le commerce de pièces détachées  qu’il profite en même temps pour vendre à ses clients. Voulant se réapprovisionner en pièces détachées et acheter du matériel de travail, il sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter des moteurs, des amortisseurs, du matériel mécanique et d’autres pièces détachées. Il est marié et a 04 enfants, sa femme est une revendeuse.
texts.en:
Mr. A. Ayao works in mechanics. He opened a garage where he works at his trade, to which he has included commerce in spare parts that is all the while advantageous to him for selling to customers. Wanting to resupply himself with spare parts and to buy work materials, he's requesting his first loan to buy motors, shock absorbers, mechanical equipment, and other spare parts. He is married and has four children. His wife is in sales.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy motors, shock absorbers, spare parts, and work materials

loans.name: Ally

texts.en: Ally M. is a Tanzanian small-business owner. He is married. He runs a phone-accessory shop in Yombo Vituka in Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business items from the wholesale shops at the Kariakoo business center and sells on a retail basis to his customers. He has been in the business for only one year. His business plan is to run a mobile-phone shop but funds are the most limiting factor. He needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Yudeta

texts.en:
Yudeta K. currently sells beans and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and rice to sell. She is a 45-year-old woman whose husband was shot dead during the 21 year liberation war in southern Sudan. She has five children: two are in Juba day secondary school and three are in primary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. 


 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Karla Yaneth

texts.es: Karla Yaneth V. M. vive en el departamento de La Libertad, Karla es una joven mujer de tan 21 años de edad con muchas responsabilidades, ella está a cargo de sus 3 hermanos que aun son menores de edad todos estudiando en la escuela, también Karla es madre soltera de Cristofer su hijo de 4 años de edad. Karla recibe remesas de sus padres, que por motivos económicos están lejos de ella y sus hermanos, pero Karla es una mujer muy trabajadora y hace tres años monto un comedor en el  mercado municipal del puerto de La Libertad donde todos los días vende desayunos y almuerzos, ella solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus platillos, principalmente granos básicos ya que son los que más utiliza.
texts.en:
Karla Yaneth Velasquez M. lives in the Department of La Libertad. She is a young lady, 21 years old, with a lot of responsibilities. In addition to taking care of three younger brothers, all in school, Karla also is a single mother and has to care for a young son Cristofer, who is 4 years old. Karla receives some financial help from her parents, who, for financial reasons, live very far from her. But Karla is very hard working, and three months ago she set up a stand in the city market in the port of La Libertad from which she sells breakfast and lunch. She is requesting this loan to purchase the food she will need for the meals – especially cereal grains which she uses a lot.

Translated from Spanish by William Farren, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for restaurant

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. owns a small rice farm. Her main crop is rice. She has been tilling the farm for seven years to help support the needs of her family. She is 31 years old and has two children. Her husband, Hegino P. Jr., manages their farm. She never stops dreaming that someday she will be able to buy an additional farm lot of 1-hectare. She also wishes to have a better quality of life and good health for all her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm needs. She thinks that her loan from CEVI will help her improve her yield in the future.

CEVI helps small farmers sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farming needs

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio O. E. es un señor de 43 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros

Desde hace ya varios años don Antonio se dedica a la ganadería de doble propósito. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de los productos que ofrece. En su caso en particular, la demanda es mayor de lo que puede ofrecer actualmente. 

Don Antonio considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su familia han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida, logradando ser actores en el desarrollo de la comunidad, la cual se ve frecuentemente azotada por las inclemencias del tiempo y el desempleo.

Actualmente don Luis desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢685,000 (seiscientos ochenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar varios toretes pequeños  y así  poder incrementar la producción. El sabe que contar con mayor número de vacas más es un mayor sacrificio y demandará más trabajo. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida, lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero. 

Don Antonio es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Antonio O. E. is a 43-year-old man who lives with his wife and two children in the small, rural, Costa Rican community of Las Delicias de Upala in the province of Alajuela. He works in commerce, raises cattle (milk and meat), and grows basic grains like rice, beans, and corn. Mr. Antonio has worked with both milk cows and raising cattle for meat for many years. He sells his products to his neighbors and to people in his community and they are happy with the quality he produces. Currently there is more demand than he can satisfy. Mr. Antonio thinks that he and his family have been able to improve their living conditions bit by bit because of the success he has had with his business. He has also been able to help the community, a community that is regularly struck with bad weather and unemployment. Mr. Antonio would like a loan of 685,000 colones to buy several young bulls so he can increase production. He knows that having more cows will be a greater sacrifice and make more work for him. But his desire to be a successful small business owner and improve life for his family motivates him to work even harder. Mr. Antonio is a member of the communal bank “Datraban.” “Datraban is one of the hundreds of EDESA's member organizations in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan and he hopes to use it to keep growing, on both personal and economic levels. He also will continue to be an active participant in helping to develop his communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra ganado doble propósito

loans.name: Jheny Marisol

texts.es:
Yheny es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil.
Yheny es soltera, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Yeny es agente vendedora de productos diversos que ofrece a diferentes tiendas.
Yheny necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de los estudios de su hijo.
Los sueños de Yheny es terminar de construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Yheny is a member of the Dos Mil Communal Bank. She is single, 38 years old, and has two children. Yheny is a salesperson, offering various products to different stores. Yheny needs a loan of 1000 soles- money that will be invested in paying for her son's education. Yheny's dreams are to finish building her house and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Gladys Ambiyo

texts.en:
Gladys S. is 44 years old and married to Emmanuel Owacho who is a social worker. Together they have five children. Her business is located at PAG Church on the Likuyani road in Eldoret Town. She has been in the retail business for the past two years now.

Gladys was introduced to KADET Limited by a group member. She has applied for a loan which she intends to use to restock her retail shop with one bag of sugar, two bags of rice, cooking fat and detergents. In future she intends to diversify to wholesale and increase her sales to one hundred thousand (100000/=).

This will enable her to support her family by providing the basic needs and educate her three dependents.

loans.use: To restock her retail business

loans.name: Justacio Ramiro

texts.es: Justacio Ramiro P. tiene 67 años. Es un hombre casado, este Señor tiene 6 hijos su compañera de vida  trabaja en la administración  de una  venta de refrescos y gaseosa en su vivienda. Hace más de 30 años que se dedica a brindar el servicio de zapatería.la ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del Mercado Santos Bárcenas por lo que en este lugar es donde hay más afluencia de clientes.  el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita  realizar las compras de hilo encerado, lija, pega, clavos y suela debido a que la compra de este se hace en Managua ya que al por mayor le resulta más conveniente y podrá realizar los encargos que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Justacio Ramiro P. is 67 years old. He is married and has 6 children. His wife runs a business selling soft drinks in their home. For more than 30 years he has been providing shoe-making services. His business is located on the outskirts of the Santos Bárcenas market, because this area has more affluent customers.

The loan is for working capital, which he needs to buy waxed thread, sandpaper, paste, nails, and soles, which he can buy wholesale in Managua. This will be convenient, and he will be able to fill all the orders he has pending.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Oussou Richard

texts.fr: F. Oussou Richard est né vers 1960 à Ayokpo. Oussou Richard est marié et père de treize enfants. Mais Oussou Richard a seulement six enfants à charge aujourd’hui. Oussou Richard assure les charges de la famille mais avec l’aide de sa femme. Oussou Richard est un pêcheur. Oussou Richard a déjà vingt ans d’expérience dans la pêche. Oussou Richard veut augmenter sa capacité en matière de pêche et pour cela il a besoin de moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Oussou Richard sollicite un prêt d’ALIDé pour acheter le matériel nécessaire.
texts.en:
Oussou Richard F. was born around 1960 in the town of Ayokpo. Oussou Richard is married and he is the father of 13 chidlren, but only six of his children are still in his care. Oussou Richard provides for the needs of the family together with his wife. Oussou Richard is a fisherman. Oussou Richard has been carrying out his fishing business for the past 20 years. Oussou Richard wants to increase the size of his catch and for this he requires financial support. For this reason Oussou Richard is requesting a loan from Alide (Kiva Field Partner). He will purchase all the tools necessary.


Translated from French by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools.

loans.name: San Antonio De Padua Group

texts.es: Es un grupo nuevo muy responsables en sus pagos, venden en un solo lugar se conocen bien. Su grupo se llama "SAN ANTONIO DE PADUA", donde, el Banco de Emprendimiento esta en su 2º Ciclo, la  mesa directiva esta conformada la siguiente manera,  como presidenta esta  la señora Rossemary V. ,ella es lider de su grupo,muy responsable, vende pollos frito en carrito, tiene 3 hijos, es casada su esposo trabaja en la policia. Como tesorera esta la socia Evelin F. C.  quien es muy responsable y conocedora del manejo del efectivo. Tiene 1 hijo vive en concubinato vende CDs,  el credito lo utiliza para  aumento de capital. Como secretaria esta la socia Carla T. Illanes vive con sus padres es soltera no tiene hijos, estudia Barbulario,el credito lo utiliza para aumento de capital, ella tiene la venta de refrescos.
texts.en:
This is a new group in which the members have been responsible with their payments. They all sell at a single location that is well-known. The group is called “San Antonio de Padua” and the members are in their 2nd loan cycle. The board consists of the following members: Sra. Rosmery V. serves as the president and leader of the group. She is very responsible. She sells fried chicken from a cart. Rosmery has 3 children and is married to a police officer. Evelin F. C. serves as the treasurer. She is very responsible and is known for being an effective manager. She has 1 child with her live-in partner. Evelin sells compact discs and will use her loan to increase her capital. Carla T. Illanes serves as the secretary. She is single, does not have children, and lives with her parents. Carla is studying speech communications. She will use her loan to increase her capital for her soft drinks business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for improving their businesses

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is 56 years old. She is a widow with four children. She makes bird feed to sell in bags to her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more bird feed to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more materials to make bird feed to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 29-year-old single mother with an 8-year-old son. For the last four years, she has run a business supplying wrapping paper, plastics, and old newspaper. Her customers include businesses like butcheries, retail shops, and take-away food kiosks. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to purchase more stock to deliver direct to wholesalers.

Rose describes herself as very ambitious and hardworking and says that since joining Kiva partner Faulu she has become more knowledgeable about business matters and a better saver. In the future, she hopes to buy a pick-up truck to deliver her products to wholesalers in Kericho and bring food items in return. She would also like to build a flat to rent out for extra income.

About Faulu Kenya
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To purchase stock

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nyetaa est composé de quatre femmes,  mariées majoritairement dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont  en moyenne   38 ans, 5 enfants et habitent au Camp Militaire de Ségou  (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage car sont toutes épouses de militaires et font partie de la même association Finesse d’entre aide des femmes du camp. Elles font le commerce d’articles divers.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, elles ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elles sont à leur prêt  solidaire.
Elles comptent acheter, 10 tenues en bazins moins riche, 15 pièces de pagnes wax, 6 tenues en tissus brodés, 2 sacs de farine de blé, 2 bidons  d’huile alimentaires de 20Litres et des ingrédients pour la fabrication de l’encens. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en habits à Bamako et au grand marché de Ségou, en ingrédients pour l’encens, les pagnes en wax, l’huile, la farine au grand marché de Ségou.  
Les habits  sont vendus   au grand marché, à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou et au marché château et à l’intérieur du camp, l’encens est repartie en deux une partie est vendue au grand marché et l’autre est donnée à crédit aux femmes du camp sur commande, les beignets en farine de blé   sont vendu au marché de Ségou Coro.  Les ventes se font   au comptant et  à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 27.375 FCFA qui servira à rembourser le prêt,  les tontines, à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux,  à participer aux événements sociaux, à acheter de petits ruminants. 
Elles ambitionnent avoir une maison à usage d’habitation à Ségou ou Bamako.
texts.en:
The group Nyetaa is composed of four married women mostly in polygamous households.  The women average 38 years of age and five children each and live at the Camp Militaire de Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The women know one another through community ties because they are all the wives of soldiers and belong to the same association "Finesse", a women's mutual-aid organization of the camp.  The group members do commerce in a variety of goods. Concerned about satisfying customer needs, they decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their solidarity loan.  They intend to buy ten outfits of moins riche damask outfits, fifteen bolts of Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), six outfits of embroidered cloth, two sacks of wheat flour, two 20-liter containers of cooking oil, and some ingredients for making incense.  Supplies of clothing are gotten in Bamako and at the big market of Ségou;  ingredients for incense, pagnes, oil, and flour are gotten at the big market of Ségou.  The clothing is sold at the big market, at the weekly fair in Ségou, at the Château market, and inside the camp.  The incense are divided into two, with one part sold at the big market and the other part lent out to the women in the camp by special order.  The beignets made of wheat flour are sold at the Ségou Coro market to customers composed of women and men. The group members hope to realize an average monthly profit of 27,375 francs CFA that will be used to repay the loan and the lending association, to meet sundry family needs, to assist with societal events, and to buy small ruminants.  Their ambition is to have a house in which to live in Ségou or Bamako.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Joseph Kimathi

texts.en: Joseph Kimathi K. has sold home products such as cooking fat, soap, rice, flour and others to residents in the Maweni area in Mombasa for the last three years. This is the coastal side of Kenya  His business challenge is the lack of funds to restock the goods.  He plans to use the proceeds of a KES20,000 loan to purchase flour, cooking fat, rice and other items.  Joseph is looking forward to becoming a wholesaler in the future.  He is married and has three children ranging from 2 to 6 years old.  He describes himself as friendly.

loans.use: To add more home products.

loans.name: Mrs. Makara Phan Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of 15 people located in Smau Khchei village in Takeo province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Makara P. is the village bank president. She is 21 years old and the mother of a child who is too young to work or study. 

Mrs. Makara P. is a laborer who makes a small income to support her family. Since the workplace is far from home, she needs to use more money on transportation. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to bU. a motorbike to go to work. Her husband, Mr. Pich Socheat, is a soldier who makes a small income to support the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to go to work.

loans.name: Small Business Unit Group

texts.en: John F. is the leader of five borrowers called Small Business Unit. He is 37 years old and is married with three children aged 13 to 16 years with educational levels of 4th and 5th grade. He is a nursing student hoping to graduate next semester. John lives and sells at Rock Town UN drive, Water Side. This area has a market environment and is a crowded area close to downtown Monrovia. John's business is the sale of new clothes. He has been running this business for twelve years and hopes to own a store in the near future. John started his business by selling used clothes and his capital was 2,500 Liberian dollars. He attracts customers by selling new designs and needs this loan to purchase more clothes to sell. He dreams of educating his children to make them good future leaders. In the photo that accompanies this profile, John is the one holding the sign. S. J. is inset at lower left. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes to sell

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en:
Sadiq M. is a 37-year-old man who has sold office supplies and toys in Agsu city since 2006. He is married and has two children who are the meaning of his life. He enjoys his life very much and his working day is more that nine hours long.

Sadiq is alone in his business and he would like to increase his income and spend more time with his adorable kids. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN which he will use to purchase more supplies and toys to increase his profit.

Sadiq and his family count on your help.

loans.use: To purchase more office supplies and toys to sell

loans.name: Juana Rebeca

texts.es: Doña Juana Rebeca B. Velásquez  cuenta con 36 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller  habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 10 años de Elaborar Cortes Típicos en su negocio que se encuentra en el Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Juana Rebeca B. Velásquez is married and lives with her husband and 2 children.. She is an artesan who makes traditional carvings in her own workshop. She and her husband work in the same business, and have been making traditional carvings for 10 years. Her business is found in Paraje Pacoc Siguán, Cantón Poxlajuj, Totonicapán Department, Guatemala. Demand from her clientele has increased but she doesn't have sufficient economic resources to increase her capital. For this reason she went to Asociación ASDIR to seek a loan with the intention of purchasing material and in this way increase her sales. She hopes to also help her children progress and have a better standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es:
Fabián  forma parte del banco comunal “Kantu de San Jerónimo”, es soltero y es natural  de la ciudad del cusco. Fabian es profesor titulado y actualmente esta ejerciendo su profesión durante el tiempo escolar en el colegio “56266 de Livitaca” en la provincia de Chumbivilcas del departamento del Cusco. El socio cuando esta de vacaciones por los meses de enero y febrero enseña en una academia pre universitaria “Master” que se encuentra ubicada detrás de la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco. Fabián también se dedica a la venta de carne de ovino en la comunidad de Livitaca a los restaurantes. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Fabián requiere el préstamo de los 500 soles para comprar 5 corderos que le costaran comprar aproximadamente entre 80 soles y 100 soles.  Fabián nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es abrir una ferretería y radicar en la ciudad del Cusco.   
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad de Livitaca es distrito de la provincia de Chumbivilcas del Departamento del Cusco, Chumbivilcas Hermoso distrito alto andino de aguerridos pobladores ubicado a 240 Km., de la ciudad imperial del Cusco).
texts.en:
Fabian belongs to the “Kantu de San Jeronimo” communal bank. He is single, and a native of Cuzco. He has a degree and currently teaches during the school year in Livitaca 56266 high school, in Chumbivilcas province, department of Cuzco. When he is on vacation in January and February, he teaches in a “Master” prep school, located behind San Antonio Abad del Cuzco National University. Fabian also sells sheep meat to restaurants in the Livitaca community. He has been in that business for a year, and has done well, because he has worked very hard. Fabian needs a loan of 500 soles to buy 5 lambs, which will cost between 80 and 100 soles. He tells us that his greatest dream is to open a hardware store and live in Cuzco. He is grateful for the opportunity offered here, and commits to paying back the loan per the schedule. (Livitaca is a district of the Chumbivilcas province, department of Cuzco. Beautiful Chumbivilcas, high Andes, tough inhabitants, located 240 km. from the city of Cuzco.)

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabian needs a loan of 500 soles to buy 5 lambs

loans.name: Bacilisa

texts.es:
Bacilisa, tiene 46 años, tiene tres hijos (Miguel, Junior y Jairo), es una madre responsable que saca adelante a sus hijos y quiere darles una mejor profesión para que puedan defenderse mejor en la vida. 

Bacilisa es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a  la venta de comestibles como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su domicilio donde ofrece sus productos. Ya son 4 años que se dedica a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien. 

Bacilisa también se dedica a la venta de pizzas de forma ambulatoria en la avenida principal de la ciudad de Urubamba, la socia vende cada pizzas a 4 soles, ella sale a vender sus pizzas a partir de las 6 p.m. hasta las 10 p.m. La socia nos cuenta que antes tenía un proveedor de pizzas pre cocidas pero ahora la socia elabora sus propias pizza pre cocidas. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Bacilisa requiere el préstamo para comprar 20 cajas de cerveza, leche, harina,  arroz y azúcar. 

Bacilisa pertenece al banco comunal “Reyna de los Ángeles”, ella es una de las fundadoras del banco comunal. El anhelo de la socia es abrir un depósito de cerveza y tener su propia pizzería.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Bacilisa is 46 years old, and she has three children (Miguel, Junior, and Jairo). She is a responsible mother who gets her children ahead. She wants to give them a better profession so that they will be able to better take care of themselves in this life. Bacilisa is a very hard-working woman. She sells food like rice, sugar, noodles, and, milk, etc. She has a small store in her house where she sells these products. She has been in this business for four years, and it has gone very well for her. Bacilisa also sells pizzas as a street vendor on a main avenue in the city of Urubamba. She sells each pizza for four PEN. She leaves to sell her pizzas at six p.m., and she sells until ten p.m. She tells us that she used to have a provider of pre-cooked pizzas, but now she makes her own pre-cooked pizzas. She has been in this business for one year, and it is going very well for her. Bacilisa needs the loan to buy 20 cases of beer, milk, flour, rice and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 20 cases of beer, milk, flour, rice and sugar

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 2ans et demi et a de belles performances avec le crédit. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine, son crédit lui permettra d'acheter deux bœufs, de les engraisser pendant 4 à 5 mois et de les revendre dans le marché hebdomadaire de sa localité. Les profits générés par son activité lui permettent participer aux différents besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Marie is 60 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for 2 ½ years and has had good experiences with credit loans. She fattens cattle, and her loan will enable her to buy two oxen, to fatten them for four-five months, and resell them at the local weekly market. The profits generated by her activity will enable her to participate in meeting various family needs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen for fattening

loans.name: Miyaray

texts.es: Miyaray tiene 45 años,  vive en su casa propia  junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Su negocio al que se dedica, es la venta de gaseosas y galletas, en su bodega que tiene en un espacio de su casa. Es así que todas las mañanas limpia y ordena sus productos antes de abrir su negocio. Hasta el momento ha logrado captar muchos clientes, que acuden diariamente a su establecimiento. Su hija Katty la ayuda en la atención de sus clientes, al final parte de las ganancias que obtiene son derivadas para la educación de su hija. Para Miyaray su trabajo la relaja, puesto que el atender a sus clientes y conversar con ellos la distraen bastante. Es así que hace más de 3 años que empezó con este negocio, siendo lo primeros meses muy difícil para conseguir clientes, ahora es muy reconocida por su barrio. En adelante le gustaría ampliar su bodega y abastecerse de variados productos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y promete pagar todas las cuotas dentro de las fechas establecidas, ya que será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar cervezas al por mayor, porque los fines de semana son muy requeridas y considera que así logrará aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Miyaray is 45 years old and lives in her own home together with her husband and two children. She sells soda and cookies for a living in her small shop, which is located inside her house. Every day, she cleans and arranges the products before opening her shop. Miyaray has managed to acquire a very sizeable clientele who go to her shop on a daily basis. Her daughter, Katty, helps her to attend to customers, as part of the profits made from the shop goes towards her education. For Miyaray, her work helps her to relax, as attending to customers and talking with them helps to keep her mind off things. It has been over three years since Miyaray started the shop. However, the first months were difficult in which to build up clientele. Nowadays, Miyaray’s shop is well known throughout the neighbourhood. In future, Miyaray would like to expand her shop and be able to stock it with a greater variety of products. This is her second loan with MFP and she fully commits to repaying the loan within the prescribed period. Miyaray plans to use the loan to buy beers from wholesale as customers often wish to purchase these at the weekend. She can then increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer to increase her earnings/profits.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok T. began to sell food that she prepared at home when she was newly married. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are now married and living separately and one is single and works in a mobile phone company. In addition to her food sales, Sok T. sells some cooking ingredients from the store she built. She has a life partner in her husband who is a military policeman. Sok T. is requesting a loan so she can decorate her store and increase her inventory of groceries and other food ingredients for her business.

loans.use: To decorate her store and increase her inventory

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose T. lives in the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. He is 48 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, he operates a store where he sells bananas and sweet potatoes to people who live in his community. Jose has been engaged in this business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month from his work.

Last year, Jose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He has successfully repaid two previous loans from HSPFI, after using them to buy bananas and root crops to sell. Now he is applying for a new loan for 11,000 PHP to expand his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for the education of children. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand his small business

loans.name: Aracelys Maribel

texts.es: A sus 23 años de edad la señora Aracelys Reyes, junto a su esposo ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a trabajar como empleado en una compañía naviera en el país vecino de Costa Rica, en donde ella desempeña el puesto de mesera de un restaurante y su esposo como capitán de una embarcación dicha actividad económica de la empresa para la cual ellos trabajan es con destinos turísticos, actualmente este matrimonio ha decidido realizar la construcción de su vivienda ubicada en la comarca las mesitas sector casa blanca, en donde tienen el sueño de emprender un negocio he independizarse de su vida como empleados, por tal razón ellos solicitaron un crédito para poder terminar su casa y tener un mejor lugar donde habitar junto a su pequeña hija de 3 añitos de edad.
texts.en:
Aracelys Reyes, twenty-three, along with her husband, has spent most of her life working for a shipping company in the country neighboring Costa Rica. She works as a server in a restaurant and her husband is a boat captain. The company they work for serves tourist destinations. This couple has now decided to build their own house in the Casa Blanca sector of the Las Mesitas region, where they dream of launching a business to free themselves from their lives as employees. That's why they've asked for a loan, so they can finish up their house and have a better place to live with their little three-year-old daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Bernaldo

texts.es:
El señor Bernaldo R. A. empezó con la actividad de cultivo de banano hace 6 años atrás, anteriormente trabajaba como jornalero y se le presento la oportunidad de comprarse un lotecito de 4 has para poderlo trabajar, para su suerte correspondía a una zona bananera que contaba con una buena organización en cuanto a la infraestructura como cable vía y empacadoras, lo que le permitió desarrollar más, actualmente cuenta con casi 8 has de de las cuales está con 4 has en producción. 

Tiene 4 hijos a los que mantiene y cuida con dedicación, su producto lo comercializa por medio de la asociación 25 de julio a las empresas exportadoras de banano, quienes lo llevan hasta los mercados chilenos y argentinos, el mantenimiento de sus cultivos lo realiza con fumigación con avioneta, agrupándose con sus vecinos, el trabajo de campo es más familiar y algunas veces contrata hasta dos jornaleros eventuales mas para que le colaboren en el trabajo de rosado de las plantaciones. El solicitante es una persona con muy buenas perspectivas de seguir creciendo y seguir mejorando sus plantaciones de banano.

Lo que necesita Bernaldo es capital para poder comprar insumos para el cultivo de banano y asi poder cultivar este producto en todo su terreno y asi mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Bernaldo R. A. started farming bananas 6 years ago. He used to be employed as a day laborer. He had the opportunity to buy a small, 4 hectare, lot in a banana growing area that fortunately had the entire necessary infrastructure in place, like conveyor belts and packers that allowed for more development. He currently has almost 8 hectares four of which are in production. He has four children that he supports with care and dedication. He sells his crops through the 25 de Julio association, one of the banana exporting firms that take the cops to Chilean and Argentinean markets. He and his neighbors group together to have their crops aerially fumigated. The field work is more family oriented and sometimes he hires up to two day workers to help with watering. He is a person with good prospects for future growth and continued improvement of his banana crops. Bernaldo needs capital to buy supplies for banana crops so that he can produce bananas on his entire property thereby improving his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for banana crops.

loans.name: Edita

texts.es: Edita tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años cultiva hortalizas, principalmente brócoli y coliflor, por ser vegetales muy cotizados y mejor renumerados en el mercado. Es por ello que se esfuerzan en la siembra de estos productos, tanto su esposo y sus hijos siempre están al pendiente en cada proceso que requiere estos cultivos, desde que son sembrados hasta la cosecha, en donde contrata operarios para éste último proceso en donde se encargan de la recolección. Una vez cosechado, son vendidos directamente en el mercado de su zona, asimismo son llevados a otras ciudades cercanas para ampliar su mercado. Durante este tiempo, ha visto mejoras en su economía debido a las rentas que recibe son buenas y la tierra que posee se mantiene con los mismos nutrientes, necesarios para los próximos cultivos. En adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos aumentando sus extensiones de terreno que tiene. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  aquellas personas que son gestoras del préstamo, puesto que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el pago de mantenimiento mecánico de su carro, que le sirve para transportar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Edita is 36 years old and lives in her home with her husband and three children. For more than three years she has been growing vegetables, especially broccoli and cauliflower, since these are highly prized goods that earn good prices at the market. For this reason, she puts the effort into planting these crops. Her husband and children are always monitoring each step that is required to grow each product, from planting through harvest. She hires workers for the final process which involves collecting everything that is ready for harvest. Once everything is collected Edita sells her products directly at the local market, but she also takes them to other cities nearby to expand her customer base. During the whole time she has been farming, Edita has seen improvements in her finances because her profits have been good and her land has maintained its fertility season after season. In order to keep improving her crops, she wants to expand by acquiring more land.

This is her tenth loan with MFP. Edita is very happy to know she has financial support, which is why she has always demonstrated responsibility with her payments. She is glad to be part of her Communal Bank because all of the members are responsible and supportive people. Edita thanks those individuals who will be approving this loan since it will be very useful in advancing her business. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance of the vehicle she uses for transporting her products to other cities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for maintenance of the vehicle she uses for transporting her products

loans.name: Aïssata

texts.fr:
Née le 1er Janvier 1963 à N’Gola Kébila, dans la préfecture de Kolondiéba (région de Sikasso), Madame Aïssata M. est mariée, mère de neuf enfants et réside avec sa coépouse, leurs enfants et leur époux, commerçant, à Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame  Aïssata M. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initiée depuis plus de six ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente de fruits (ananas, avocat, banane, banane plantain, orange, etc). Elle mène son activité au niveau des services de Douanes de Sikasso. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ trois ans. Elle a bénéficié de 2 prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement  remboursés. C'est ainsi qu’elle sollicite ce troisième prêt qui lui permettra d’acheter  et de constituer un grand stock de fruits ( ananas, avocat, banane plantain, orange, etc.) en provenance de la Côte d’Ivoire qu’elle revend en détail et en gros à une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce troisième prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 115 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Born on January 1, 1963 in N’Gola Kébila, in the Prefecture of Kolondiéba (the Sikasso region), Mrs. Aïssata M. is married and the mother of nine children. She lives with her husband (who is an entrepreneur), her husband’s second wife and their children in Sanoubougou I-Koulikoro, one of the peripheral districts of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali). Having tried various business activities without success, over six years ago Mrs. Aïssata M. started selling fruits (pineapples, avocados, bananas, plantains, oranges etc). She sells near the Customs’ office in Sikasso. In order to better satisfy the demands of her growing customer base, about three years ago she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She obtained two individual loans in the past and repaid them well. And thus she is seeking a third loan, which will allow her to buy a large supply of fruit (pineapples, avocados, plantains, oranges etc) from Côte d’Ivoire; she sells retail and wholesale to customers coming from all layers of society. With this third loan she plans to achieve a monthly income of 115,000 West African Francs, which will be used to bolster her business capital, contribute to the family budget and pay off the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fruits

loans.name: Tilekberdi

texts.en:
Tilekberdi U. is 36 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Bayan-Ulgiy province in western Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His elder two children attend a local middle school and the youngest son stays at home with his mother. 

Tilekberdi operates a delivery business with his big truck and supplies local customers with coal. He began his business in 2000, and after several years of hard work and saving, he managed to buy his own big vehicle and expand his customer base.  He says, “I worked hard every day to purchase a heavy load truck for my business, which cost about 60,000,000 MNT, in order to improve my family’s quality of life.” 

Tilekberdi is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan for purchasing a trailer for his big truck in order to increase the load turnover and make deliveries to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for his big truck

loans.name: Taupaolo

texts.en:
Taupaolo T., 32 and married with three children ranging in age from one to eight, owns a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. With two years of experience in this business, Taupaolo now needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand her enterprise.

In 2010, Taupaolo joined SPBD, and this is her first loan. SPBD's loans are Taupaolo's only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie B. is forty years old and married. She is from the village of Poblacion within the municipality of Lantapan, a part of Bukidnon province on the Mindanao islands. Josie runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Josie has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Josie joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from HSPFI, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Francis Njoroge

texts.en:
Francis has been making furniture for sale in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 24 years old, married to Maureen Njoroge, and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the cash to buy more lumber for use in furniture making.

Francis hopes to get major tenders from suppliers of furniture in future.

loans.use: To buy more lumber

loans.name: Idalia

texts.es: La Sra. Idalia A. J.  ella es Trabajadora activa del colegio CERMA  desempeñándose como Maestra de Educación Primaria tiene  veinte y ocho años de trabajar como docente, es casa actualmente tiene un hijo en edad escolar. Ha tenido  seis créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción y  mejorar su casa de habitación los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Idalia A. J. is an active employee of the CERMA school as an Elementary School Teacher. She has worked as a teacher for 28 years and currently has a school-aged child living at home. 

She has had six loans with CEPRODEL and each one has been for the purchase of construction materials for improvements to her home. The loans have been extraordinarily helpful to her since they have enabled her to improve her and her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase sand, cement, quarry stone, iron and gravel

loans.name: Agartha Adjoa Boadzi

texts.en: Agartha Adjoa Boadzi O. is married to a mason and has four children. She has received junior high education.  Agartha sells ripe plantains, salt, salted fish and other items at Abura. She assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Agartha is asking to use the loan to buy additional foodstuffs, thus expanding her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agartha plans to build a house.

loans.use: buy additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Paula Karina

texts.es:
Paula de 30 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la ventana de su casa. Vive con sus dos hijos en una casa de caña en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra. 

Hace 5 años atrás comenzó con la tienda pero cuando se separo de su esposo cerro la tienda pero hace ya 11 meses que volvió abrirlo ya que necesitaba dinero para poder mantener a sus hijos. Vende arroz, pollos, bebidas, dulces en su tienda. Trabaja en distintos horarios ya que está en la parte delantera de su casa. 

Para poder seguir con su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, pollos bebidas para convertir su tienda. En el futuro quiere tener su casa de cemento e incrementar su negocio con mercadería.
texts.en:
Paula, who is 30 years old, runs a general store from the window of her house.  She lives with her two children in a house made of sugar cane stalks in El Fortín, a peri-urban area of Guayaquil known for its dirt roads.

She started the store five years ago, but when she separated from her husband, Paula closed it.  Eleven months ago she opened the store again because she needed money to support her children.  She sells rice, chicken, beverages and candies in her store.  Paula works on a varying schedule since the store is in the front part of her house.

Paula wants to use the loan to buy rice, chicken and beverages to stock her store.  In the future she wants to have a cement house and expand her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: Rice, chicken, beverages

loans.name: Imad

texts.ar:
عماد عمره 35 سنة متزوج وله ولد يعمل في الادوات الصحية فهو يعمل من اكثر من  18 سنة في هذه المصلحة وهو يحب عمله كثيرا 
يحب ان يتطور ويعمل بجد ونشاط يحب تحسين وضع عائلته كثيرا وتطويرها يحب ان يحافظ على جودة عمله فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة
الى شراء بضاعة اضافية بجودة عالية لكي يطور من عمله وتجديد البضائع الموجودة لديه زبائنه هم اهل قريته واقاربه يريد دعم عائلته وتحسين محيطه الاجتماعي
والعملي
texts.en: Imad is a 35-year-old husband and father of one who wants to help his family and community advance. Imad has been working for the past eighteen years in the field of bathroom supplies, drawing patronage from his relatives and other fellow villagers. He is very enthusiastic about his work which he wants to further develop. Accordingly, Imad is now seeking a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase new high-quality wares to expand his business and to also upgrade the materials he already has in stock.

loans.use: To purchase materials for bathroom supplies business

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel S. is from the village of Poblacion, Dangcagan, Bukidnon. She is 28 years old. Licel is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Licel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fruits like pineapple, pomelo & bananas in the local community. Licel has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Licel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Licel is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fruits like apples & mangosteen. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Licel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Topurchase fruits to sell

loans.name: Zipora  Wanzila

texts.en:
Zipora Wanzilu K. is 42 years old and the single mother of four school going children .She has been selling clothes in Mlolongo Market and operating rental houses for 10 years. She earns a profit of Kshs 10,000 per month.

She was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by KADET staff, and she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.60, 000 after paying back the previous loan successfully. Zipora plans to use the loan as follows: Kshs. 30,000 to purchase more clothes to sell during the festive season, and Kshs 30,000 to renovate the rental houses.

She will use the extra income generated to open a boutique in Kitengela. She desires to grow her business and own a wholesale shop for clothes in Mlolongo Market Centre in the future. Zipora describes herself as outgoing and ready to grow in business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and renovate rental houses.

loans.name: Samer

texts.ar:
سامر متزوج وله ولدان وهو في عمر 46 سنة يعمل سائق عام له في عمله 12 سنة يحب عمله ويجيده جيدا يريد دائما التجديد
والتطيور في عمله اهله واولاده اولى اهتماماته يريد ان يعلم اولاده بصورة جيدة وان يكون لهم في المجتمع وضع مقبول وجيد
لقد ساعده القرض القديم من المجموعة بشكل جيد حيث استطاع ان يشتري فان خاص له والان يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة
الى صيانة الفان وتحسين وضع الموتور والفرش حتى يستطيع في مواسم السياحة من استقبال زبائن سواح يحب عمله ويريد مستقبل جيد
له ولعائلته
texts.en: Samer is a 46-year-old husband and father of two who is keen to provide his children with a good education and allow them to achieve a respectable social status. For the past twelve years, Samer has been driving a tai, which he excels at and enjoys very much. His last loan from Al Majmoua helped him procure his own van. Now, Samer wants to ask for another loan to have maintenance performed on the van’s motor and to have the upholstery redone so that the van can be in a good condition to ferry tourists around.

loans.use: To perform maintenance on van's motor and to change the upholstery

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ar:
احمد في عمر 34 سنة متزوج وله 3 اولاد يعمل في مطعم لبيع الدجاج له في عمله 10 سنوات يحب عمله عائلته كل
اهتمامه يريد لها التطور والاستمرار في ظروف الحياة الصعبة طموح متميز في عمله يتميز بالنظافة والدقة في العمل
له زبائن من محيط ضيعته وجيرانه ومحبيه يريد من خلال طلب قرض من المجموعة الى تطوير المصلحة وتحسين الوضع المادي له
texts.en: Ahmed is 34 years old and married with three children. He works in a restaurant selling chicken and has 10 years experience in this. He loves his work and is ambitious. His family is important to him and he wants to improve their situation and provide them with stability in difficult circumstances. He is strictly hygienic in his work and is precise. His customers include his neighbors and friends. With the requested loan from A.-Majmoua he wants to develop his business and improve his financiA. situation.

loans.use: To gain more capital to invest in the development of his business

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline K. is married and has a seven-year-old child. Her husband owns a transportation business, and the young couple is very committed to provide its child with a quality education through the university level. She makes a living by running a general store in the Shinyalu market in the west Kenya town of Kakamega, where she sells sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour, utensils and other items to people who live nearby. She has been in this business for five years and is doing well despite financial constraints. She has applied for a loan for Kes 20,000 to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. She hopes to expand her store into a large supermarket in future. Everline describes herself as hard working, humble, friendly and honest.

loans.use: To buy food items and utensils to sell to her customers

loans.name: Acléo

texts.fr: Acléo M. est journaliste de la radio locale en ville de Kigali, il est né au Rwanda. Il a 33 ans et est célibataire. Il un diplôme de niveau licence en journalisme. Il est client d’ACB depuis 2010. Il besoin d’un prêt pour l’ordinateur portable (laptop) pour utiliser dans sa carrière de journalisme, ses ambitions sont de travailler à la hâte pour augmenter sa professionnalisme,  sa stratégie pour a croissance de l’affaires et d’augmenter pouvoir rédiger les informations de façon facile, enfin il veut chercher construire sa maison et pouvoir se marier.
texts.en: Acléo M. is a journalist at the local radio station in the city of Kigali. He is 33 years old and unmarried. He has a certificate in journalism. He has been a client of ACB since 2010. Acléo needs a loan for a laptop computer for use in his journalism career. His ambition is to work urgently to increase his professionalism. His strategy for growth is to have an easy way to write his material. Ultimately, he wants to build a house and to be able to get married.

loans.use: Buying a laptop

loans.name: Esneda

texts.es:
que por la falta de oportunidades laborales en el campo de donde es oriunda, se vio en la necesidad de emigrara hacia Medellín para buscar fuente de ingresos que le permitieran mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. 

Al lado de su esposo, sin conocer la ciudad y sin saber en qué trabajar, Esneda decidió convertirse en vendedora en el centro de la ciudad, allí se instaló con su puesto de frutas y empezó a laborar independiente para ganarse la vida. 

Actualmente, Esneda necesita de un préstamo para comprar productos para la venta, así podrá incrementar sus ventas y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Esneda, for lack of labor opportunities in the rural area she comes from, saw the necessity of emigrating towards Medellin, to look for a source of income that would permit her to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Beside her husband, without knowing the city and without knowing what to work at, Esneda decided to become a vender in the city center.  Here she installed herself, with her post of fruits and began to work independently in order to earn her living.

Now, Esneda needs a loan to buy products to sell, in hopes of increasing her sales and augmenting her earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY PRODUCTS TO SELL

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth A. Arévalo, Con su primer credikiva compró artículos D. papelería como cartulinas, cuadernos, lápices, artículos D. belleza como polvos y cosméticos; con su nuevo credikiva al que está ahora aplicando, comprará con una parte un congelador D. 500 botellas todo con el fin D. aprovechar su clientela y generar mas ingresos por productos como los refrescos que le gustan a sus clientes, así mismo el resto lo invertirá en artículos D. aseo e higiene personal para la venta.
Estas fueron  las palabras con las que despidió a su asesora cuando la visitó: dígale mis financiadores que estoy agradecida por el préstamo que me hicieron y espero quedarles bien como con este,  para que me sigan apoyando y D. esta manera logrando satisfacción mutua y recomendaré a nuevos clientes”. Si usted quiere leer la historia D. Elizabeth A. pueD. acceder al siguiente enlace:http://kiva.org/lend/178033
texts.en: Elizabeth A. Arévalo used her first Kiva loan to buy stationery products such as card, exercise books and pencils, and beauty products such as powders and cosmetics.  She will use part of the new Kiva loan that she is currently applying for to buy a 500-bottle chiller cabinet in order to make more income selling products such as soft drinks that her customers like.  She will invest the rest in buying toiletries and personal care products to sell.  These were the words she said to her advisor when she was leaving after having visited her "Tell my financial backers that I am grateful for the loan they gave me and I hope to please them through this loan as well, so that they continue supporting me.  In this way, we will all be happy and I will recommend new clients".  If you would like to read Elizabeth A.'s story, you can access it here: http://kiva.org/lend/178033

loans.use: to buy a chiller cabinet and merchandise

loans.name: Maria Liza

texts.en:
Maria Liza E. is from the village of Bugang, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Maria Liza is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Liza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk food, beverages, biscuits, shampoo, soap & bread in the local community. Maria Liza has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Maria Liza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Liza is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods & junk food. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Maria Liza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.
