Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk food

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 36-year-old married man living in Bint Jbeil with his wife and four kids. Since 1990, he has owned farm tractors that he rents to farmers to prepare their lands for each new planting season. 

Rabih  has 26 years of experience. He was too young when he started working, but he was expected to work early because his parents' financial situation was too hard to manage their living without his contribution. Rabih is a man with good reputation, especially in his proficiency at work. 

Rabih is requesting a loan from Al Mjamoua in order to buy a six-wheel, which he believes will increase his income through being able to transport materials and products from one place to another. Rabih has been an Al Majmoua borrower since 2009, and his previous loans had a big effect on his ability to grow his business. 

He would like to expand his business more in the future, and works hard to give his kids the best childhood ever, the one he couldn’t have.

loans.use: to buy a six-wheel vehicle

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto de profesión fontanero con más de veintisiete años laborando para la misma empresa, el cual ha logrado estabilidad laborar como económica para el bienestar común de la familia.
Hoy en día cuenta con el apoyo económico de su señora esposa ya que es comerciante y ambos apoyan a sus tres hijos, todos estudiantes.
Logro mejoras a su vivienda con financiamiento en Afodenic en donde lleva tres ciclos lo cual ha cambiado techo, y otros cambios. Hoy con este nuevo préstamo reparara paredes interna de la vivienda para una mejor construcción de infraestructura. Comprando: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra.
texts.en:
Humberto is a plumber by profession and has worked for over 27 years in the same company.  This economic stability has provided quality of life for his family.

He also receives economic support from his wife who is a merchant and both support their three children who are students.  With loans from Afodenic he has been able to make home improvements.  During those three loan terms he was able to change the roof and carry out other modifications.  With the new loan he plans to repair the inside walls of the house to improve its infrastructure.  He will buy blocks, sand, cement, and iron to begin construction.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the inside walls of his house.

loans.name: Kosal

texts.en:
Kosal, 47, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Kosal is a farmer, earning an income of $0.63 US per day to help cover the family's expenses. Her husband produces fishing tools to sell, earning an income of $3 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $100 on food and $25 on the other necessary expenses. 

Kosal is requesting a loan of $1000 to expand her brother's business by selling and purchasing gold and platinum. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner. Her husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to expand her brother's business of gold and platinum purchase and sales

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is married and has five dependants. Her husband is a fisherman.

For the past twenty years, Efua has been living on the income made from the sale of smoked fish. She responsibly assists her husband in the general upkeep of the home. Her loan of 600 GHS will be used to buy additional fresh fish to smoke and so improve her business.

She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her dependents.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to smoke.

loans.name: Nakyanzi

texts.en:
Nakyanzi is a 40 year old single lady with three children. She has been running her salon and cosmetics shop for the past fourteen years. She earns a monthly income of about KES 12,000 which she uses to take care of her family.

She has borrowed KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is her second loan from KADET. She intends to use her loan to purchase more stock of items like cosmetics, chemicals and weaves and also to open another salon in another area.

She plans to use the profit from her business to open up another branch and buy another dryer. In the future, she hopes to have several salons from Mulolongo, Athi River and Kitengela.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like cosmetics and chemicals and to open another salon.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Amer has owned a farm for raising calves and cows since 1987. He has much experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to make a ceiling and to buy a water pump and generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To make a ceiling and to buy a water pump and generator.

loans.name: Nataly

texts.en:
Nataly is 25 years old and lives with her partner and her young daughter. Her occupation is selling corn. Nataly sells corn to various clients around the city of Cusco. 

She is asking for a loan in order to further invest in her business. She plans to purchase more corn in hope that she can acquire more clients and therefore, make a greater amount of profits. 

Nataly is a hardworking woman and is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more corn to sell.

loans.name: Tension Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Tension” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Yeabu. Yeabu is 38 years old and was born in Mafukia, a village in northern Sierra Leone. Yeabu is married to a teacher and the couple has 4 children – 2 in secondary school and 2 in primary school. Yeabu has been a businesswoman selling fish for 12 years now. With her share of this loan, Yeabu is going to buy a large quantity of fish to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of fish to add to her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines. She also earns income from a carenderia (local eatery) and her sari-sari store. In business for eight years, she is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment and to pay for labor on her tricycle sidecar.

Edna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her enterprises to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment and pay for labor on her tricycle sidecar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plant passion fruit.

loans.name: Manar

texts.en:
Manar is a 25-year-old young woman. She is married and her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. In addition, he works as a driver for the taxi the family owns. Manar wants to change the taxi engine motor to let it work more efficiently and increase the family income. She also wants to purchase some home appliances she needs such as a refrigerator, gas, etc, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for these expenses so she needs to take a loan of $2,386.67 from FATEN. When Manar takes the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to change the taxi engine motor to a new one, which enables her husband to work extra hours and increase the family income. Manar will also purchase the home appliances she needs and that will improve her life and she will be able to live with her family in better conditions. Manar is a conservative woman so her husband is photographed instead next to the taxi the family owns.


About this loan product:
 FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To replace the taxi motor and purchase home appliances

loans.name: Mirzosharif

texts.ru: Мирзошариф проживает в районе Яван. Ему 59 лет. Он женат. У него семеро детей. Один из его сыновей находится на заработках заграницей. Сам Мирзошариф предоставляет услугу, занимается развозкой на своем грузовом автомобиле. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже семь лет. Кредит берет для ремонта грузового автомобиля.
texts.en: Mirzosharif lives in the Yavan district.  He is 59 years old, married and has seven children.  One of his sons is working abroad.  Mirzosharif provides a service; he is involved in transportation, using his truck.  He has been in this business for seven years.  Mirzosharif is requesting this loan to make repairs to his truck.

loans.use: to make repairs to his truck

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: Amelia, de 20 años habita en el centro poblado Unión Autiki. Ahí conformó su familia desde hace 3 años, producto de su amor nacieron sus 2 hermosas hijas: Lucero y Esther a las que cuida en su casa propia. Su principal actividad económica es “la agricultura”. Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano se levanta a cuidar de sus sembríos de café y plátanos, los cuales vende en cada cosecha al mercado de la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde obtiene buenas ganancias. Cuenta que en todo este tiempo pudo obtener, gracias a su esfuerzo y perseverancia, 2 terrenos productivos propios. Se siente feliz, por ello; pero como madre responsable, espera aumentar sus ganancias con la siembra de más productos y en mayores cantidades. Aunque los bajos precios en el mercado la desaniman, pero sabe que si tiene frutos de calidad, podrá también obtener un mayor precio en la compra de sus frutos maduros. Por eso trabajará con ahínco para lograr ese objetivo. Además quiere brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación, ya que el próximo año comenzarán a estudiar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Mujeres Unidas” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera del apoyo de todos ustedes para continuar con sus objetivos. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Amelia de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas para la limpieza de sus cultivos y mil plantitas de café para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Amelia, 20, lives in the town of Unión Autiki.  Here she formed her family 3 years ago, and through her relationship she has given birth to 2 beautiful daughters, Lucero and Esther, whom she cares for in her own home.  Her main economic activity is farming.  Every morning she gets up very early to care for her coffee and banana crops.  At harvest time she sells these crops in the market in the city of Pichanaki, where she gets good profits.  She says that over time, and thanks to her efforts and perseverance, she has been able to acquire 2 plots of productive farmland.  She is very happy about this, but as a responsible mother, she wants to further increase her earnings by planting more products in greater volume.  Although the low prices in the market are discouraging, she knows that if she has good quality products, she will be able to get the best prices when she sells her mature crops. For this reason she will work vigorously to achieve this objective.  In addition, she wants to provide her children with a good education, since next year they will start school.  Amelia belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Unidas," and this is her first loan with MFP, where she awaits the support of all of you so that she can continue to work toward her goals.  In addition, she promises to make her payments on time.   Once Amelia receives your support, she will invest the sums requested in the purchase of tools to clear her lands, and a thousand coffee seedlings to start her next crop cycle.

loans.use: to buy tools to clear her lands, and a thousand coffee seedlings

loans.name: Daniel Ezequiel

texts.es: El señor Daniel, es un pequeño agricultor de la zona de Ticuantepe, el habita junto a su esposa e hijos ya todos independientes, los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus nietos en sus estudios para que sean personas de bien y a la vez mejorar la vivienda ya que en tiempo de invierno se le pasa el agua, don Daniel desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que no cuenta con los recueros económicos necesarios para comprar fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para mantener el cultivo ; ya que este presenta una coloración no muy adecuada y la fruta para su edad está mal desarrollada , lo cual para él es de mucha importancia aplicar los insumos necesarios para rescatar la producción .Agradece la confianza que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de los fondo Kiva ya que si ellos no fuese posible cultivar frutos sanos , frescos y sobre todo con su sabor natural .
texts.en:
Daniel is a small farmer in the Ticuantepe zone. He lives with his wife and children who are all independent.  His plan for the future is to support his grandchildren’s schooling so that they will become upstanding citizens and also to make some home improvements because during the winter water leaks in.

Daniel has been a pineapple farmer for several years.  The main problem he faces is not having the necessary economic resources to buy fertilizer and needed farm supplies to care for the crops leading to their having poor color and fruit that is underdeveloped for its age.  It is, therefore, very important for him to be able to apply the necessary farm supplies to rescue his production.
  
He is grateful for the trust Afodenic places in him through the Kiva fund because without them it would not be possible to produce healthy, fresh and, above all, natural tasting fruit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
La señora Alba  se dedica a la artesanía y a tejer manteles desde hace cuatro años  le gusta tejer y dibujar  en las mantas.
Tiene la cantidad de  dos hijos una mujer   y un varón  Alma Yosaleth  de tres años de edad y  Ángel Martín de  cinco años de edad.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Martín de  treinta y ocho años de edad  a quien quiere  y agradece todo el apoyo que le ha dado.
Uno de sus sueños es  tener un local donde pueda exhibir su mercancía    y vender telas  para poder obtener más ganancias.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar más mercancía para  hacer ropa típica: hilos, aros, manda  de color y agujas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha  dado para  seguir creciendo como mujer y como artesana.
texts.en:
Alba has been making crafts and weaving cloth for four years. She likes to knit and draw on the cloth. She has two children, one daughter and one son-- Alma Yosaleth who is three years old and Ángel Martín who is five years old. 

She is happily married to Martín who is 38 years old and who she thanks for all the support he has given her. One of her dreams is to have a local shop where she can display her merchandise and sell fabric to earn more money. 

She has asked for a loan to buy more merchandise to make traditional clothing: threads, wires, hoops, needles and colored handles. She thanks the foundation for the support they’ve given her to continue growing as a woman and as an artist.

loans.use: thread, fabric, rings, and needles to make traditional clothes

loans.name: Angeli

texts.en:
This is Angeli, 29, resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband Ricky is a baker. She is the mother of only child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income to cover their everyday expenses.

Angeli operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Aside from this, she also operates a bakery alomg with her store. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She makes a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Angeli hopes her business grows so she can add another branch. She also hopes to give her child a high-quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a seamstress, and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She earns reasonably good profits every month. She started this business a few years ago because her husband’s income was not enough to fulfill the needs of the whole family. Shahnaz has given birth to three daughters and three sons; five of them are studying while her elder son left his education after 6th grade, and started a scrap selling business.

He is in the process of establishing his business, and Shahnaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to help him. With the loan he will buy scrap in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill his clients' requirements and increase his profits.

Shahnaz is hopeful that an investment will help her son in his business, and he will be able to run it better.


Note: "In the picture, the lady who has passbook (called Asasah passbook) in her hand is Shahnaz."

loans.use: to buy scrap for scrap selling business.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 25 years old and single.  He resides in Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Stephen is operating a livestock business, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for 3 years. Each month, he earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of business.

Stephen requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. He has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, he wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sara Martha

texts.es:
Sara Martha tiene 19 años de edad es casada tiene un hijo, vive con el esposo y con lel hijo de 1 año de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Sara se dedica a la agricultura, crianza de animales, siembra de maíz, papas, trigo, cebada en terrenos al partido, vive en casa de los suegros.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz comprar abonos agrícolas, urea. Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá mejorar la producción y los ingresos económicos.
El sueño es poder comprar terreno, construir una casa.
Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es las plagas y enfermedades en los cultivos. En el tiempo libre le gusta salir a pasear, disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y San Pedro.

Con la ayuda del préstamo anterior pudo mejorar el estilo de vida de la familia, los ingresos y la producción han aumentado en buena cantidad.
texts.en:
Sara Martha is 19, married, and has a one-year-old child. They live together in the Guaranda province of Bolívar.
She is a member of the Ventanal communal bank in the Guantuncoto community, in the Julio Moreno parish, Guaranda canton. They are located 30 minutes from the Los Habitantes de la Comunidad office. The members work in various areas, such as: agriculture, livestock, raising animals (hogs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.
Sara works in agriculture, raising animals and sowing corn, potatoes, wheat, and barley. She lives in the home of her parents-in-law.
She makes her purchases and sales in Guaranda. She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and for purchasing fertilizers and urea. With the help of this loan, she will be able to improve her production and her income.
Her dream is to be able to buy a plot of land and build a house.
Pests and plagues are challenges for her as a farmer. In her free time she likes to go out for walks and enjoy the carnivals and the San Pedro festival.
With the help of her previous loan she was able to improve her family's lifestyle. Her income and production have improved nicely.

loans.use: to plant corn and to buy fertilizers and urea; with the help of this loan she will be able to improve her production and income.

loans.name: Suat

texts.en: Suat, a 38-year-old married woman with six children, four of whom are in school, has had a business selling charcoal in Yei South Sudan for five years. Suat is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal, and she will use the resulting extra income to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Paula Cristina

texts.es: Paula Cristina es una joven emprendedora y luchadora que con sus 25 años de edad tiene su propio taller de confección y vende su propia línea de ropa. Con la ayuda de su pareja a construido un hogar con 2 hijos a los cuales les quiere brindar la mejor educación posible. Paula Cristina sueña con que su marca crezca y se posicione en el mercado, por lo que requiere de la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus prendas. Busca dejarles un gran legado a sus dos hijos con una estabilidad económica y grandes oportunidades de progreso.
texts.en:
Paula Cristina is a young, tenacious entrepreneur who at the age of 25 has her own clothes making workshop and sells her own line of clothing.  With help from her spouse she’s built a home for her two children that she wants to provide the best possible education for.

Paula Cristina dreams with her brand growing and becoming positioned in the marketplace.  To do so, she needs to buy raw materials to make her clothing.  She aims to leave a legacy to her two children of economic stability and great opportunities for progress.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Bienvenidos A Pilcopata Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Bienvenidos a Pilcopata” en el centro poblado de Pilcopata en el distrito Kosñipata en la provincia de Paucartambo en el departamento del Cusco. 

Rene Mateo tiene 34 años de edad es casado y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene una hermosa familia, él y su familia viven en la hermosa ciudad de Pilcopata.  

Rene Mateo es un joven trabajador que desde muy niño aprendió de sus padres la agricultura y la venta y compra de madera,  él es una persona carismática y amable que sale adelante con el apoyo de su pareja, él en sus horas libres se a otras actividades entonces él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera de la selva de Pilcopata para luego venderlo en la ciudad del Cusco.   
 
Este banco comunal está conformado por varias personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Los socios se dedican a la agricultura, a la gansería, al engorde de ganado, a la venta y compra de madera. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.(Las personas que aparecen en la inferior de la fotografia llegaron tarde a la reunion).
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the Communal Bank “Bienvenidos a Pilcopata” (Welcome to Pilcopata) which is located in the central village of Pilcopata in the District of Kosñipata, Paucartambo Province, Department of Cusco.

Rene Mateo is 34 years old, married, and has a beautiful relationship with his lovely family.  He and his family live in the gorgeous city of Pilcopata.  Rene Mateo is a hardworking young man who learned as a boy how to farm from his parents.  He also buys and sells wood.  Rene Mateo is a charismatic and friendly individual who is able to move forward with the support of his partner.  During his free time, he engages in other activities.  He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy wood from the jungle of Pilcopata that he can eventually sell in the city of Cusco.  

This Communal Bank consists of several people who look at each moment as an opportunity to get ahead.  Through their efforts, they are able to provide a better future for their children.  The members engage in farming, raising geese, fattening cattle, and buying and selling wood.  

The members are grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promise to complete their payments according to the established terms.  (The individuals who appear in the smaller photo arrived late to the meeting.)

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Lira region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, all of whom are currently in school. 

For the past 8 years, Richard has been working hard to manage his retail shop, from which he sells posho (a type of cornmeal porridge), beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, and salt. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. Richard will use the loan to buy more inventory for his shop, and it will help Richard to generate greater profits and increase his capital. 

In the future Richard hopes to grow his business. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his shop like posho, beans, sugar, rice, bread, curry powder, and salt.

loans.name: Narcizo

texts.es:
Narcizo con 48 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus cinco hijos, en el distrito de Pomahuaca,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, de variedad Catimor de 04 y 05 años de edad, con una experiencia en el rubro de 05 años. Adicionalmente se desempeña como peón agrícola así mismo a la cría de ganado vacuno. Solicita préstamo para gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de café.De esta manera podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida.

Narcizo es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su segundo crédito.

loans.use: para gastos de abono y mantenimiento de su finca de café

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is married with 12 children. He is retired driver with one of the local sugar companies. The loan of $450 is to provide him with working capital to operate a Jaggery in his home village of Myanga. In addition to using cane from his farm, the jaggery will also buy cane from other local farmers providing the farmers with an alternative market for their  cane other than the large sugar company which sometimes take a long time before paying them. The mill employs 5 youths, full time and some of his children when they are not in school. The jaggery will bring benefit to the community in general in addition to being a source of livelihood for his family.

loans.use: Jaggery

loans.name: Nkem

texts.en: Mrs. Nkem I. is a 38-year-old woman who sells rubber plastic to people. She is married with two (2) children. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the loan to expand her business. With the loan, she will buy more rubber plastic items to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rubber plastics for sale

loans.name: Dunia Maria

texts.en:
I've been running my business of making and selling tortillas for the past three and a half years. I have two school-age kids. With the profits I make I am able to provide for them and keep them in school, and in my country there is a job shortage. My best customers are my neighbors and other people in my community.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Mi negocio es la elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 3 años y medio. tengo dos hijos en la edad de esolar, con la venta que hago los ayudo para que ternimen su año escolar, ya que aqui en mi pais hay escases de trabajo. mis mejores clientes son son mis vecinos y otras personas de la comunidad.

loans.use: Purchasem corn, lime, firewood and water.

loans.name: Noelia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Noelia is married and has two young children who are studying at the primary school level. Her husband works as an employee in a refinery. She began her business to help him with the family income. Two years ago Noelia began selling food in her home, and little by little she has progressed to where she now has her own little kitchen and place to sell her food. Thanks to the growth of her sales, her sister now helps her with the business. She desires to continue growing and make hiring two employees her next goal. She has learned a lot about business and has made her plans to grow; she knows that she is going to achieve her goals.

Noelia is requesting a loan for $925 so she can buy cooking utensils, which will allow her to prepare her meals in a more efficient manner, and enlarge her kitchen. With this loan, she will be able to complete all her orders and also continue growing. She is offering to pay back the loan in six months. She and her family greatly appreciate your support that helps Noelia reach her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Noelia está casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños que se encuentran estudiando en la primaria. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una refinería y ella empezó con su negocio para ayudar a su esposo con la economía familiar. Noelia empezó hace dos años vendiendo comida en su casa y poco a poco ha ido creciendo hasta ahora tener un pequeño local, gracias al incremento de sus ventas ahora su hermana la ayuda en el negocio. Ella desea continuar creciendo y tiene como meta contratar dos empleados ya que ha aprendido mucho del negocio y ha hecho sus proyecciones para crecer y sabe que lo va a lograr.

Noelia está solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para comprar utensilios de cocina que le permitan avanzar con sus comidas de manera más eficiente y para ampliar su local, con lo que podrá cumplir con todos sus pedidos y a la vez continuar con su crecimiento, ella ofrece pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia te agradecen mucho tu apoyo para que pueda cumplir sus metas.

loans.use: Buy cooking utensils and remodel

loans.name: Jesús Teresa

texts.es:
Until a while ago, things were difficult for Teresa and life was full of suffering. The person who became her husband and with whom she hoped to form a household that would be stable and full of love instead mistreated her, both physically and psychologically, in the presence of their children.

When she decided to end this treatment, she looked for help and left to establish herself in another town far from her hometown of Pucallpa. Little by little, and with a lot of work, Teresa’s children regained the peace and happiness that their father had taken from them for such a long time.

Because of her tireless fighting spirit, she began a small business in her home, and she never imagined it would become so popular, due to the incomparable service that she offers. Since the population is always growing from families moving into the neighborhood, the demand for the basic goods she sells at her store is also growing. She wants to increase the number of products that she has to offer, so she is requesting a loan of $275.00, which she is committed to repaying in 6 months. Let’s help her continue fighting to keep her family together and to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Para Doña Teresa las cosas hasta hace un tiempo fueron duras y de constante sufrimiento, la persona que se convertiría en su esposo y con el que deseaba formar un hogar estable y lleno de amor, siempre la maltrató física y psicológicamente en presencia de sus hijos durante mucho tiempo. Cuando ella decidió terminar con estos actos buscó ayuda y se marchó para establecerse en otra ciudad muy lejos de su natal Pucallpa; poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo los hijos de Teresa fueron recobrando la calma y felicidad que hace mucho tiempo les arrebató el hombre que les dio la vida. El incansable espíritu luchador la hizo emprender un pequeño negocio en el interior de la vivienda que habitaba; y jamás se imaginó que con el tiempo se convertiría en una de las más concurridas por el incomparable servicio que les ofrece. Y como la población se va imcrementando cada vez más porque se establecen más familias en las zonas aledañas mayor es la demanda por los artículos de primera necesidad que ofrece en su pequeña tienda Teresa. Con el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de productos que ofrece hasta la fecha ella solicita un préstamo de 275 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses. Hagamos que ese espíritu siga luchando por mantener a su familia unida con el cumplimiento de su anhelo.

loans.use: To buy a more varied stock for her small general store

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 40 years old. She is marred and has three children. Her husband is unemployed. She works at her house, which is rented, and she is responsible for all of her family's expenses. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric to make new clothes to sell. She also wants to paint the shop and renovate it in order to increase her income and develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Seab

texts.en:
Mrs. V. Seab, 36, and her husband, Lon Charoeun, have been married since 1989.  They have five children, three sons and two daughters. Seab has been a fish seller since 2002. Her husband is a fisherman. He fishes in the Mekong River for Seab, who sells around the village using her motorbike. Her oldest daughter is weaving silk at home; two of her children are studying in the local school; and the other two are still young and stay at home.   

Seab is requesting her first loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $250.  She will use this loan to purchase silk materials for her daughter’s weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving

loans.name: Haneefa's Group

texts.en: I am Haneefa B., and I live in a small semi-urban town, called Kot Radha Kishan in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of two: one boy and one girl. My son is in grade seven and my daughter is in grade five. My husband works at a local factory. I sell milk from my house and now I want to buy an additional cow for my business. I have a few group members in my loan group: Reshma B. and Asiah B. need loans to buy cows; and Anofi B. wants a loan to pay off the remaining installments of the cow. All of these women are very hard working entrepreneurs and we are responsible for each other's loans.

loans.use: Buy an additional cow

loans.name: Leonid

texts.en:
Leonid has a small enterprise which allows him to combine his love of cars and driving with business. He travels around to small villages in the Zaporoshye Oblast in central Ukraine and operates a vending business where he sells a variety of small items such as tools, small parts, school supplies and office supplies. Leonid got into this type of business recognizing that the retail industry in many small villages was underdeveloped and he could meet a need. He is good about determining what items will be in demand depending on the season and adjusts his inventory accordingly. Leonid’s wife also helps him with the business. They have two grown children.

Leonid has requested a loan to add to his working capital before the upcoming season change. The loan will allow him to be prepared with new inventory for the spring season and also help ensure that his car is in good working order. Leonid is a jolly, honest entrepreneur. We are happy for this opportunity to help him maintain a successful business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase metals and aluminum products for a small store.

loans.name: Marilu's Group

texts.es:
Raquel, Doris, and Marilu have been members of “Banco Comunal Guadalupe” for 6 months.

Raquel is a single mother, she is 26 years old and has a 4 year-old son. She sells cosmetics from catalogues and she also helps out from time to time at her aunt’s store. Doris lives with a partner, she is 28 years old and has 2 children. She owns a store where she has been selling groceries and vegetables for the past 6 months. Marilu lives with a partner, she is 37 years old and has 4 children. Together with her husband she sells jackets and leather shoes. Their products are bought at the town of Puno and Lima and sold in stores and institutions at the town of Ayucucho. They also own a shoe repair workshop.

Raquel, Doris, and Marilu need loans of 600 soles, 1000 soles, and 1000 soles to invest in the purchase of cream, perfume, talc, shampoo, cologne, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, salt, tuna fish, jackets, shoes, and material for the shoe repair. It is their dream to make their businesses grow, to increase stock, that their children become professionals and to own a shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Raquel, Doris y Marilu pertenecen al Banco Comunal Guadalupe hace 6 meses.

Raquel es madre soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo de 4 años, Raquel vende cosméticos por catálogos. Además Raquel en algunas ocasiones ayuda en la tienda de su tía. Por otro lado Doris es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Doris tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, actividad que realiza hace 6 meses. Mientras que Marilu es conviviente, tiene 37 años y 4 hijos, Marilu junto a su esposo venden casacas y zapatos de cuero, sus productos son adquiridos de la ciudad de Puno y Lima y son vendidos a tiendas, instituciones de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además junto a su esposo tienen una renovadora de calzados.

Raquel, Doris y Marilu necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 1000 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cremas, perfumes, talcos, champú, colonias, azúcar, fideo, aceite, sal, atún, casacas, zapatos y materiales para su renovadora. Los sueños de Raquel, Doris y Marilu son salir adelante con su negocio, surtir su negocio, que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener una tienda de calzados.

loans.use: Raquel, Doris, and Marilu need loans of 600, 1000, and 1000 soles to purchase cream, perfume, talc, shampoo, cologne, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, salt, tuna fish, jackets, shoes, and material for shoe repair.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Rolando could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of his clients. That is to say that he was able to buy everything in time, finishing his crop as expected and marketing all his product.

Development of Business:

The 3 hectares that he possesses have permitted him to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but related products, as for example corn. Seventeen years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of his products.

Personal information:

Rolando is 27 years old. He is married. He has 2 small children, of which only the oldest studies, who is 7 years old. His dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of his aspirations is to give a better education to his children.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan he will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of his location is that it is in the high part of this coastal region.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11775

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Rolando pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 3 hectáreas que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. 17 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Rolando tiene 27 años. Es unido. Tiene 2 hijos pequeños, de los cuales solo el mayor de 7 años estudia. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=11775

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment and other necessary supplies, rent machinery and contract labor to plant a winter crop.

loans.name: Sautaua

texts.en: Sautaua I., 48, is married with 3 children.  She has many years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the villagers 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Sautaua’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Her husband works for Sping Water Company, and her three children are schooling in town.

loans.use: purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Mr. Voeurn V. is a motorcycle taxi driver; his wife raises pigs. They live in Trapeang Thnal Village, Siem Reap Province. Mr. V. drives his motorcycle taxi around Siem Reap City and he makes about $4 per day. Because of the competitive market,  he tries to retain and increase his customer base. Now he is asking for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle to attract customers. He plans to use the remainder of the loan to purchase more pigs for his wife to raise.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to attract customers

loans.name: Valeryi

texts.en:
Valeryi is married with two children: a 12-year-old son and a 14-year-old daughter. He sells audio and video devices, CDs, DVDs, video games, play stations, etc. in his little open kiosk in Znamenka. Valeryi has an individual approach to each client and sometimes does special deliveries of his clients' requests. He has been in the trade for two and a half years. He isn't challenged by high competition as there are very few other entrepreneurs who are working in this sphere of business. Presently, Valeryi has about $5000 in merchandise. His profit is about $600 a month.

Valeryi has been dreaming about a covered kiosk where he could store all his inventory and keep it unharmed. He believes a loan of 3000 Grivnas ($650 USD) will help him buy construction supplies to build such a kiosk and protect his products from the damaging effects of the climate in Ukraine. Moreover, a covered kiosk will help him work each day and be less dependent on weather forecasts. We believe this client will reach all his goals and repay the current loan without any problems.

Note: this is a short term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to build a vending kiosk

loans.name: Zahra's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Zahra is 30 years old. She is divorced with two children, aged eleven and four years old. Since 2005, Zahra has been selling firewood and charcoal. She works daily and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Zahra is requesting a loan of $525 to buy more charcoal and firewood to sell. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Salma and Mtumwa, who have their own businesses selling charcoal, bread, and clothing.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Doem

texts.en: Mrs. Doem S. is a villager in Prey Sak Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is a thatch maker who sews palm leaves together to process into thatch. Her husband, Mr. Morn Chamnab, tows a cart with his motorbike in order to transport passengers for an income. Even though Mrs. S. and her husband have different businesses, they still live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve their standard of living, Mrs. S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house for her family to live in better conditions. Mrs. S. is 28 years old and the mother of one child who is too young to go to school.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 45 años, vive al lado de sus hijos Miguel Ángel de 24, Tania de 21 y Katherine de 6, los cuales son estudiantes. Empieza su rutina diaria a las 8 de la mañana aproximadamente y termina hasta que se oculta el sol, trabaja mucho para lograr buenos ingresos económicos para su familia. Su pequeño puesto está ubicado en uno de los mercados de la ciudad de Juliaca, ofrece artefactos electrodomésticos como DVDs , televisores, radios, etc., se viene dedicando a este negocio desde hace 8 años, gustándole mucho su trabajo y no encontrándole mayor problema en realizarlo. Delia quiere que sus hijos sean los mejores en los estudios, ya que de eso dependerá su futuro económico. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más artefactos y arreglará su stand para brindar una mejor acogida a los clientes. En el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda muy grande de venta de artefactos electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Delia is 45 years old and she lives with her children Miguel Angel (24 years old), Tania (aged 21 years old), and Katherine (aged 6 years old). They are all attending school. She starts her daily routine at 8 a.m. and she works until sundown. She works hard to earn enough money for her family. Her little stand is located in one of the markets in the city of Juliaca. She sells home electronics such as DVDs, TVs, radios etc. She has been running this business for the past 8 years. She loves her work and she finds no real difficulties in running the business. Delia wants for her children to be the best in their studies, especially because this will dictate their financial future. With the funds that she is requesting she will purchase more products and she will remodel her stand to provide a more inviting experience for her clients. In the future she would like to have a larger store to sell even more home electronics.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase electronics for resall to increase her earnings.

loans.name: Francisca Xavier Macuacua

texts.pt:
Francisca Xavier M. é natural da cidade de Maputo bairro Chamanculo, tem 32 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de três filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 10 anos e estuda na 6ªclasse, o segundo com 8 anos de idade e estudava na 3ªclasse e passou para 4ªclasse e o terceiro tem 5 anos e não estuda. Para alem dos filhos sustenta a sua mãe e um irmão enviando-os dinheiro mensalmente.

Francisca estudou até 9ªclasse e parou por ter se engravidada e pois parto começou o negocio para sustentar ao seu filho porque o pai não trabalhava e pelo tipo de negocio que lhe obriga andar muito pelas comunidades rurais a comprar os cabritos não conseguiu continuar com os estudos.

Francisca é negociante desde 1998, compra e vende caprinos, compra por 350,00mt e vende por 600,00mt; compra por 450,00mt e vende por 750,00mt e compra por 550,00mt e vende por 950,00mt. Assim tem um rendimento mensal de 12500,00mt e consegue poupar 2500,00mt por mês.

Para Francisca este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque para melhor responder a quadra festiva do fim do ano. Assim sonha em comprar um contentor afim de usar como um local fixo de venda deste animais.
texts.en:
Francisca Xavier M. is from the city of Maputo, neighborhood of Chamanculo, she is 32 years old, married with 3 children, who are 10, 8 and 5 years old. Besides her kids, she also supports her mother and brother sending them money monthly. Francisca didn’t finish school as she got pregnant and started a business after she gave birth because the father of her child didn’t work. She has to travel around communities in the interior in order to buy the goats, so she couldn’t keep studying. Francisca works buying and selling goats for profit since 1998. She gets a monthly profit of approximately 12500.00mt. and saves 2500.00mt a month. For Francisca this is her first loan in Hluvuku and Kiva, with the money she wants to increase her inventory to respond better to the demand of the end of the year holidays. She also dreams in buying a container to use it as a fixed place to sell her animals.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell goats at the Xipamanine market in the city of Maputo

loans.name: Eugenia Celina

texts.es:
La señora de nombre Eugenia Celina T. López tiene la edad de 65 años su estado civil es soltera, Doña Eugenia tiene 7 hijos de los cuales no tiene hijos a su cargo, en sus deseos esta salir adelante con su negocio para mantenerlo activo ya que este negocio le proporciona la ayuda necesaria para sacar adelante a sus hijos y darle lo que ellos necesitaban, en sus propósitos esta el proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda ya que no tiene un lugar adecuado en donde cocinar y el lugar que utiliza para cocinar es un fogón   por lo que quiere trabajar fuerte para lograr sus propósitos ya que los materiales de construcción tienen un elevado precio es por eso que esta ahorrando lo suficiente para llevar a cabo sus propósitos.



La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta de tortilla, la ubicación de su negocio es la siguiente barrio de subtiava, el tiempo que tiene de poseer este negocio es de 20 años, ella inicia este negocio por con 1 quintal de maíz por lo que en el tiempo en 
el que Doña Eugenia inicio las tortillas tenían un precio de 25 centavos y al paso del tiempo es que decide aumentar el precio ya que debido a lo difícil que se torno la situación pero aun así logra conseguir afluencia de clientes y es así como esta con su negocio actualmente, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de leña, maíz entre otros ya que esta agradecida trabajar con Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas por lo que se interesan que los clientes salgan adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Eugenia Celina T. López is 65 years old, single, and has seven children (whom are not dependent upon her). One of her dreams is to keep her business going, since it helps to provide opportunity for her children and fulfill their needs. She plans to improve her home since she does not have adequate space for cooking - the space she uses is actually a wood-burning oven. She is working hard and saving money up to fulfill her plans since construction materials are expensive. She's had her tortilla-selling business, located in the Subtiava Barrio, for 20 years, which she started with one bag of corn and a price of 25 cents for tortillas. She raised the price as times became difficult but she was still able to grow her client base and that's how her business grew to its current size. This loan is for capital which she needs to buy firewood and corn, among other things. She is grateful to work with the Fundación León 2000 and the partner organizations as they are very supportive in helping their clients succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Abdurafik

texts.en:
Abdurafik is married with two kids. He’s a market vendor from Khujand where he sells men’s suits, trousers, shirts, and ties at the famous Kairakkum market “Somon-bozor”. Abdurafik is very enterprising, has vast experience working as a vendor, and is full of creative ideas. A reasonable pricing policy and client-friendly service have always been priorities in his work and have helped to ensure the success of his business.

Abdurafik has been running his business for many years. He was only 12 when he started to help his mother with her market business, then afterward when he became an adult, he started his own business. In general he has 12 years of experience selling clothing. Currently, Abdurafik is requesting a loan of 800 USD to increase his inventory. He promises to repay the loan within 11 months. He believes that having this additional turnover capital will help him minimize his sales risk and provide stable financial support for his family. Moreover, it will help him get closer to his ultimate goal of purchasing a big store of his own.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new goods to sell

loans.name: Loboko Group

texts.en:
Monique sells beverages, salted and smoked fish, and mushrooms. She has been in business off and on since 1981. She started by selling rolled cotton. Her beginning capital was US$ 7. Her first business prospered but lasted only for six months due to the lack of goods on the market. 

Monique had to change businesses. She started selling rice and soaps at the market, but was severely impacted when the Congolese Franc lost its value in 1981. She lost all of her capital and went to take care of her family until 2003.

Monique launched another business in 2003. She started selling beverages, cakes and waffles until 2007 when she joined one of Hope’s groups called “Loboko” meaning “Hand” in English. Through her sales, Monique makes about US$ 70 per week. Monique plans to use her loan from Hope to diversify her business and sell salted and smoked fish and mushrooms. In order to increase her income, Monique has various points of sale within her community. She dreams one day of putting up a large business building that she can rent out for additional income.  

Monique is 64 years old, married, and a mother of twelve children between the ages of 22 and 46; two of her children are sick and stay with her. The rest of her children are independent. In spite of her age, Monique likes selling because it gives her the opportunity to make contact with many different people, and once they become permanent customers, she is able to offer them quality products at a better price and they keep coming back.

loans.use: To purchase some bags of salted and smoked fish and mushrooms

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es: Sonia Elizabeth R. D. M., resiD. en San Martín, vive junto a su esposo, tres hijos y su abuela. Ella posee un negocio D. productos textiles, tales como camisetas, toallas entre otras más, dicho negocio tiene por nombre “taller Costura”. Tiene más D. ocho años D. poseerlo,  y este es la mayor fuente D. ingreso para su familia. Sonia desea poder comprar más materia prima la cual la utilizará para producir más producto, ella desea mejorar su negocio y poder ampliarlo, D. manera que pueda percibir mayores ingresos los cuales logren cubrir los gastos familiares y sobre todo las necesidades más primordiales D. sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia Elizabeth Ramirez D. Martinez, lives in San Martin, with her husband, three children and her grandmother. She has a business that makes textile products, such as t-shirts, towels and more, her business is called “sewing shop”. She’s had it for more than eight years, it is the primary source of income for her family. Sonia wishes to purchase more materials to make more items, improve her business and expand it, this way she will have more income to cover family expenses and the basic needs of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for business

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Reina es una mujer de 26 años, vive en su propia casa con su esposo Emilio de 30 años, tiene muchas ganas de sobresalir en la vida, es por eso que trabaja duro. Desde muy niña se preocupó por aprender las actividades ganaderas, lo que aprendió de sus padres. Ahora ella se dedica a la venta de fibra de alpaca, la cual vende en la feria dominical de la ciudad de Juliaca, la fibra que vende es de muy buena calidad, motivo por el cual se vende rápidamente. A Reina le es muy cansado trasladar toda la fibra para venderla, eso es lo más difícil de su trabajo, pero sabe que tiene que hacerlo para tener ingresos económicos, con los cuales en el futuro pueda comprar un carro para trasladar con mayor facilidad la fibra. Tiene ya 4 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta es la venta y conversar con sus clientes que siempre la buscan para comprarle. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y siempre ha pagado sus cuotas a tiempo, y dice que ahora no será la excepción, ya que desea acceder a más préstamos, con lo cuales pueda mejorar su negocio, sabe que en su banco comunal la apoyarán y la guiarán, ya que es una socia muy querida. Con el dinero solicitado pretende comprar más fibra de alpaca para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Reina is a 26 year old woman who lives in her own house with her husband, 30 year old Emilio. She really wants to get ahead in life, and this is why she works so hard. Since she was very young she has concerned herself with finding ways to make money, which she learned from her parents. Currently she sells alpaca wool in a market in the city of Juliaca. Her wool is of a very high quality, so it sells very quickly. It is very tiring for Reina to take all the wool to market, and this is the hardest part of her work. But she knows that he has to do it to earn money, which she will eventually use to buy a car in order to transport the wool more easily. She has been doing this for four years, and what she likes best is selling and chatting with her customers, who are always seeking her out.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she always made her payments on time, and says that this loan will be no exception. She wants to eventually take out more loans which she will use to improve her business. She knows very well that in her communal bank, they will support and guide her, because she is a well-loved member of the group. With this loan she plans to buy more alpaca wool to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy boards and work tools

loans.name: Sabah Group

texts.en:
The name of this group of borrowers is Sabah. The group is made up of three ladies who live in the Bekaa region of Lebanon.

Sabah, who lends her name to the group, is a 29-year-old woman. Sabah has been working in agriculture for 15 years. She has requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Sabah has requested a loan. Sabah decided to start her business in order to supplement her family's income. Her clients are people from her own region. In the future, she plans on expanding the scope of her work.

Saada is a 40-year-old married woman. Saada has been working in agriculture for 10 years. She has requested a loan of $300 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Saada has requested a loan. Saada enjoys what she does. Her clients are people from her own region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Nazha is a 33-year-old married woman. Nazha has been working in agriculture for 17 years. She has requested a loan of $300 dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her work. This is the first time that Nazha has requested a loan. Her clients are people from her own region. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Sabah group will use their loan to purchase tools for their agricultural work.

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en: Afolabi O. is 35 years old and single. He sells medicines. He is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Gerarda De La Concepcion

texts.es: Gerarda de la Asunción  P. tiene 48 años de edad y un solo hijo pero este ya esta casado y vive por cuenta propia, la actividad económica a la que se dedica es a la venta de hamacas y una pulperia. además con el capital que poco a poco ha ido recogiendo ha podido establecer una pequeña pulpería en su hogar de habitación. Gerarda fue ayudante de su mama cuando este trabajo elaborando hamacas, por esto cuando Gerarda formo su hogar este fue el oficio que le ayudo a obtener ingresos para su familia, inicio su negocio con un financiamiento que Fundación León 2000 le otorgo en los momentos que mas necesito, desde entonces Gerarda no ha estancado la producción de hamacas y de este pequeño negocio logro establecer otro, pues ella ha aprendido a luchar y emprender nuevos caminos cuando parece que ya no existen mas opciones, ahora a Gerarda se le ha presentado la oportunidad de incrementar aun mas sus ventas, pero realmente ella no cuenta con toda la materia prima que requiere la elaboración de una gran cantidad de hamacas y los ingresos de su pulpería tampoco puede sufragar los costos que esto infiere, por los tanto ella ha recurrido a nuestra ayuda pues su financiamiento lo utilizara para este nuevo proyecto que desea emprender en su negocio.
texts.en:
Gerarda de la Asunción P. is 48 years old. She has one son, but he is married and makes his own living. She sells hammocks and has a small grocery store. She opened the grocery store in her home with money she was able to save up bit by bit. Gerarda used to help her mother when her mother made hammocks . That’s why when Gerarda started her own household, this was the occupation that helped her to earn an income for her family. Since then, she has never slowed in her production of hammocks, and this small business helped her start another one. She has learned to fight and start over when there aren’t any other options. Gerarda has now been presented with the opportunity to increase her sales even more, but she doesn’t have all of the materials that she needs to make a large number of hammocks and the earnings from her grocery store also wouldn’t be enough for the costs she would incur. This is why she has come to us for help. The loan would be used for this new project that she wishes to start in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe J. is from the village of Silanga, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Maria Fe is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Fe owns and operates a business venture in the construction sector, providing carpentry services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing repair services to local community members. Maria Fe has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide the service. This will be the first loan taken out by Maria Fe from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Patricia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Manuela D. Hoy”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, Provincia D. El Collao, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 54 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada y es madre D. 08 hijos.  No tiene estudios, vive en la Parcialidad D. Chakoputi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra D. ganado menor (ovinos).

Su deseo es continuar trabajando hasta que las fuerzas se lo permitan.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la forma D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Patricia belongs to the Manuela D. Hoy Community Bank, which is located in the Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is 54, married, and has eight children. She does not have an education. She lives in the Parcialidad D. Chakoputi. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy small livestock. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy small livestock (sheep). Her wish is to keep working as long as she has the strength. She likes the savings and the way they work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Houma

texts.fr: Houma B. est une femme de 55 ans, mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter du mil et de l’arachide destiné à la vente. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital d’investissement et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Houma B. is a 55-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 6 children. She is requesting a loan to buy millet and peanuts destined for sale. Her goal is to increase her investment capital and to improve her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell peanut butter and millet

loans.name: Imoh

texts.en: Imoh sells drinks. She has been in the business for the past 5 years. Imoh is 36 years old and married with 6 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. Imoh is requesting for the loan of N100, 000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Salve

texts.en:
Salve D. S. hails from the busy town of Tanay, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 33 years old and the mother of a daughter, Fatima. She is married to Arnel, who is 34 and her business partner. She is busy managing her business.

She wanted to help her husband make a living. She really wanted to start a business that she could manage within her capacity as a woman. Her problem was the capital to start a business. Then she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2008. When she received her first loan, she started a business reselling rice, charcoal and other products. After almost a year of doing the business, she finds it profitable.

Now she is requesting a loan of 10,000 pesos as her second loan and this will be used to pay for charcoal, nine sacks of rice and transportation expenses. She is hopeful that her business will grow and will bring enough profit for her to save for the future of her child. She also wants to improve her sewing business as her secondary source of income.

loans.use: To pay for charcoal worth 5,000 pesos, nine sacks of rice and transportation expenses

loans.name: Patuju Group

texts.es: El grupo “Patuju” están representadas por la señora Ana Rosario y conformada por 17 miembros que van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas de salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría de las socias se dedican a la venta de productos como ropa, cotillones, pan, cosméticos, comida, dulces y al servicio domestico, albañiles, cocineros, atención de cafés Internet y a la realización de telares. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desde su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento de sus negocios y al incremento de su mercadería para ofrecer al mercado un producto de mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas de las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinde a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Patuju group is represented by Mrs. Ana Rosario and made up of 17 members who are in their second cycle with the institution and who demonstrate responsibility, honesty and the desire to succeed to continue growing with the economic support that the institution gives them. The majority of the members dedicate themselves to the sale of products like clothing, party novelties, bread, cosmetics, food, sweets and articles for the home such as masons, cookery, products for internet cafes and the for construction of looms. The effort that this group has exhibited since their first cycle has begun to take off because of the new credit requirement which is to work to grow their business and increase their stock of merchandise to be able to provide a more competitive and higher quality product to the market. The members' expectations are to have a productive business that will give their families a higher quality of life and give their children a better education.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita.
Julia es casada, tiene 48 años y 4 hijos, Julia tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes y bebidas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su hija. Julia tiene proyectado viajar a las ferias.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Julia sueña con ampliar su tienda y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Morenita Communal Bank. Julia is 48, married, and has four children. Julia has a store in her house where she sells groceries and drinks. She does this every day with her daughter’s help. Julia plans to travel to the fairs. Julia needs a loan for 1,200 PEN, which she will use to buy rice and sugar. Julia’s dreams are to expand her store and that her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad, 35 years old, is married with three children.  All his children are currently in school.  Imad's main activity is selling fruit and vegetables.  As of now, this is his only source of income. 

This is the first time that Imad has requested a loan from Ryada. This loan will let him purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell and therefore improve his business by being able to provide a larger variety of goods. He needs a loan in the amount of USD 2000. He promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary R. is a farmer who lives in Preak Tanop village in Kandal province. In her farming, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seed to cultivate rice. Thus, Mrs. Nary R. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seed for her purpose and she would use the rest of the money to buy a water pump to water her crop.

Mrs. Nary R.’s husband, Mr. Seng Sokhom, is also a farmer who helps his wife with the business. Mrs. Nary R. has a child who is too young to work or study because the child is only three years old. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seed and a water pump

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Née le 17 Septembre 1982 à Sikasso, Fatoumata B. est une divorcée, mère de deux garçons qui vit dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Médine-Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Fatoumata B.  décida  finalement de s’initier  à l’activité d’achat et de vente d’articles d’alimentation il y a environ cinq  ans. Elle mène cette activité devant leur domicile à Médine Sikasso où elle est beaucoup  appréciée et sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant deux mois. Elle est à son premier prêt individuel. 
Avec ce premier prêt  elle compte acheter, auprès de ses fournisseurs 50 cartons d’eau minérale, 35 paquets de boisson NBB, 30 casiers de boisson BRAMALI, 20 cartons de boisson  en canette  de différentes sortes et d’autres articles. 
Elle achète ses marchandises sur place et vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée des femmes et des jeunes surtout en cette période d’approche des fêtes (Tabaski, Noël et Fin d’année). 
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on September 17, 1982 in Sikasso, Fatoumata B. is divorced and the mother of two children.  She lives in a large traditional extended family in Médine-Sikasso (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). After having run many businesses without success, she decided in the end to become introduced to buying and selling food items five years ago.  She operates her business in front of her home in Médine Sikasso, where she is much appreciated by her customers for the quality of her goods. To satisfy her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two months ago.  She is now on her first individual loan, which she intends to use to buy from suppliers:  50 boxes of mineral water, 35 packets of NBB drinks, 30 cases of BRAMALI drinks, 20 boxes of canned drinks of various kinds, and other items.  She purchases her goods locally and sells to customers composed of women and young people, cash or credit accepted, particularly during this period leading up to the holidays (Tabaski, Christmas, and New Year).  She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, and to pay the interest on her loan.  The rest will be invested into her business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies (mineral water, canned beverages, containers, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her grocery

loans.name: Chrispinus

texts.en:
Chrispinus M. is 30 years old, a very jovial man who likes to joke. He has a third eye for life, he says, and he calls it, to my surprise, determination. He says you need to have this in the back of your head in order to make it in life.

Chrispinus is married and together with his wife, he runs a farm dealing mainly with vegetables like cabbage, kale, and traditional greens. He would like to venture into tomatoes as soon as he can. He has a number of cattle, too, for milk. He would like a loan of Kshs.20,000 which will go toward increasing his farming area in Malanga, Busia district. His main vision is to educate his children.
