loans.use: Increase farming area

loans.name: Juaben Ladies Group

texts.en:
Mariama is 38 years old, married, and the mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She has been sewing for five years now, specializing in womenswear and funeral dresses. Her skills and designs are of high class. She makes various kinds of clothing styles to give her customers a new look – for example, children's school uniform, church attire, kaba and slit (a tailored top and long skirt), wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She wants to use her loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials such as linen, threads, thimbles, etc. to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work, she has two apprentices to whom she is providing quality training for their future work.
Mariama is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Juaben Ladies’. She is pictured in the middle of the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are small traders or food traders. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy sewing materials such as linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Ricardo Francisco

texts.es: En el 2000 don Ricardo Francisco R. empezó a comercializar tomate en cuyo negocio le va muy bien ya que es una de las frutas más vendidas. El tiene siente hijos los cuales debes en cuando le ayudan en el negocio ya que trabajan.
texts.en:
Ricardo Francisco R. began selling tomatoes in 2000. He does well in this business because tomatoes are one of the best-selling fruits. He has 7 children who sometimes help him with his business because they all work elsewhere.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tomatoes.

loans.name: Rose

texts.fr: Née en 1971 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, K. Rose vit depuis 4 ans au quartier Cadjèhoun à Cotonou. Rose est divorcée de son mari et a à sa charge ses quatre enfants. Tous ses enfants sont scolarisés et vivent donc avec elle à Cadjèhoun. Rose a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire. Pour assurer les différentes charges qui lui reviennent, Rose vend du riz préparé à son domicile. A côté de cette activité, Rose vend des divers (lait, savons, pâtes alimentaires, conserves, etc.), des tissus et également des chaussures, ce qui lui permet d’avoir plusieurs sources de revenu. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Rose fait ses achats. Il y a près de 20 ans que Rose mène cette activité, ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses besoins. Rose a déjà obtenu une fois de crédit à ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Rose voudrait développer son activité pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle se faire plus de revenu que par le passé. Mais n’ayant suffisamment pas de moyens financiers pour y arriver, Rose sollicite l’aide de ALIDé pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1971 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Rose K. has been living for the past four years in the Cadjéhoun area of Cotonou. She is divorced from her husband and provides support for her four children, who are all in school and live with her in Cadjéhoun. Rose attended school up to secondary level. To manage the diverse household expenses, Rose sells rice prepared in her home. Additionally, she sells various products (milk, soap, pasta, canned goods, etc.), fabrics and also shoes, which provides her with several sources of income. She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, Benin’s international marketplace. Rose has been active in this business for about 20 years, and is able to make ends meet. Rose has already been granted one loan by ALIDé, which she promptly reimbursed. She would like to develop her business to increase customer satisfaction, and generate more income than in the past. Without the financial means to accomplish this, she is requesting support from ALIDé to bolster her business.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of rice, condiments, and pieces of fabric

loans.name: Leona Feliciana

texts.es: Doña Leona Feliciana Ordoñez P. cuenta con 30 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” cuenta con un taller, habita junto a sus 2 hijos conjuntamente con su esposo, Ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 15 años de laborar Cortes Tipicos  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío la Libertad, de la Aldea Vásquez, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Leona Feliciana Ordoñez P. is 30 years old, is married, and she works as an artisan in “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos” (Elaborating Typical Cuts). She has a workshop and lives with her 2 children and husband. Mrs. Ordoñes and her husband have the same occupation and they have 2 employees, they have worked for 15 years in Cortes Tipicos in their home which is located in Caserío, La Libertad, in Aldea Vásquez, the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, the demand from their customers has increased, but their current economic condition is not enough for her to increase her income, it is for this reason that she went to Asociación ASDIR (Kiva’s field partner) for a loan, with the intention to buy raw materials so that she can increase her sales. She also hopes to give her children a good start in life and that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Jazmin Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su tercer ciclo, y todas se encuentran trabajando muy activamente cada una en actividad independiente.
 Podemos hablar de la Sra.Adelina V. con 35 años de edad , tiene 2 hijos que se quedan  en la casa mientras ella se  va a vender por la mañana en la zona de Ñemby, este trabajo lo realiza todas las mañanas, luego regresa a su casa prepara para el almuerzo  y vuelve a salir por la tarde para a hacer su venta. Es una señora muy sacrificada que tiene un dia a dia muy pesado  por que al llegar de su trabajo debe de realizar las tareas de la casa y todo lo hace para salir adelante con su familia.
Ella agradece por el crédito ya que mediante ella pudo comprar   los ingredientes que ella utiliza para elaborar sus tortas, como; dulces, harina y otros.
texts.en:
The current group is in its third cycle and all members have been working actively in their businesses. We can speak about Adilina. She is 35 years old and has two children who remain at home while she travels every morning to make her sales in the Nemby zone. She then returns home to fix lunch and ventures out again in the afternoon to continue her sales. This lady makes many daily sacrifices. She has many hard days and then must do household chores when she returns home. She does this in order to get ahead with her family. She is grateful for this loan that allowed her to buy the ingredients, such as sweets, flower and other things that she needs to make her pastries.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients for pastries

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y vive junto a sus dos hijos, uno de los cuales ya trabaja, en la ciudad de Lambayeque, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace cinco años empezó a vender productos cosméticos por catálogo, con mucho esfuerzo pudo obtener un grupo de clientes fieles, los cuales le recomendaron ampliar su negocio instalando un puesto de venta en su vivienda. Teresa trabajó mucho para lograr este objetivo y actualmente ya tiene instalado su negocio.

Ella hace los pedidos con anticipación para tener un stock permanente que le garantice satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes en cualquier momento sin necesidad de que estos esperen al fin de mes para que llegue el pedido que solicitaron. Actualmente ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que tenga un stock surtido, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Teresa es una mujer emprendedora y bastante trabajadora. Sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran alguien de confianza, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria.
texts.en:
Teresa is 44 years old. She is separeated and lives with her two children, one of whom is already working in the city of Lambayeque, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Five years ago she started selling cosmetics through a catalog. With a lot of effort she was able to establish a group of regular customers, who suggested that she expand her business and set up a shop in her home. She worked hard to meet this objective and now has her business established. She anticipates her customers’ needs and places her orders in advance, so that she will have the items in stock and her customers will not have to wait until the end of the month for the products to arrive. Now she would like to expand her business even more by buying and maintaining a stock of a greater variety of products. So she is requesting her first loan of 500 PEN ($200) through Edpyme Alternativa in order to help her meet her objective. Teresa is a very enterprising and hard working woman. She is well liked by her friends and acquaintances and they consider her to be a very trustworthy person. Her greatest desire is to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Velinda Silvia

texts.es: El negocio D. L. Sra Velinda es por temporadas entre los meses D. Enero y abril venD. frutas con su cuñada en un puesto que ellas alquilan, y entre los meses D. abril y julio se dedican a L. venta D. carne D. res que traen desD. provincias del Perú, ElL. nos comenta que así obtiene mayores ingresos, Velinda tiene como meta adquirir un puesto propio y ofrecer diferentes productos que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Velinda’s business is seasonal. In January and April, she sells fruit with her sister-in-law in a leased stand. From April to July they sell beef that they bring from the provinces of Perú. She comments that this provides higher earnings. Velinda’s goal is to acquire her own stand and offer the various products that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pastries to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Koeb Im Roth Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan is made up of 15 people who are villagers in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Koeb Im R. is the village bank president, selected by all the members who will use their loans to improve their family's living conditions.
Mrs. Koeb Im R. is a mother of two children who attend the local public school. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Therefore, in order to improve her business, she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables for resale. Her husband, Mr. Davin Sok, is an electrician who earns a small salary to support his family.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Holishon's Group

texts.en:
Holishon S. is the leader of the group. She is 51 and a widow. She has raised a 23-year-old daughter. The daughter helps her mom with housework. Holishon's husband died three years ago, and after that, she had to start to do something to earn money. She started to breed cattle, poultry and cultivate fruit and vegetables. The initial investment in this business activity was 8000 soms ($174.17) and now she makes 2100 soms ($45.72) per month. Holishon applied for the loan, because she needs money to purchase a calf for fattening and breeding. In the future she wants to save some money to contribute to her daughter's wedding.

Shohsanam V. is the treasurer of the group. She is 25 and a widow. Shohsanam lives with her parents. In order to make money, Shohsanam works in a pharmacy and her parents breed cattle and cultivate fruit and vegetables.  Shohsanam's parents started that activity 21 year ago, with the initial investment of 2100 soms ($45.72). In this way they make 2700 soms ($58.78) per month. That profit made them able to build a new house, contribute some money to their older son's and older daughter's weddings. With money received from the loan, Shohsanam wants to purchase a cow for fattening and breeding. 

Munosibzhon M. is 25. He lives with his parents. The father works as a driver, the older sister works in a pharmacy, and the brother went off to work in Russia to make some money. Four years ago with the initial investment of 2700 soms ($58.78) Munosibzhon started wholesaling potatoes. Now he wholesales fruit and vegetables, particularly cherries. In this way he earns 6000 soms ($130.63) per month. Munosibzhon wants to get a loan to purchase a variety of fruits and vegetables in order to sell them in Bishkek and make good money. In the future he wants to build a new house and buy a vehicle. 

Dilbarhon M. is 27. Her husband works as a builder. They have a son and two daughters. Four years ago with an initial investment of 7800 soms ($169.82) Dilbarhon started to breed cattle and cultivate different sorts of fruit and vegetables. In this way she makes 1800 soms ($39.19) per month. Now she wants to get a loan to purchase a bull-calf for fattening in order to sell it later on.
 
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf for breeding

loans.name: Rosa Marlene

texts.es:
la señora Rosa Marlene V. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada con el señor Jose Gimenez quien se dedica al negocio del transporte desde hace mucho tiempo y Rosa Marlene atiende la pulperia y un molino de moler maiz que tiene en su casa de habitacion, tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de mercaderia para surtir mas su negocio y comprar refrescos al por mayor.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa Marlene V. is 40 years old. She is married to Jose Gimenez who has been involved in the transportation business for a long time. Rosa Marlene attends to the store and a mill for grinding corn that she has in her house. She has been in this business for four years. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her business and purchase wholesale drinks. She needs the earnings to cover the household and family costs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, cereal, milk, soups, churros, drinks, bread, cookies, coffee, and candles.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 44 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene tres hijos en su haber. Juntos viven en la localidad de Quimbiri, ubicada en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Mary recuerda que empezó desde abajo hasta llegar lo que tiene ahora, que es una librería, pero al inicio tuvo sus primeras recaídas, pero le sirvió de experiencia para mejorar, es por ello que son muchos lo clientes que recurren a su establecimiento, debido a la calidad y el buen servicio que brinda, eso le ha generado buenas ganancias económicas. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su negocio con la finalidad de que pueda introducir mayor cantidad de productos, según a los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir pagando como en anteriores ocasiones, además está conforme con grupo comunal, ya que todos los presentes son responsables y puntuales. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías para abastecer su librería.
texts.en:
Mary, age 44, is divorced and has three children at home. They live together in the Quimbiri area, which is located on the edge of the Peruvian jungle. They have their own house there. Mary remembers that she started from the bottom until she came to have what she has now, a bookstore. When she started she had her first losses. But, the experience helped her to improve. That is why so many customers frequent her establishment. It is due to the quality and the good service that she offers. This has generated good income. She usually works on her own, but sometimes her children help her. Her plan for the future is to expand her business so that she can introduce a greater quantity of products. She will do this according to the likes and preferences of her customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She pledges to keep making her payments as she has in the past. Also, she gets along well with her communal bank. All of the members are responsible and punctual. She plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise to stock her bookstore.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and goods to stock her bookstore

loans.name: William Gonzalo

texts.en:
William Gonzalo V. S. is 44 years old. He is in a common-law relationship, and lives with his 4 children, aged 5, 9, 14 and 15, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

William is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

William is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries, beans and corn. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and corn and beans once a year.

William requests this loan to invest in blackberries by purchasing seeds and compost. His dream is to get a house and enable his children to study. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest

He likes to play volleyball and indoor soccer in his free time.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and compost for blackberries

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old single woman from Lebanon. She lives with her two parents. After getting 10 years of experience working as a tailor, she opened a small tailoring shop in 2005 near to her house. She makes different clothing designs at the request of her clientele. She also repairs used clothes. With her income, she supports her father in the household. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase tailoring supplies and more textiles to versify her products. In the future, she would like to expand her client base and she hopes to open a small tailoring factory. 
 
Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been withheld to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen: 

Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in Lebanese Microfinance since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specializing in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement to their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase tailoring supplies and more textiles

loans.name: Elizaphan

texts.en:
Elizaphan is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for over 20 years and employs one farmhand. His main products are milk, maize, beans, millet, eggs, vegetables and tomatoes, which he sells to the local market and to schools. He is also a bursar at a local school.
Elizaphan recently completed his second loan from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, of 50,000 KES and has requested this loan of 80,000 KES to purchase a dairy cow and connect electricity to his house. With the proceeds from this loan, he will be able to provide for his family and have electricity in his house. He is happy that his children will be able to study comfortably when they have an electricity connection.
Elizaphan's primary challenge has been lack of sufficient capital for expansion. However, he plans to expand his cereal business and be the major supplier to various schools in the locality.
Elizaphan is 44 years old. He is married and has been blessed with four children who are now between the ages of eight and sixteen. All the children attend school. He is requesting a bigger loan from Juhudi Kilimo and appreciates how far the organization has brought him to date.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and connect electricity to his house

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en:
Etevise I. is 25 and married with 1 child.  She owns a business venture selling lavalavas (bottom-half wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has 2 years of experience in this business, and needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve and expand it.

In 2010, Etevise joined SPBD, and this is her 1st loan with them. SPBD's loans are Etevise's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim loves in Vehari, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is popular for its agricultural industry. She is married to M. R. who is a fruit seller by profession.  He sells fruits by putting them on his cart and visiting different streets of the city. He works very hard all the day to put three meals on the table for his family. 

Shamim helps her husband financially by making and selling "chingairs" (a kind of tray made of thick rope to keep breads in). She is very good in her art and her chingairs sells easily in the market at good rate. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy seasonal fruits for his business.  She is hopeful that through this investment her husband will be able to make more income which will help her family to enjoy better facilities of life.

Note: In the picture, they lady who is raising her hand is Shamim.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Merida

texts.en:
Merida is a 27-year-old mother who lives with her husband and son in Alajuela, San Ramón, located in the central valley of Costa Rica. 

Merida has completed a two year program in the art of beauty/cosmetics. She has combined her educational background and her entrepreneurial instincts to open a beauty salon. Merida offers hair services such as styling, cutting, coloring and other hair related services, as well as nail services (manicures, pedicures etc.)  She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of various beauty products/tools such as hair dryers, a hair straightener, scissors, creams, shampoos, nail polish, etc. Merida started her business five years ago with a loan she shared with a friend. This loan will be her first with Fundación Mujer. 

Over the past year, Merida has been focused on raising her newborn son. As a result, she has been working half time at her salon. This loan will mark the return to full time work for Merida, as she aims to transform this loan into profits. Full time business hours are from 9:00AM to 6:00PM, Monday to Saturday, and Merida works alone.  The months of October, November and December are the busiest in the beauty industry. Merida can count on anywhere between 60 to 100 regular clients who make monthly visits during this time. Merida´s services are sought not only by members of her immediate community, but by clients in neighbourung communities who travel to visit her salon (San Jose, San Carlos, Guanacaste). These clients have helped to keep her business flourishing as there are a number of beauty salons in the area, creating high levels of competition for clients.

 In an effort to differentiate her salon from those of her competitors, Merida would like to invest in an automatic nail painter. This machine paints nails quickly and with intricate designs. The machine is quite expensive, so Merida will not be putting the current loan towards such a machine, possibly the next loan.

In general, Merida wakes up early, prepares breakfast for her husband and son, and carries out domestic tasks. From 9:00AMto 6:00PM she will be working in the salon, with an hour lunch break.

loans.use: For the purchase of a hair straightener, scissors, nail polish, and a hair dryer

loans.name: Julio Ricardo

texts.es:
El clienta Julio Ricardo Z. C.. Vive en departamento de león Reparto buena Vista Cuarta Calle., Es un cliente Soltero  trabaja actual mente en MINSA santa Rosa del peñón desempeñan el cargo como Medico En Epidermiología tiene 13 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación propia el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la para Construcción de una pequeña cocina, el cual le permitirá la facilidad de su familia.  
Esto le permitirá que el cliente pueda obtener una mejor condición de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
This client's name is Julio Ricardo Z. C.. He lives in the department of León, in the Fourth Street area of Buena Vista. He is single and currently works for MINSA [the Ministry of Health] in Santa Rosa del Peñón, in the position of Doctor of Epidemiology.  He has worked for this institution for 13 years.

The client has a house of his own which he would like to improve. The loan will be used to construct a small kitchen, which will make things easier for his family. This will permit the client to achieve better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: Constructing a kitchen

loans.name: Sesay United Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the "S. United" group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. For the very first time, these entrepreneurs have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to buy more goods to add to their respective business, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

The leader of this group is Foday S.. Mr. S. is a forty-five-year-old man who was born in the city of Bo, in southern Sierra Leone. He is today residing in Magburaka, together with his wife and two children. His wife is a school teacher and his children are attending secondary school. Mr. S. sells palm oil, rice, groundnuts, peppers, etc. He has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, he will be able to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to his current inventory. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, groundnuts, peppers, etc. in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras 3 Group

texts.es:
Genoveva es una de los miembros del Grupo Mujeres triunfadoras 3; localizado en La ciudad de Puerto Plata, cuya economía depende de la industria del ron, del sector turístico e inmobiliaria, fue el primer destino turistico del República Dominicana y unas de las ciudades mas productora de azúcar, en donde como muchas hay escasez de agua potable y de energía eléctrica y con una población de dominicanos y emigrantes haitianos. Su negocio es las ventas de cosméticos, zapatos, accesorios y diversos productos miscelaneos especialmente para las mujeres. Genoveva es casada, y su familia esta compuesta por ella y su esposo. Nos dice que su reto o desafío más difícil ha sido siempre luchar duro para conseguir su sustento, nunca ha podido estar esperando por las cosas, siempre la ha salido a buscar ella. Disfruta mucho compartir con los demas.

Genoveva está muy emocionada de recibir su préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber recibido la invitacion de formar parte del grupo que habia en su comunidad, donde ha visto otras mujeres como ella muy trabajadora, conseguir por medio de los prestamo capital para sus negocios. Está planificando relanzar su negocio ya que por falta de capital lo habia cerrado y va a invertir este préstamo en la compra Productos de belleza, cosméticos, zapatos, algunas piezas de ropa, accesorios, etc. Planea utilizar sus ganancias para ahorrar y poder compartir los gastos de su vivienda con su esposo, de esta manera pueden apoyarse mutuamente y ayudar a algun familiar que los necesiten. Su sueño es tener tengo un negocio estable y poder estar tranquila esperando su vejez.
texts.en:
Genoveva is one of the members of the “Mujeres Triunfadores 3” (Triumphant Women 3) group which is located in the city of Puerto Plata, whose economy depends on the rum industry, the tourist industry and the real estate industry.  It was the top tourist destination in the Dominican Republic and one of the biggest producers of sugar.  As in many other cities, there is a scarcity of drinking water and electricity and a population of Dominicans and emigrant Haitians.

Genoveva's business is selling cosmetics, shoes, accessories and other miscellaneous products, especially for women.  She is married and her family comprises herself and her husband.  She tells us that her most difficult challenge has always been to fight hard to support herself.  She has never sat back and waited for things, she has always gone out in search of them.  She really enjoys sharing with others.

Genoveva is very excited to be receiving her loan from Esperanza Internacional after having received an invitation to form part of the group in her community.  Here she has seen other hard-working women like herself manage to use their loans to gain capital for their businesses.  She is planing to relaunch her business since she had shut it through lack of capital.  She will use this loan to invest in buying beauty products, cosmetics, shoes, some clothes, accessories, etc.  She plans to use the profits she makes to save and be able to share the household expenses with her husband.  In this way they can support each other and help any family member who should need it.   Her dream is to have a stable business and be able to relax as she waits for her old age.

loans.use: To buy various products such as perfume, purses, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is the wife of B. A. and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari is a small city famous for its agricultural industry. She is an uneducated lady and couldn’t get an education due to the poor financial condition of her family. In her childhood, she had a great desire in her heart to get a good education, but it couldn’t get fulfilled because her father had a big family to serve. She is very thankful to her mother, that she taught her the skill of embroidery, and now she is getting good benefits from this work. She receives orders from her neighboring customers and earns good income by completing them on time. 

Her husband is a private entrepreneur in a fruits & vegetables selling business. He has a shop in the market where he serves his customers and earns good profits. He has been in this business for over 7 years.

Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy seasonal fruits & vegetables in bulk quantity and improves his sales. Zarina is hopeful that this investment will bring her husband’s business to a more profitable position and increase his monthly income.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits & vegetables to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha, 55 years old, is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has eight children. Three of her children still go to school. Editha does her best to sustain her children's education because she wants them to finish college and have bright futures.

Editha is a farmer and she says she has been engaged in farming for almost 26 years already. Her husband, who is also a farmer, helps maintain their rice farm. Editha does her part to keep their farm productive and makes sure to take care of her family.

In need of additional farm inputs, Editha applied for a loan of Php 20,000 from CEVI, a KIVA partner. She will use the loan amount to buy fertilizers and other supplies she needs for their farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe JIGUISSEME sont essentiellement des femmes mariées  avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et en moyenne 3 enfants. Elles  vivent la dans des familles monogames à OUAYERMA II  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur sixième  collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Les prêts précédents ont été  bien soldés. Elles font la vente de savon liquide, de pagnes, de tissus et de la friperie  avec AWA K.. 
Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 balles de friperies.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché  de Sikasso et effectue sa vente à domicile et au marché au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 49.000FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Jiguisseme group are mostly married women, averaging 32 years old with 3 children. They live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the neighborhoods of Sikasso, third administrative district of Mali. 

They are on their 3rd loan with microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet their customers' needs. The previous loans have been properly repaid. The women sell liquid soap, "pagne" fabric, other fabric and used clothing with Awa K.. With her new loan, Awa plans to buy 10 bales of used clothing. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Sikasso and sells at her house and at the market for cash, and often for credit, to customers who are both men and women. She expects to make a monthly profit of 49,000 CFA francs, of which some will be used for savings and the family's needs, the rest being re-invested in her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes

loans.name: Gladys Azucena

texts.es:
Gladys Azucena Z. V., tiene 38 años, es soltera con su hijo, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Gladys se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta conversar con las amigas y escuchar música.
texts.en:
Gladys Azucena Z. V. is 38 years old, she is single and lives with her son in Ventanas, a caonton in the Los Ríos Province. She has one son.

The V.R.C. Valle Alto (Valle Alto Communal Bank) is located in the Voluntad de Dios precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; this group engages in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Gladys engages in agriculture, growing maize and rice. She buys and sells the products in Ventanas and in the Comercial Peña, and she also sells them every day at her house or in the market.

The loan she is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help her economically, as thanks to it she will fulfill her needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. She dreams of buying a farm.

She likes chatting with her female friends and listening to music.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Solome

texts.en:
Solome N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has one child.None of her children is currently in school. Solome has a business selling all types of food (food market), which she has had for two years. 
        
To help expand her business, Solome has requested a loan of 350,000 UGX  BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Solome hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to own another business operating a small retail shop. Solome is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by giving her a loan to start a business.

loans.use: To purchase more food for resale

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.ar: هيام في عمر 58 سنة متزوجة تعمل في بيع الادوات المنزلية لها في عملها سنة تحب عملها وتطوره دائما تسعى الى تحسين وضعها المادي والاجتماعي تريد دائما زيادة مدخولها حيث انها تتعرض للمنافسة من محيطها تريد من خلال طلب قرض لها من المجموعة الى شراء بضاعة للمحل وزيادة عدد الزبائن لها حب في عملها من خلال زبائنها حيث انهم يقصدونها من جيرانها واقاربها واصدقائها
texts.en: Hiyamis 58 years old and married. She has been working for the past year selling household products to the friends, relatives, and neighbors who make up her clientele. She is always working to gain an edge over her stiff competition and increase revenues. Hiyam now wanted to apply for a loan from Al Majmoua to procure more merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
Doña María de 49 años de edad, reside en Usulután, tiene un negocio donde vende productos necesarios para el hogar, ella vive junto a su esposo, una hija y una nieta de 6 años de edad, doña María tiene experiencia en el comercio, pues lleva varios años dedicándose a esta actividad.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra mercadería y abastecer la tienda, su propósito es mantener el negocio en óptimas condiciones, brindar a los clientes lo necesario para el hogar con productos nuevos y a buen precio.

Los objetivos de doña María es mantenerse en el negocio, atender bien a los clientes, satisfacer las necesidades de estos, aumentar sus ventas y por consiguiente brindar a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
María is 49 years old and lives in Usulután together with her husband, a daughter and a 6 year-old granddaughter.  She has a business selling household products.  María has sales experience since she has been in this line of work for several years.

María is currently requesting a loan so that she can buy merchandise to stock her store.  Her aim is to keep her business in optimum condition and to provide her customers with what they need for their households by offering them new products at a good price.

María's goal is to keep her business going, to serve her customers well, to meet her customers' needs, to increase her sales and, consequently, to provide her family with a more comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama San Jose, ya está en el 2 ciclo del programa, este comité se formó el 10 de agosto  del 2010.
La sra. Agueda tiene problemas de visión y aun así se dedica a la venta de harina de maíz, ella dice que gracias al crédito que solicita podrá comprar un molino manual y así podrá aumentar su producción.
Es de muy pocos recursos económicos la sra. Agueda pero posee ganas de progresar y superarse, ayudando también a su familia, pues la vida ha sido muy dura para ella, al igual que para las demás integrantes de este comité.
Todas esperan poder contar con el apoyo financiero de los inversionistas que facilitan los préstamos mediante Kiva.
texts.en:
This group is called San Jose and in its second loan cycle within the program. The committee was established on August 10, 2010.

Sra. Agueda has vision problems, yet she has a business selling cornmeal. She says that thanks to the loan she requested, she will be able to purchase a manual grinder to help increase her production. Despite having limited financial resources, Sra. Agueda has the desire to make progress and succeed in order to help her family. Life has been very hard for her as well as the other members of this committee.

They all hope to have the financial support of the lenders who fund the loans through Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a manual grinder.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: El señor Gonzalo es originario de la localidad de Francisco Serrato, cuenta con 45 años de edad. Él término la escuela primaria y ya no pudo seguir estudiando por que sus padres no tenía la solvencia económica para pagar los útiles escolares ya que tenía mas hermanos pequeños y por eso desde muy chico empezó a trabajar en México ayudándo en un negocio de frutas. Don Gonzalo está casado con la señora Otilia quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y realiza tejidos, bordados en servilletas, manteles, etc., ellos tienen 8 hijos. Él pidió su préstamo a Fundación Realidad para invertir en el negocio de abarrotes, frutas y verduras; él lleva con su negocio de abarrotes y frutas 10 años aproximadamente, diario se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para ir a surtirse a la central de abastos y cada 15 días va a ver a sus hijos menores a Francisco Serrato ya que sus 4 hijos mayores le ayudan a atender el negocio en México. Él comenta que tiene su puesto en la ciudad de México por que en su comunidad se venden muy baratos los productos y en México gana más. El tiene la necesidad de seguir apoyando a sus cuatro hijos menores para que estudien una carrera comenta: “Quiero que se preparen, que tengan una carrera técnica ya que a mis otros cuatro hijos no les pude ayudar a terminar sus estudios porque me tenían que ayudar con los gastos de los menores. Quisiera llevar a mi familia a la ciudad de México pero también me gusta mi pueblo”. Una de sus metas es mejorar su puesto, surtiendo mas mercancía que él no vende, y quiere poner otro puesto para que uno lo trabajen sus hijos mayores y otro él y su esposa.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is originally from Francisco Serrato.  He’s 45 years old.  He finished elementary school but was unable to continue studying because his parents lacked economic solvency to pay for school supplies and he had younger siblings.  Because of this he started working in Mexico City while still very young helping out in a fruit selling business.

Gonzalo is married to Otilia who is a fruit merchant and also knits making embroidery on napkins, tablecloths, etc.  They have 8 children.

He requested a loan from Fundación Realidad to invest in the grocery, fruit and vegetable business.  He’s been in this business for about 10 years.  He rises daily at 4am to stock up at the wholesale market and every two weeks he goes to Francisco Serrato to visit his younger children since his four older children help him tend to the business in Mexico City.  He comments that he has his stand in Mexico City because the products sell very cheaply in his community and he can earn more in Mexico City.

He needs to continue supporting his four younger children so that they will study a career.  He comments:  “I want them to prepare themselves; that they have a technical career since I was unable to help my other four children finish their studies because I needed them to help me meet the expenses of the younger ones.  I’d like to bring my family to Mexico City but I also like my town.”

One of his goals is to improve his stand stocking more merchandise that he currently doesn’t sell; he also wants to set up a second stand so that his older children can run one and he and his wife can run the other one.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz C. is from the village of Bugang in Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Luz is widowed and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Luz runs a sari-sari (general goods) shop, selling canned goods, snacks, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Luz has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase additional stock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 39 years old and married with six children between ten and 17 years old. His wife is a farmer and they live in their own semi-permanent house in Karuguza, Uganda. For the past 20 years, Vincent has been running a butcher shop. With the proceeds from his business, he has been able to buy land. Vincent’s goal for his family is to pay school fees and expand his business.

Vincent is requesting a loan to purchase cattle for his business. His major business challenge is inadequate capital. In the future, Vincent hopes his business will expand and he would like to own a ranch.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Mariano Rosario

texts.es:
El Señor. Mariano es socio del banco comunal San José, vive en la parroquia de Santa Ana,  esta Parroquia es de clima frió, sus bellos paisajes reflejan la belleza natural del sector y desde el centro de la parroquia se puede admirar gran parte de la ciudad de Cuenca, su gente es muy trabajadora, mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.

El Señor Mariano tiene 31 años, vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad que  está estudiando en una escuelita de la comunidad. Su esposa labora como empleada, con el trabajo conyugal han construido su casa propia.

Don Mariano  labora en el área de la construcción y gracias a su experiencia ahora es maestro constructor. Ha laborado en esta área desde los 15 años de edad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitado por su suegra. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de materiales de construcción para realizar algunos acabados que le hacen falta a su casa.

Su meta es comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Mr. Mariano is a member of the communal bank "San Jose". He lives in the Santa Ana sector. This is known to be a cold climate sector and it is known for the beautiful scenery of natural beauty and from the downtown of the sector a large part of the city of Cuenca can be admired. The population is very hard working and they maintain their culture and their traditions. 

Mariano is 31 years old and he is married common-law. He has a 10-year old son and he attends primary school in his community. His wife is employed and with their combined work they have built a house of their own. 

Mariano works in the construction field and thanks to his experience he is now a master builder. He has been working in this field since he was 15 years old. 

He is on his second loan through is communal bank. He was initially invited to join by his mother-in-law. The funds from his loan will be invested in the purchase of construction materials to carry out some necessary home improvements.

His goal is to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: This is 46 year-old Alice. She is married and has three children ages 4, 18, and 22 years old. She has two dependents, one who is a relative.  In 1991, Alice established her local food stuff business. Working seven days a week and thirteen hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Alice requires a loan in order to purchase more local food stuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 150,000. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local food stuffs for her business.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram is a 56-year-old farmer from the village of Tskhratskharo in West Georgia. He is married and lives with his wife Marine and their 13-year-old daughter, who goes to school. 

The only source of income for Guram's family is agriculture. They have three milk cows, the milk of which is used for cheese production. The cheese they produce, approximately 20 kg per week, is sold at the local open market by Guram and Marine. Along with the dairy farm they also have a half-hectare plot of land, which is used for growing wheat. Any corn they grow is mainly used for feeding the cows. 

With the loan Guram plans to purchase an additional half hectare of land, which will be used for the same purpose: growing wheat. Additional wheat will be sold at the local market by the family members. It will increase the income of the family. 

An increase in income will allow the family to improve their living conditions as well as invest in expanding the dairy farm by increasing the number of milk cows.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 62 years old and the single mother of three. For the past 31 years, she has worked as a wholesale grocery supplier and she also has rental houses. Mary earns a monthly income of 66,000 KES from her businesses. 

Mary is requesting a loan to buy groceries and renovate her rental houses. This will be her third loan from KADET LTD and she has a good credit history. Mary intends to use her expected profits to build more rental houses. In the future, she hopes to be able to have a variety of multi-storied buildings.

loans.use: to buy groceries and renovate rental houses

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia is 25 years old and married.  Her husband a farmer.  She has 1 child and her child goes to school.  

She is currently working in another salon.  She knows how to work in the salon.  She asking for a loan in order to start a salon.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her child.  This Loan will help her start a salon.

loans.use: To start a beauty salon

loans.name: Amugulla Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Amugulla” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Kadiatu. Kadiatu is 24 years old and was born in the town of Kailahun, but she is currently residing in Kenema city. Kadiatu is single with no children. For many years now, Kadiatu has been selling garden eggs. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy dozens of garden eggs to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of garden eggs to add to her business.

loans.name: Alexis

texts.es: Alexis, tiene la edad 37 de  años, está soltero y vive con sus padres con la conyugue y una hijastra. El pretende con el crédito realizar la asistencia de su plantación de café. El cuenta con un terreno sembrado de café y pretende invertir en insumos como abonos y fungicidas para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere implantar un cafetal que de buena producción para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de sus familia y crecer con el proyecto del café. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Alexis is 37 years old, single, and lives with his wife and a stepdaughter in his parents' house. He intends to invest the loan in his coffee plot. 

Alexis has land planted with coffee trees and he wants to invest in supplies such as manure and fungicides to obtain a better harvest. Alexis wants to develop a coffee plot with good production and to sell a quality coffee. He wishes to generate the largest possible harvest in order to earn more income and improve his wellbeing and that of his family, and to expand his coffee project.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. Alexis has had no previous loans with state banks. FUDOCOSUR has offered this loan on the best terms with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: buy manure and fungicides to improve the quality and productivity of his coffee trees.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 48 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school.  Merly buys and sells fermented shrimps in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. She is  requesting a loan for 12,000 loan PHP through NWTF to buy additional stock of fermented shrimps to sell.  

In the future, Merly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of fermented shrimps to sell.

loans.name: Nancy Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Unión De Mujeres se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Calceta, ciudad conocida con el nombre de “Calceta la sin par”por la belleza de sus mujeres y porque para sus habitantes no hay ciudad más hermosa en el mundo.

La señora Nancy es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque a pesar del tiempo el grupo se ha hecho más unido y que es como una familia que se apoya mutuamente. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos, tres de ellos son mayores  y el menor de 16 años que estudia en  colegio, dos de ellos  aun viven con ella, el menor y una hija que es casada junto a sus esposo y dos pequeños que son la felicidad de nuestra amiga. Su esposo es maestro constructor.
 
Ella es modista de profesión trabaja y en un taller de costura de una señora para lo cual recibe un sueldo semanal, pero en las noches ella por su cuenta se dedica a coser ropa, en especial vestidos de niñas que es lo que más le gusta confeccionar aunque también elabora bastantes prendas de damas, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares. Lleva más de 25 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien ya que nunca le ha faltado trabajo tanto en el taller como en su casa.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, cierres, botones y otros materiales para la costura.
 
Sus sueños son tener un taller propio con varias operarias y entregar grandes pedidos.
texts.en:
The Unión De Mujeres (Women’s Union) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the beautiful city of Calceta, a city known by the name “Calceta la sin par” (Unparalled Calceta) for the beauty of its women and because for its inhabitants, there is no more beautiful city in the world.  

Nancy is a founding member of the communal bank and she enjoys it because despite the time, the group has become more united and is like a family that supports each other.  She is 52 years old, married, and has four children.  Three of them are adults. The youngest is a 16 year old student, and still lives at home. Her daughter, son-in-law, and two small children, who are the joy of her life, also live with her. Her husband is a master builder.

She is a dressmaker by profession, and works for a woman in a sewing workshop for which she is paid a weekly salary.  But in the evenings, she sews clothing on her own. Mainly, she sews dresses for girls and that is what she enjoys making the most although she also makes many ladies garments as well.  She works based on orders from individuals.  She has been engaged in this activity for more than 25 years and it’s going very well since she has never lacked work in the workshop or at home.

This new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, fasteners, buttons, and other sewing materials.  Her dream is to have her own workshop with several workers and deliver large orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, fasterners, etc.

loans.name: Song Eng

texts.en:
Song eng (pictured with her loom) is a silk weaver, and lives across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1995 and has one son who is in school.

Song eng hopes to continue her weaving business because it is a traditional profession business. That’s why she is asking for another loan of $200 USD to by silk materials.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: United We Stand Group

texts.en:
Rosemary is 23 years old.  She is married and her husband is a driver.  They have one, small child and live in Norton, about 40 kilometers from Harare.

Rosemary makes and sells school uniforms and ladies wear.  Her main issues are the rising costs of supplies and the need to replace her sewing machines. 

She does not need to rely upon her husband to put food on the table.

She will use the loan to buy cloth for school uniforms ahead of the new school term.  One day, Rosemary hopes to have a uniform factory that will supply many shops in the country

loans.use: to buy material for making school uniforms.

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raúl, de 43 años, habita en el caserío de Shururuyoc. Ahí formó su familia junto a Emma, su esposa. Ambos tienen 5 hijos a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Su principal virtud es el trabajo duro. Él se dedica a la agricultura sus principales sembríos constan de habas, alverjas, papas y cebada. Cada día cuida sus campos durante las mañanas, porque dice que el trabajo requiere mucha dedicación, para que la cosecha sea todo un éxito y de esta manera, pueda recoger toda su producción para venderla a los mayoristas de la zona; que le pagan muy bien. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la época de cosecha, pues sus hijos mayores le ayudan en la actividad agrícola, ya que el resto del tiempo estudia en la ciudad. Además comenta que hace poco incursionó en la venta de leña al por mayor y la crianza de ganado vacuno, los cuales enseba para luego venderlas a un mayor precio. Es así que obtiene ganancias extras, las cuales utiliza para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Campo Verde” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy agradecido por brindarle otra oportunidad. Además dice que su grupo de trabajo es uno de los mejores, pues todos los integrantes se mantienen puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas; por ello promete hacer lo mismo. Raúl de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir en sus cultivos de habas, alverja y papa que tiene sembrado.
texts.en:
Raúl, 43, lives in the hamlet of Shururuyoc.  He formed his family there with Emilia, his wife.  They have five children that he wants to provide a better quality of life for.  His main virtue is hard work.  He’s a farmer and his main crops are lima beans, peas, potatoes and barley.  He cares for his fields every day during the morning because he says that the work requires much dedication so that the harvest will be a success and he’ll be able to reap it in its entirety to sell to wholesalers in the area that pay very well.

What he most enjoys about his work is harvest time because his older children help him with the work; the rest of the time they are studying at the university in the city.  He also comments that recently he started selling firewood at wholesale and raising cattle that he fattens up for subsequent sale at higher prices.   He earns extra income this way that he uses to provide a better quality of life for his family.

He belongs to the “Campo Verde” (Green Countryside) communal bank and this is the sixth MFP loan where he’s very grateful for another opportunity.  He says that his work group is one of the best ones because all the members are punctual with their payments and he promises to be so too.  If Raúl were to receive your support, he will invest the requested money purchasing natural fertilizer to spread among his lima bean, pea and potato crops that he has planted.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Seuseuolefa

texts.en:
Seuseuolefa is a 55 year old widow with six children. She plants and harvests fruits and vegetables for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. 

Seuseuolefa needs a loan of WST $2500 to purchase farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 200 Talas or US $83 per week) to support her family.

In 2008, Seuseuolefa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Seuseuolefa's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Honoria

texts.es:
La señora  Honoria forma parte  del grupo las mujeres trabajando  es una señora trabajadora lo que mas le gusta es vender dulces.
Tiene la cantidad de sesenta y seis años de edad  tiene una hija de dieciocho años de edad.
Ella se dedica a la venta de  dulces  desde hace nueve meses, es divorciada, a pesar de su edad  no se da pordencida le gusta  mucho trabajar su dinero y obtener buenas ganancias.
Esta muy contenta  por que su negocio le deja muy buenas ganancias  y cuando  ella no puede salir a vender sus dulces va su hija.
Pidió  el préstamo  para  comprar  mas  dulces  para poder comprar dulces que no tiene como son: pelo pelo rico , paletas de chile , ciruelas enmieladas, chamoy , rasca rasca  y chicharrones.
Uno de sus sueños es que con sus ganancias pueda ahorrar para hacer una casa  más grande por que donde vive esta muy chiquito.
Lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es salir a vender  ya que  que le tiene mucho amor a  sus dulces.
Le da las gracias a fundación realidad por el apoyo que le ha dado para salir adelante y cumplir sus  sueños.
texts.en: Honoria is a member of the 'Mujeres Trabajando' group. She is a hard-working woman and what she most enjoys is selling sweet treats. She is 66 years old and has an 18-year-old daughter. Honoria has been selling sweet treats for nine months. She is divorced. In spite of her age, she very much enjoys working for her money and making good profits. When she cannot go out to sell her sweets, her daughter goes in her place. Honoria requested this loan to buy more sweet treats that she doesn't have such as Pelo, Pelo Rico, paletas de chile (hot spicy lollipops), honeyed cherries, Chamoy (a pickled fruit snack), Rasca Rasca and pork scratchings. One of Honoria's dreams is to save up her profits so that she can enlarge her house as her home is very small. What Honoria most enjoys about her business is going out to sell her products as she really loves her sweet treats. Honoria thanks Fundación Realidad for the support that they have given her so that she can get ahead in life and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy sweet treats - Pelo, Pelo Rico, paletas de chile (hot spicy lollipops), honeyed cherries, Chamoy (a pickled fruit snack), Rasca Rasca and pork scratchings

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 25-year-old married Lebanese man who lives with his wife and their child. He is putting all his efforts toward meeting his family’s needs. He has owned a car repair shop since 2007.  He specializes in repairing wheels, and also sells assorted spare parts. Today, he is asking to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new mechanic tools and supplies, as well as a wide variety of spare parts. In the future, he plans to apply for more Kiva loans in order to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new mechanic tools and supplies, as well as a wide variety of spare parts.

loans.name: 030701-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs Xuân, a 48-year-old married mother of three children, works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle for the past five years. The leader of a four-member group, the 030701-Đông Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group, Xuân lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.

The main hardship that Xuân faces in her enterprise is a lack of capital. In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Having repaid her two previous loans, she is requesting a new one to purchase baby livestock to raise for sale.

In the future, Xuân hopes to remodel her house, buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and earn enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise to sell in the future.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with two children and she is 39 years old.  She resides at Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, The Philippines.

Josephine operates a livestock rearing business, raising pigs to sell in order to earn a living.  She has been five years in this business.  Each month she earns PHP 15,000 doing this business.

She has requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Josephine has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Josephine wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies for her pig business.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto es un cliente distinguido que a lo largo  de sus  créditos  se  a  caracterizado por  tener  una excelente  cultura de pago y este es el segundo crédito que tiene con la institución, actualmente  se  dedica  a la  venta  de  frutas   lo  cual  le  a permitido  sacar  adelante  a su  familia,  es por ello  que  en esta  ocasión se acerco  con nosotros  para   realizar  la compra  de frutas ya  que  nos  comenta  que no  cuenta  con el  capital para  surtir  nuevamente   y poder  continuar  con la venta,  el Sr.  Roberto esta  muy  agradecido  por  el apoyo incondicional  que  a recibido  para  realizar  sus  proyectos.
texts.en: Roberto is a distinguished client who has exhibited excellent repayment behavior all along his credit history with the institution.  He currently sells fruit which has made it possible for him to support his family and this is why he approached us on this occasion: to buy fruit because he comments that he does not have capital to stock up again and continue selling.  Roberto is very grateful for the unconditional support he’s received to carry out his projects.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.en:
Camilo is a 50-year-old, married man. He and his wife have four children, and they live in Canghunog-hunog, Siquijor.

To earn a living, Camilo operates a furniture business. He has run this business for two years. Each month, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP. He explains that this is the major source of income for his family.

He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase materials for his furniture business. In the future, Camilo hopes to grow his business and have a permanent location to display his finished product.

loans.use: To purchase materials for his furniture business

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Lidia es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Renacer” grupo que está conformado por 09 socios, siendo Lidia la tesorera del grupo, cargo que ha llevado con responsabilidad. Ella tiene 64 años de edad, es casada y tiene 04 hijos independientes. Lidia se dedica a la venta de postres como gelatinas, flan, pasteles, entre otras delicias, la cual son elaborados por ella, aparte de ese negocio se dedica a la venta de  productos de belleza la cual trabaja sobre pedido que le hacen sus clientes. Lidia es una mujer empeñosa que gracias a su trabajo ha mejorado la calidad de vida de su familia. El deseo de Lidia es de seguir trabajando positivamente y de esa manera generar utilidades para su hogar. Con el fin de seguir mejorando su negocio solicito  el préstamo para la compra de insumos de sus postres como harina, leche,  huevo, manteca, azúcar y así tener que ofrecer a sus clientes. La Alcancía Comunal "Renacer"  se comprometen a seguir  trabajando bien con el Programa- Prosperidad. Adjuntamos la fotografía de la sra. Nelly.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the community bank "Renacer" [Rebirth], which is made up of nine members.   Lidia is the treasurer of the group, a job she has done responsibly.  She is 64 years old, married, and has four adult children.  Lidia works selling desserts such as gelatin, flan, cakes, and other delicacies, all of which she makes herself.  In addition to this business, she also works selling beauty products, which she does when her customers place an order.

Lidia is a hard-working woman who thanks to her work has improved her family's quality of life.  Lidia wants to continue working and generate income for her household.  So that she can continue improving her business, she is asking for this loan to purchase ingredients for her desserts such as flour, milk, eggs, butter, and sugar.  

The "Renacer" community bank promises to continue working well with the Prosperity Program. 

We have attached a photograph of Sra. Nelly.

loans.use: to purchase flour, milk, eggs, butter, and sugar.

loans.name: Claudio

texts.en:
Claudio grew up in Mexico watching his parent, which made him very keen and passionate about working the land. Since Claudio’s move to the United States 20 years ago, he has worked on farms in upstate New York and found seasonal employment at different factories during the winter months. Fascinated by the variety of produce that is grown in the U.S., Claudio made a decision seven years ago to rent land and start a farm of his own farm – sustained with support from the Grow NYC New Farmer Development program.  

When Hurricane Irene swept through upstate New York – devastating crops from Claudio's farm – it was his loyal Community Supported Agriculture (CSA) members that took immediate action to save his business. By collectively pooling their savings, Claudio’s CSA was able offset lost income and monetary damages and kept Claudio’s farm from going under. This demonstration of un-coerced, homegrown support is no less organic than the farm fresh vegetables Claudio has been selling for over seven years. With a variety of over 50 types of vegetables sold at six different markets throughout New York City, Claudio has amassed a dedicated following of patrons that can quickly discern the quality of Claudio’s produce. 

In 2011, Claudio searched for loan capital to help cover the cost of his next batch of seedlings for the spring, but like other immigrant entrepreneurs, a short credit history made it challenging for him to secure funding for his business. As a member of Grow NYC, Claudio attended a financing workshop on Dec. 1 and met ACCION USA Business Development Officer Erica Dorn, who saw potential in Claudio’s business. “I really saw some strengths in Claudio, particularly with his business momentum and strong CSA relationships,” said Erica. Looking beyond Claudio’s credit score, ACCION USA approved a microloan for seedlings, helping Claudio to stabilize his business during tough winter months.

loans.use: To purchase seedlings for Spring planting

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es: Candelario vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene más de veintisiete años  de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite mantener la calidad de su labor además de obtener las mejores cosechas, el terreno de cultivo se ubica en una zona de alta incidencia agrícola y está cercano a su residencia, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas saben que todo lo que vende es de calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo a un buen precio; Candelario es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante siempre está en la búsqueda de nuevas oportunidades que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, quiere aumentar la producción para esta temporada de siembra pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, fertilizante, herramienta, etc. Candelario es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, herbicida, fertilizante, herramienta

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Siongiroi, Kenya has a beautiful landscape made up of rolling hills and valleys stretching as far as the eye can see. In her small but clean mud and grass thatched house Judy has been able to raise 2 children who give her the determination to keep pushing on even when things get rough.

Thanks to practicing mixed farming Judy can see a bright future. Each morning at 5:00 a.m. she arises to go to her farm in the remote village of Kapkwen. 

However, the biggest challenge Judy faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village. She is seeking a 50,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy another dairy cow of good quality. She believes that another cow will enable her to sell more milk, improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.
Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, Judy is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business, and she will be able to pay back the loan. 

Judy is very motivated because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family. 
During this festive season paint a smile on Judy’s face by granting her a loan!

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow of good quality.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
B. Jennifer hails from west Nile part of Uganda. She is a student pursuing a bachelor’s degree in business administration at Makerere university business school. She came to Kampala around 2002 after finding that there was nothing possible for her in her home district.

While in Kampala things could not come normally. The desire to study and the pressure from burdens due to improper income. She started some causal work to help raise money for fees, rent, feeding and all the requirements needed in life but all the same, it was easy. By good luck, Jennifer got a friend by the names Abalo Florence who introduced her to life in Africa that she joined as a member and find that at Life in Africa; there is a lot of creativeness. Members teach each other how to make crafts out of recycling materials and she too took the idea. She has learnt how to make bracelets, paper beads and other craft products. She is now earning good living.

Where Jennifer B. stays at Nakawa quarters Kampala, is near where consumption of fire wood is very high because the nature of business there is local distillation of whisky that there is nothing used other than fire wood. So she is planning to start a fire wood scheme there since these distillers have to drive long way to look for fire wood. Jennifer is living with her mother who is also selling pancakes and along side this, her mother is ready to manage these businesses.

To make the plan a reality Jennifer is seeking a loan in the amount of 600,000/= and she will be able to repay in ten months. Below is the break down of her business:

-Three trips of firewood @ 150,000/=....450,000/=
-Loading and off loading....30,000/=
-Transport @ 20000/= per trip.... 60, 000/=
-Rent for three months @ 20,000/=..... 60,000/=
Total ……………………………………………………………. 600,000/=

loans.use: Purchase of firewood for resale

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is raising two children alone. She has extensive experience in selling children’s clothing and currently manages two sales locations in the market. Both locations have proven to be profitable, yielding Ruzanna around $800 of income each month with $3,000 invested in inventory. Ruzanna relies solely on her income to support herself and her two sons. She has about 4 years of experience in this area of retail and has been excited to witness the growth of her business. She recently made the decision to open a third vending kiosk for children’s clothing and is requesting a loan for $800 to purchase a variety of clothing that will fill the shelves of the new location. She knows that successful expansion will lead to higher profits for the business and in turn a higher income for her family.

Рузанна Аракелян сама виховує двох дітей. Вона має багатий досвід роботи в роздрібній торгівлі дитячим одягом. Зараз в неї дві торгові точки на місцевому ринку. Бізнес Рузанни досить прибутковий, щомісяця вона заробляє 800 доларів, в товар в неї вкладено приблизно 3000 доларів. Рузанна покладається лише на себе у забезпеченні родини.
