Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de consumo en su casa, en la cual vende desde  arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta productos Avon (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde,  los productos los compra en Montecristi y Manta aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local. Nos cuenta que lleva en su tienda ya por 5 años y que le va bien ya que dia a dia trata de mejorarla.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, perfumes, cremas entre otros productos y otros artículos de primera necesidad.

Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The members of the “Mi Banquito” (My Little Bank) communal bank meet every two weeks in Los Bajos de Montecristi a city known for the variety of typical products known within and outside the country like its famous "toquilla" straw hats, also known as Panama hats, despite being manufactured in Ecuador.

Gloria is a founding member of the bank and she likes it because the loans are easy to get.  She’s 35 years old, married, and has two children who are 14 and 7 years of age and who go to school and high school.  Her husband is a craftsman working with "tagua" (a nut, sometimes confused with ivory).

She has a home-based grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oils, detergents, even Avon products (beauty items, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works daily from 6am to 8pm and sometimes even later.  She buys her products in Montecristi and in Manta although most of her products are delivered to her store.  She tells us that she’s had the store for five years now and does well since she tries to improve it day to day.

She will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, perfumes and creams, among other products and some other basic need items.

Her goals are to continue forward with her business and that her store grows more every day.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel C. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old. Rodel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rodel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman who lives in Sto. Niño, South Cotabato with her family. She is a rice farmer and raises pigs in her backyard for sale. Josephine works hard to increase her harvest and to keep the pigs healthy.

Josephine's loan will be used to purchase fertilizer and pig feed. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pig feed.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Adama.  She is married and has 3 children aged 18, 16 and 11. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her because they are her husband’s nephews. In 1999 Adama established her clothing business. She began her business because she wanted to have a means of income that she could use to support her family. Adama's business is open 7 days a week and 11 hours a day.

She needs a loan of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy more of her business stock. In the future, Adama plans to expand to the point of importing directly from one of those dress making factories abroad. She wishes to build a house for her family. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothing for resale

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food production and vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. 

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. 

Analyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production and vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 41 years old, married and has two children. He runs a general store where he sells goods to people who live in his town. He has owned his store for 10 years and makes an income of KES. 20,000 a month. He plans to use this loan to buy more sugar, wheat and maize flour to sell to his customers. This will be his second loan from KADET LTD, where he has been a good client who made payments on time. In the future, James plans to open a second store and, eventually, a supermarket. James describes himself as hard working.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, wheat and maize flour for his general store.

loans.name: Nery Concepción

texts.es: Nery Concepción, de treinta y tres años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa  e hijas Gabriela y Fatima quienes estudian.  Nery se dedica desde hace más de cinco años al servicio de transportar materiales de construcción como hierro, arena, grava, ladrillos, tierra, entre otros. Ésta es la única actividad que genera ingresos para él y es con la misma que lográ llevar lo necesario para su familia. Hoy su fuente de empleo, el camión, requiere de mantenimiento y comprar algunos repuestos dado que ha estado presentando algunas fallas, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando crédito a INTEGRAL con la plena confianza de que con esto hará las reparaciones necesarias y su camión se encuentre en óptimas condiciones y no tener que detenerse con la realización de viajes y así no le falte la seguridad económica a su familia y sus hijas puedan continuar realizando sus estudios.-
texts.en: Nery Concepción, 33, lives in his own house with his wife and daughters, Gabriela and Fatima who are in school.  For over five years Nery has been running a transportation business for construction materials such as iron, sand, gravel, bricks, and dirt, amonth other things.  This is his sole source of income for providing for his family.  Now his main work tool, his truck, is in need of maintenance and repair parts.  He is requesting a loan through INTEGRAL in the hopes that the necessary repairs will be what his truck needs to be in the best working condition.  This way he will not have to delay providing services which would cut off the family income, and his daughters can continue to study.

loans.use: To provide maintenance for his truck and buy repair parts.

loans.name: Akbarali

texts.en:
Akbarali is married with four children. He lives in Kumsangir, Tajikistan, and sells men’s clothing in the central market. Akbarali’s discipline and orderliness have helped his business grow steadily over the past 11 years. He is very good with people and has a unique gift of understanding people and building relationships with them. These characteristics have helped him be successful in the competitive clothing market. 

Akbarali is requesting a loan to buy clothing to sell. His biggest dream is to have financial independence and provide a decent livelihood for his family. Akbarali hopes his current loan will promote further growth in his business and help him see his dream come true.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Cristian Camilo

texts.es:
Con apenas 20 años de edad Cristian es un microempresario que sueña con día a día sacar su negocio adelante, allí se encarga de la cría y engorde de cerdos, labor que aprendió gracias a su padre quien se ha dedicado a esto toda su vida, es así como poco a poco Cristian fue aprendiendo todo lo que se necesita en este trabajo. 

Actualmente tiene sus propios cerdos, a quienes les dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo para cuidar y tenerlos en muy buenas condiciones ambientales. Sin embargo el sostenimiento de estos cerdos es costoso, y él no cuenta ahora con el capital que necesita invertir para comprarles el cuido y todos los insumos necesarios para su bienestar, motivo por el cual hoy Cristian solicita un crédito que le ayude a hacer crecer su negocio, y proporcionalmente mejorar su calidad de vida por que su sueño es ir incrementando sus ingresos de manera que en un futuro él pueda tener un próspero negocio el cual le permita sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en:
At barely 20 years of age, Cristian is a small businessman who dreams of getting his business ahead day by day. He raises and fattens hogs, a job that he learned thanks to his father who did this his whole life. This is how Cristian learned, bit by bit, everything he needs in this work.

He now has his own hogs, to whom he dedicates the majority of his time, caring for them and keeping their environment in very good conditions. Without a doubt, it is expensive to sustain these hogs, and he does not currently have the capital that he needs to invest in buying them the food and all necessary items for their well-being. For this reason, Cristian is requesting a loan which will help him to make his business grow. This will proportionally improve his quality of life. His dream is to increase his income so that in the future he can have a prosperous business which will allow him to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase tools for raising hogs

loans.name: Fidey Roberto

texts.es: Fidey Roberto, tiene la edad 20 de  años, está soltero y vive con su madre y hermanos. El pretende con el crédito invertir en una  plantación de café. El cuenta con un terreno sembrado de café e invertirá en comprar insumos como fungicidas y abonos para obtener una mejor cosecha. El quiere lograr que el cafetal genere una buena producción con la inversión para vender un café de calidad. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su madre y hermanos, logrando así  crecer con el proyecto de la producción de café de calidad. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Fidey Roberto, 20, is single and lives with his mother and his siblings.  He intends to invest the loan in his coffee crops.  He has a field planted with coffee and he will buy supplies like fungicide and manure to obtain better harvests.  He wants his coffee plants to generate good production with this investment so that he can sell high quality coffee.  He wants to generate higher profits for the wellbeing of himself, his mother and his siblings thereby growing with his coffee growing project.

This is his first Fudecosur loan.  He has had no previous loans with state banks but Fudecosur offered him the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a 32-year-old married woman with four children, and she owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. 

She has had a cafe and bar business for a year. She started the business with 200,000 shillings and now has 1,500,000 shillings as her working capital. 

Her hardship is high prices of food and her vision is operating a five star hotel plus building commercial houses.

Annah needs the loan to buy drinks to sell.

loans.use: To buy drinks.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Leonora has a retail shop that sells electronic loads (cell phone minutes) from different networks like Globe & Smart. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 3,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy electronic loads to sell. 

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads (mobile phone minutes) to sell

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Savan, stays at home and does house work. They have six children: two sons and four daughters. Two are married, two are construction workers and the other two are garment workers. The family is living along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  

Phal is requesting a loan of $1,200 to rebuild his kitchen because it’s old and breaks.

loans.use: To rebuild his kitchen.

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
Rizalina is a 50-year-old married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 23 years old.

Rizalina makes bread for a living. She sells her products to store owners in her town. Rizalina is happy to share that she has regular customers now.

Rizalina has requested this loan to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread. She hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar and other ingredients for making bread.

loans.name: Amigas Solidarias De Miguel Grau Group

texts.es: “Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau” es una alcancía comunal integrada por 8 personas responsables y emprendedoras las cuales trabajan bien con el programa. Nilda tiene 42 años de edad y 3 hijos los cuales son dependientes de ella. Nilda tiene una bodega la cual constituyo con mucho esfuerzo ya que en un inicio empezó vendiendo golosinas en la esquina de su casa en una pequeña carreta, nos cuenta que le fue difícil empezar el negocio debido a la competencia y a la poca mercadería con la que contaba, empezó poco a poco a surtir mas su negocio con los créditos que obtiene del programa y es así que ahora su tienda cuenta con muchos productos y ahora los cliente prefieren compra en la bodega de Nilda por el servicio agradable que les ofrece, el deseo que tiene es que su bodega siga creciendo para que de esta manera pueda dar un mejor nivel de vida a sus hijos. La alcancía comunal “Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau” agradece su ayuda.
texts.en:
“Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau” (Supportive Friends of Miguel Grau) is a Communal Bank that consists of eight responsible and enterprising individuals who have worked well with the program.

Nilda is 42 years old and has three dependent children. She has a store that she built with great effort. When she started her business, she sold candy from the corner of her house using a small cart. She said that she had difficulty starting her business because of the competition and having very little merchandise in stock. Nilda gradually built up the inventory of her business using the loans she obtained through the program. Now she has a store with many more products. Her customers prefer to buy from her store because of the friendly service she offers. Nilda wants her store to continue growing so that she can provide a better standard of living for her children.

The Communal Bank “Amigas Solidarias de Miguel Grau” is grateful for the help.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Amparo Isabel

texts.es:
Amparo es socia del Banco Comunal “Bellavista” ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 38 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos.  Estudió hasta la secundaria.
Su préstamo anterior fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizo en su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace tres ciclos.
Con este nuevo préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevo soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, gaseosas, y otros insumos para su tienda, en le negocio le ayuda su mamá.  Su esposo trabaja independientemente.
La señora desea seguir y crecer en el negocio para mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es el ahorro y su ganancia.
texts.en:
Amparo is a member of Bellavista Communal Bank, located in the district of Puno, province and department of Puno.  She is 38 years old, lives with her life partner, and has two children.  She studied through high school.

Her previous loan was for the sum of 300 PEN, money she used in her business selling groceries.  She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for three loan cycles.

With this new loan of 700 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, sodas, and other supplies for her store.  Her mother helps her in the business.  Her husband works independently.

She wants to continue with the business and grow, to improve her earnings.

What she likes about the communal bank are the savings and her profit.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, sodas, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maday

texts.es:
Maday  es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima”, ubicado en el distrito Juli, provincia de Chucuito y departamento de Puno, tiene 36 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo.  Maday cuenta con estudios de educación superior.
Desde hace ocho años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de artesanías y compra y veta de ganados vacunos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/.  1,000.00 nuevo soles, comprará un ganado para luego venderlo al instante, la señora dice que  a veces lo compra en tamaño regular para engordarlo.  Trabaja junto con su mamá.  Nos cuenta que también trabaja como profesora contratada en el sector de educación.
Su deseo es tener granados mejorados, lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la puntualidad y la responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Maday is a member of the “Santa Rosa de Lima” communal bank, located in Juli district, Chucuito provnce, in the department of Puno. She is 36 years old, single, and has a son. Maday studied beyond high school level.

For the past eight years, Maday has been working with [the field partner] Movimiento Manuela Ramos. Her first loan was for the sum of 300 Soles, which she invested in her handicrafts business and in buying and raising cattle. With this new loan of 1000 Soles, she will buy a cow, with the aim of selling it later on, once she has fattened it up from its original size. She and her mother work together. Maday also works in the education sector, as a teacher on short contracts. She wishes to improve her livestock herd. What she likes about the communal bank is the punctuality and the responsibility.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Julios Ceasar

texts.en:
At 25, Julios already has three children. He is married to a housekeeper. To make a living and cover the needs of his family, Julios is working hard and his extra time is still spent in finding another source of income to ensure that he can cover his family's needs.

Julios is a farmer. He plants rice in their field in their village. He is also manages a hog-raising business. Julios has no time to go to their neighbors just for wasting time. He goes early in the morning to his field to do farming activities. After doing farming activities, Julios goes back home to feed his hogs and clean his piggery.

With regard to his hog-raising business, Julios is asking for a loan of P25,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs. He hopes to maintain the business and continue to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie's primary source of income is rice farming. She is 54 years old and is widowed. She plants and harvests rice from her two-hectare field. Last season, Tessie did not have a good harvest due to a typhoon that affected her area. She felt sad about what happened to her crops, but she was determined to meet the needs of her children. Now she hopes to improve her crop to produce an abundant harvest.      

Tessie is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to acquire herbicides and pesticides (chemicals used to control weeds and pests that affect seedling growth) to use in farming. She wants to ensure good growth of her seedlings. Tessie would like to continue receiving loans to help expand her business and to generate profits to invest in the future.

loans.use: to acquire herbicides and pesticides for farming.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухарам проживает в Гиссарском районе. Возраст, 47 лет. Разведена. У нее двое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Мухарам арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается продажей скатертей и полотенца. В этой области она десять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения тканей.
texts.en: Muharam lives in the Gissar region. She is 47 years old, divorced and has two children. Muharam has a high school degree and makes a living by selling table cloths and towels from a rented market stall. She has been working in retail for the last 10 years. Muharam is taking out this loan to purchase fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia, es comerciante de ropa nueva y chancletas, tiene casa propia, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera, ella inicio su negocio de venta de ropa con una amiga, luego tuvo experiencia en el manejo de los precios y logro instalar su propio negocio, las ventas las realiza en las zonas cercanas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, short, faldas, vestidos, ropa interior, y también un pedido de chancletas para damas, caballeros y niños, esta compra le permitirá ofrecer una nueva variedad de mercadería.
Su aspiración es crecer en su negocio, teniendo más experiencia y generando más ganancias para su hogar.
texts.en:
Sonia is a new clothes and sandal merchant.  She owns her house and lives with her son; she’s a single mother.  She started selling clothes with a girlfriend and acquired experience managing prices and managed to open her own business.  Her sales take place in nearby areas.

She is asking for the present loan to buy clothes like shorts, skirts, dresses and underwear and also for an order of women’s, men’s and children’s sandals.  This purchase will make it possible for her to offer a new variety of merchandise.  Her hope is to stay in business acquiring more experience and generating more profits for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Flores Magon Group

texts.es: Stephanie tiene 20 años de edad la cual es parte del grupo “Flores Magón”, dice que su mama fue la que la invito al grupo por que confía en ella y porque  sabe que no quedara mal en los pagos, dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque el andador donde viven así se llama y para identificarlo mas rápidamente. Ella esta casada  y tiene dos niñas pequeñas de nombres Nicole y Sofía, ella desde hace mas de tres años se dedica a hacer y vender postres como flanes, pasteles, gelatinas de 3 leches, pay de piña y de queso, empanadas y mas dice desde niña le llamo la atención cocinar y que  por eso empezó el negocio para apoyarle a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar , también platica que vende zapatos, ropa por catalogo, perfumes originales para dama y caballero, dice ella “vendo de todo un poco ya que  me gusta tener mi propio dinero y porque quiero darles a mis hijas una mejor calidad de vida”. Platica a diario que un día antes de vender los postres los hace y sale a venderlos por las calles de su población, Fanny como de cariño le dicen sus conocidos esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar moldes para pasteles, flan y para las gelatinas y para comprar materia prima como harina, gas, azúcar, leche, huevos, mantequilla, queso, levadura chocolates, fruta como duraznos, fresas, piña etc. Ella esta muy contenta trabajando con la financiera por que dice que atravez de los crédito que ha pedido a esta empresa sus negocios han ido creciendo ya  que  tiene que ofrecer a su clientela tanto en los postres como en la ropa, zapatos y perfumes. La meta de Stephanie en rentar un local en el centro de la ciudad donde pueda vender sus productos. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman María de Socorro, Reyna, clementina, Teresa, Patricia, Roció, Vianey, Carol, Norma, Mercedes todas ellas invertirán sus créditos en un taller de manualidades, puesto de dulces, tienda de abarrotes, taller de costura, bisutería, zapatos por catalogo, tienda de ropa.
texts.en: Stephanie is 20 years old and part of the group "Flores Magón." She says that her mom was the one who invited her to the group because she trusts her and because she knows that she will not default on her loans. She says that they named the group as such because the area where they live is named so and to identify it more quickly. She is married and has two small girls whose names are Nicole and Sofía. For more than three years she has made a living making and selling desserts like flan, cake, tres leches gelatin, cheese and pineapple pie, empanadas, and more. She says that since she was a girl she was drawn to cooking and because of this began the business to support her husband with the household expenses. She also tells that she sells shoes, catalog clothing, and original perfumes for women and cologne for men. She says, "I sell a little bit of everything since I like to have my own money and because I want to give my daughters a better quality of life." She says daily that one day before selling the desserts she makes them and then goes out to sell them in the streets of her city. Those that know her affectionately call her Fanny. She is requesting a loan to buy molds for cakes, flan, and gelatin, and to buy ingredients like flour, gas, sugar, milk, eggs, butter, cheese, yeast, chocolates, and fruit like peaches, strawberries, pineapple, etc. She is very happy working with the finance company because she says that through the loan that she has requested from this company her business has been growing since she now can offer her customers desserts, clothing, and perfume. Stephanie's goal is to rent a space in the center of the city where she can sell her products. The other group's members are named María de Socorro, Reyna, Clementina, Teresa, Patricia, Roció, Vianey, Carol, Norma, and Mercedes. All will invest their loans in a handicrafts workshop, sweets stand, grocery store, sewing workshop, costume jewelry, catalog shoes, and clothing store.

loans.use: to make and sell desserts.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Feliciano de 50 años, esta casado con Domitila de 48 años y tienen 07 hijos y cuentan con su propia casa ubicado en la comunidad de Vista Alegre Alta. Feliciano, es el sostén de su familia. Desde muy niño sus padres le inculcaron a trabajar en la chacra, ahora tiene un  terreno con cultivos de café. Viene trabajando 23 años en sus propias tierras, y en tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de la mano de los jornaleros  para  así avanzar con mayor  rapidez con las extracciones de los frutos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar los frutos de las plantas; ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan como recompensa la calidad de sus frutos. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta los centros de acopio ubicados en la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus granos de café. La dificultad de Feliciano es no poder contar con suficiente ingreso económico para solventar los pagos por adelantado a los jornaleros quienes le brindan el apoyo con las cosechas; es por ello que acude a los préstamos que facilita la Institución MFP. Pero ahora lo que más prioriza es sembrar más plantas de café. Este será su crédito número 08 con MFP, siente que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy querido por el resto de sus compañeros, ya que es muy solidario con ellos. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles, comprará plantas de café.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 50, is married to Domitila, 48, and they have seven children and their own house located in the community of Vista Alegre Alta.  Feliciano is the means of support of his family.  From a young age his parents taught him to work on the farm.  Now he has a plot of land with coffee plants.  He has been working his own land for 23 years, and at harvest time he counts on the help of his children and on the labor of day laborers to make quicker progress with the extraction of the fruit.

What he likes most about his job is harvesting the fruit of the plants because in this way he feels that the months of hard work pay him back with the quality of fruit.  He considers the hardest part to be transporting his products from the farm to the distribution centers located in the city of San Francisco, where they offer better prices for his coffee beans.  The difficulty Feliciano has is not being able to have enough income to make the payments in advance to the day laborers who help him with the harvests.  This is why he turns to the loans that the MFP institution facilitates.  But now what he gives priority to is planting more coffee plants.

This will be his eighth loan with MFP.  He feels that the money from the loan will help him a lot in the progress of his work.  In his communal bank he is a member who is well loved by the rest of his companions because is is very supportive with them.

With the 1,000 PEN he will buy coffee plants.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants.

loans.name: Otilio

texts.es:
El  Señor Otilio, tiene 61 años de edad,  tiene 4 hijos y vive con su esposa, Su actividad principal es el comercio cuenta con una carnicería donde vende carne de res  desde hace más de 6 Años, Don Otilio, esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de reses para el destazo  para satisfacer la demanda de su clientela, su negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico por donde transitan varios personas a sus domicilios y aldeas cercanas lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela, con el préstamo que reciba Don Otilio, le contribuirá a tener un mejor surtido y calidad de carne en su negocio y así obtener mejores ingresos para cubrir los gastos en el hogar y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia para que salga adelante y brindarles una mejor educación a sus hijos, Don Otilio trabaja los días domingo en su carnicería ya que es el día con el que las personas que trabajan en los diferentes centros trabajos de la zona reciben sueldo y los demás días le permite realizar tareas agrícolas y comprar las reses que destazara el fin de semana,
Uno de sus sueños de Don Otilio es contar con un local que reúna todas las exigencia sanitarias en su negocio y brindarle una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Danli El Paraíso, Honduras - Abril 2012

loans.use: Para la compra de Reses para el destazo para su negocio

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem is 44 years old and a married woman. She has three children, one of whom is married and lives separately. Like other local villager, Koem is in the business of farming rice in Bakan district, Pursat province. Farming rice is a very popular business and is a major source of income for the people in the region. Koem has been doing this for almost 20 years and earns a normal income of $4 per day.

In order to improve the sanitation and increase their personal hygiene, Koem would like to build a household latrine as she doesn’t have one yet. Due to inadequate capital, she is asking for a loan of 1,000 US dollars to buy construction supplies needed for constructing a latrine and pay for labor costs. She is able to request this loan thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, which has encouraged her to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguarding the health of her family and protecting the environment.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies needed for building a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Leticia  nació en un pueblo muy pequeño en el departamento de Santa Bárbara, Honduras, tiene 38 años, es una mujer luchadora y se dedica a la producción de piña y café, además tiene un negocio de insumos para el hogar desde hace 8 años,  vive con su único hijo; ya que  su esposo falleció hace un año. Ella actualmente trabaja con un refrigerador a base de gas querosén el cual le genera un gasto grande ,y aprovechando que se le daño,  ella desea adquirir un frezzer que funcione con energía solar, por lo cual está solicitando a Soluz Honduras financiamiento para la compra de este Sistema, ya que con esto se ahorrara el gasto de estar comprando querosén y podrá  ofrecer a sus vecinos de la comunidad mayor  variedad de productos   y de esa manera podrá lograr sus objetivos, obteniendo mejores  ingresos para poder brindar a su hijo un mejor futuro.

loans.use: Para la compra de un Sistema de Freezer Solar el cual mejorara las ventas en su negocio y podrá ofrecer a sus clientes más variedad de productos.

loans.name: Kamal

texts.en:
47-year-old Kamal lives his family life with 3 children in Sumgayit, Azerbaijan where he found a shelter after the break-out of Armenian-Azerbaijani conflict. 

He began his own business 6 years ago in his own house. He is the only income earner of his family.

At the begining he traded only fruits. Two year ago he borrowed $700 from Normicro. With this loan he opened a fruit counter in Sumgayit. He paid back all loan installments timely.

Now Kamal applies for $1000 to expand his business,remodel his working place and buy digital scale. Kamal hopes that with this remodeling his sales will increase.

loans.use: Purchasing digital scales, remodelling working place

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Mrs. Paulina Umeaka lives in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She is 50 years old, married with seven  children. She started her business in the year 1988. She requests a loan of $800 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and hats for sale

loans.name: Verónica Alejandra

texts.en:
Veronica is a very hard-working woman. She is married and has one young son, who is ill. Unfortunately, her husband's salary does not cover their son's medical expenses, so Vero decided to start a business selling jewelry. With this income, she hopes to buy the medicine her son needs and to give him a better quality of life. Her son's health is now imporving. At this time, Vero is looking for a loan of $1200 to buy merchandise and meet customer demand. She promises to repay the loan in 6-12 months. Vero needs your support and appreciates your confidence and generosity.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

La señora Verónica es una mujer muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por lograr sus metas, ella es casada, lamentablemente su hijo enfermó de gravedad y con el salario de su esposo no podían cubrir todos los gastos médicos de su pequeño, para poder obtener un ingreso extra, Vero decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de joyería, en el que le fue bien y gracias a esta labor pudieron obtener los medicamentos que necesitaban, ella sólo desea lo mejor para su hijo y sabe que con su trabajo logrará ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida.

Ahora su hijo se encuentra mejor de salud, y Vero solicita un préstamo por $ 1,200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y continuar con su negocio, ella promete regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 6 a 12 meses. Vero necesita de tu confianza y ayuda, agradece sinceramente tu generosidad.

loans.use: To buy jewelry for resale.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Mr. Victoriano M. is 58 years old and lives with Maria Garcia, 35. They have two children, one 9 and the other 7. Both of the children are in school.

Victoriano and María both own their own businesses. María has a fruit and vegetable store where she sells all sort of produce and Victoriano is the owner of a gym. He tells us how he invested his savings to open a gym years ago, set ting up most of the exercise equipment himself.

The gym is a great success, since he has very little competition in the area, and is busiest during summer. He is eager to continue the progress he's made in the business and wants to modernize the gym in order to improve the benefits and comforts he offers the people who come to his gym to exercise. To do so, he is applying for a loan to nvest in additional weights and supplies for the gym.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

El Sr. Victoriano M. tiene 58 años está en pareja con María García de 35 años, tienen dos hijos, uno de 9 años y otro de 7; ellos actualmente están estudiando en una escuela de la ciudad.

Ambos tienen su negocio, María tiene una verdulería donde comercializa todo tipo de hortalizas y Victoriano es dueño de un gimnasio. Victoriano nos cuenta que hace unos años atrás invirtió unos ahorros para abrir su gimnasio, el mismo monto la mayoría de los aparatos que tiene.

El gimnasio es todo un éxito, ya que no existe mucha competencia en la zona, en verano es cuando más clientes tiene. El desea seguir progresando y modernizando mas su gimnasio para poder ofrecer mayores beneficios y comodidades a las personas que acuden al local a ejercitarse; para ello, Victoriano solicita un crédito que desea invertirlo en la compra de más pesas e insumos para el gimnasio.

loans.use: Buy more weights and other supplies for the gym

loans.name: Balababa

texts.en: Balababa is a low-income person born in Baku. He is a young man of 25, and single. He started his food business two years ago with his own resources. He developed this business through his own efforts during this period. Now he wants to borrow $1,100 to buy assets for his business.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Piedad De Jesús

texts.en:
Piedad, 35 years old, is living with her husband and their two boys.  Her husband is a professional painter and is working in Santo Domingo, the capital.  Five months ago, Piedad took a loan from our organization and with it she opened a small cosmetics store. She sells lip color, lipstick, skincare products, hair lotion treatment and perfumes and women’s fragrances. As she had handled prudently her small business, she could pay back the loan before the due date.  

She runs her business within her house, even though sometimes she leaves her house to sell in the streets or the public place, especially on the week-ends.

Now she wants to enlarge the store and introduce gold-filled and silver jewelry so as to diversify her inventory and attract more people.  She has applied for a second loan that will allow her reach these goals.  The entrepreneur nourishes the hope that very soon her business will gain importance and that she’ll have her own local where she can operate the store.

loans.use: To buy gold-filled jewels and introduce silvered jewelry to her business.

loans.name: Majida

texts.en: Majida lives in the region of Aley. She has five children and is working to provide her with family a decent living. Majida does crochet work and all kinds of handicrafts. She needs a loan of $300 in order to buy the needed material for her crochet and handicraft work.

loans.use: Majida would like to buy the needed material for her crochet and handicraft work.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 35 years old and has two young children. She has been part of the community bank “Maria Antonieta” for the past four years. Here she has learned to save, to be punctual, and to be an exceptional associate of the bank. One year ago Teodora won a special certificate for good conduct from the organization. Teodora is saving to be able to buy a car so that her husband can work as a taxi driver.

For the past two years Teodora has had a small grocery store located near the cemetery in the town of Huamanga. From the same store she serves breakfast and lunch.

With the loan of 1000 dollars she hopes to buy more groceries for her business such as oil, rice, beans, sugar, and milk. She will also buy meat and vegetables for her prepared meals.

At the moment Teodora and her family live in the store. For this reason her dream is to own a house. It would be big and have a garage, and a separate room for each of her children.

loans.use: To stock her grocery and buy ingredients for prepared meals

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She sells women's clothes, shoes & bags to workers in offices and banks. She started her own sales store in 1993. She is a LAPO client and is requesting a loan of $1,200 to enable her buy more clothes, bags and shoes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more women's clothes, shoes & bags for sale

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 38 years old and is a married woman with 5 children, ages 19,15,10, 8 and 5 years old. Paulina owns a small food vendor store, which she started in 2002. Everyday, she works from 6.30am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Salelologa E Centre - Group 2

texts.en:
Salelologa is the capital village of Savaii Island. The central market, the wharf, and the bus station are located in Salelologa. The hub of retail business is also in this village. Therefore, a large number of households are engaged in retail businesses which target neighbouring villages. The women in this group are engaged in retail businesses. Most of the commodities sold in Saleloga are purchased from the capital town, Apia, which is located across the island of Upolu. The members of this group have already undergone the required 4 session training from SPBD and are ready to receive their loans to expand and improve their retail businesses.

The Salelologa E Centre is located in a largely agricultural area and the people in the community still subsist on farming and vegetable gardening. The women who formed the Salelologa E Centre are determined to improve their present living conditions. With the help of small loans from SPBD they will be able to upgrade their farms and vegetable gardens and also expand into other income-generating activities including: sewing, Elei printing, and pancake-making. These activities are a good way of augmenting their household income.

Sieni F. (53, married, 5 children) wants to purchase sugar, salt, onions, soup, flour, potatoes, and noodles to sell at the Salelologa market.

Sulu M. (45, married, 9 children) needs equipment for her cattle and pig farm.

Mele M. P. (41, widowed, 2 children) sells pork cakes and pancakes (round lumps of fried dough). She needs a stove, flour, sugar, oil and other ingredients to bake the cakes.

Aotoa F. (28, married, 1 child) produces ice cakes (ice cream). She will use her loan to purchase plastic cups, sugar and other materials.

Asenati Masoe P. (32, married, 1 child) sells ice cakes and pancakes. She will use her loan to buy a stove, flour, and other materials.

Tuisuesue V. (40, married, 8 children) will use her loan to sell pancakes and coffee.

loans.use: Purchase ovens, flour, sugar and other baking materials, etc.

loans.name: Tho

texts.en:
Mrs. Tho C. is a 36-year-old widow who makes around $6 per day selling chickens and scanning photographs. She has one daugter who is attending school and they live in Slaket Village, Kampong Thom Province, Cambodia.

C. is seeking a loan of $200 to purchase more chicken to sell. This loan will help her to expand her business, support her family, and pay for her daughter's school expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more chicken stocks for selling

loans.name: Nop El Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nop E. is the group leader of six in Kanh Chong Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She buys a Kor fruit which can be made into pillows in Cambodia. Her husband, Mr. YuS. Sal, is a subsistence farmer. They have one child who is enrolling in state school.

Over time, Mrs. Nop E.’s business activity has improved so she now wants to expand it. Unfortunately, Mrs. Nop E. does not have enough money to buy Kor fruit so she decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Nop E. obtained a loan to start her business. Mr. Him S.'s wife will receive the loan instead of Mr. Him S., so only she is shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy Kor fruit in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Mon's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Mon S. (his wife is shown in the picture on the right) was selected to be a group leader of two families for a loan from Maxima. All of the group members live along National Road Number Two, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Mon S., 52, (not in the picture) and his wife, Mrs. Hoy Him, 51, were married in 1973 and have six children, two sons and four daughters. Three of their children have full time employment and two are in school. Mon has been a Motor Remoque Taxi driver for six years, and his wife stays at home taking care of the children. Now he is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a new trailer to replace the old one.

2-Mrs. Chanthea N., 40, (shown in the picture on the left) and her husband, Mr. Sam-aun Pol, 44, were married in 1986 and have two daughters who are in school. Chanthea has been selling grocery items for four years, while Mr. Hoy has been a policeman since 1980. Chanthea is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for the motor taxi and expand the business of selling grocery items.

loans.name: Marle Janet

texts.es:
Marle is 38 years old. Her 4 children are the meaning of her life and her reason to keep fighting to get ahead. She and her husband, Armando, have the responsibility to to get their children ahead, which Marle works very hard for.

She has sold groceries and necessities for some time, this business is the economic sustenance of herself and her children, for whom she supplies the necessities for their studies. She enjoys her work very much, and thanks to her charisma she has a large clientele. By this means she helps her husband, an employee of a company in their area, with some of the expenses.

Marle's proposal is to expand her business, to buy more edible products, and above all to improve her home, since she would later like to sell dinner in the evenings. For this, she considers it necessary to request a loan, in order to fulfill her objectives.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva volunteer

Marle tiene 38 años y cuatro hijos quienes son el significado de vivir y seguir luchando por salir adelante, junto a su esposo Armando tienen la responsabilidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos, para lo cual a Marle trabaja arduamente. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad desde hace algún tiempo atrás, este negocio es el sustento económico de ella y de sus hijos, a quienes les brinda lo necesario para sus estudios. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que gracias a su carisma cuenta con una gran clientela y desde luego, mediante esto apoya con algunos gastos a su esposo quien es trabajador de una empresa de su localidad. El propósito que tiene Marle es ampliar su negocio, comprar más productos comestibles y sobre todo mejorar la estructura de su vivienda, ya que posteriormente quiere vender comida por las noches, por ello que necesariamente estima de dinero que solicita en calidad de préstamo, para cumplir con su objetivo.

loans.use: Increase of merchandise for her grocery shop and to establish a space in her home to sell dinner in the evening.

loans.name: Sanela

texts.en:
Sanela is a twenty-six year old divorced woman and mother of one child.  She works as a salesgirl in a shop in Doboj and earns a salary of 500 KM.  

This is Sanela's first loan, in the amount of 1 200 KM ($900), and she will use it to buy compost to prepare her field for the winter.  Her wish is to increase her vegetable production in the spring.

loans.use: To buy compost.

loans.name: Osatohanmwen

texts.en:
Osatohanmwen E. lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and has been in this business for a long time. She buys drinks from distributors in Benin City. Due to the increase in the number of customers that purchase her drinks, she hopes to buy more to meet their demands. This will enable her to retain her customers. She needs the loan amount of $875 to buy more drinks for sale.

Osatohanmwen is 38 years old and married with 2 children. Standing with her are her two daughters. She says "thank you" to all who will make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng I. was born in 1952 and she now lives in Boeng village in Takeo province. She has a small piece of land for cultivating rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Keo Bu, is a policeman who gets a small salary to support his family. Even though she and her husband have different businesses, they still cannot support their family well. Thus, Mrs. Sieng I. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.name: Geidy Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Geidy pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Positiva”, ubicado en el Jr. Huancavelica Nº 457, distrito de Callería, provincia de Coronel Portillo, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 24 años de edad, es madre de un hijo menor de edad que aún depende de ella, es casada y su esposo trabaja en el Hospital de Yarina en el área Administrativa. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 decide invertir en la venta de productos de bellezas. Tiene un año trabajando con el banco comunal.

En la actualidad es profesora de Educación Secundaria y cuenta con el mismo negocio, pero aún no ejerce su carrera. En las mañanas se dedica a su hogar y por las tardes reparte sus productos a sus clientes.  

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará colonias, talcos, cremas de manos y cuerpo, lápiz labial, etc. 

Geidy agradece muy en especial al banco comunal de Manuela Ramos por el apoyo que siempre le brinda.
texts.en:
Geidy belongs to the “La Positiva” comunal bank, located on Huancavelica Street, No. 457, Callería district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 24 years old and she is the mother of a young child who still depends on her. She is married and her husband works in the Yarina Hospital in administration. With the first loan S/. 300.00 she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to invest in selling beauty products. She has been working with the communal bank for one year. She is currently a high school teacher and has her business, but she still doesn’t work in her area of study. In the mornings she takes care of her home, and in the afternoons she sells her products to her clients. With this loan of S/. 1,200.00, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy colognes, talc powders, hand and body lotions, lipstick, etc. Geidy is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos communal bank for the help it always provides to her.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy colognes, talc powders, hand and body lotions, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Loh

texts.en: Loh M. is 55 years old and makes a living selling freshwater fish. She uses a bicycle to transport her fish and sells them traveling from village to village in her area. Loh is currently earning around of $5 per day. She is a mother of seven children, three of whom are employed and are working in a garment factory. The other four children are in school. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver who earns about $5 a day. Together they meet family's food needs. To make transportation in her business easier, Loh is requesting a loan to purchase a motorcycle to replace her old bicycle for her business travels.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Zaib-Un-Nisa Abdul Ghaffar Group

texts.en:
My name is Zaib-un-Nisa. I am 40 years old and married. I have resided in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Borewala is famous for its warm and kind hearted people. 

I completed my education until 10th standard, and then married a kind man named A. G.. My husband is a security guard in a company. He supported my wish to study further, but I didn’t get to study because my presence at home became essential. 

We have three children, two sons and one daughter. My eldest son completed his education until 10th standard and then started his own business. He runs a grocery shop in the community, where people buy groceries. My youngest son reads in 9th standard and my daughter reads in kindergarten. I belong to an embroidery business. I do this work to pay off the school fees of my younger children. 

I’m happy to share the financial burden of our family with my husband and son. I am applying for a loan to buy groceries to increase the profits for my son. 

I am a group leader of some women in my locality. Bilquis baji wants a loan to buy wheat to resell. Allah Rakhi baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for her loading business. Naseem Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits for her fruit selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Blanca Adriana

texts.es:
Blanca M. es una dama muy trabajadora cuya labor es la venta de alimentos vendiendo especialmente hot dogs preparados por ella misma y siendo vendidos en el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega.

Actualmente se ha destacado por realizar excelentes hot dogs el cual agradan mucho a sus clientes por lo que lo consumen esporádicamente. La razón por la que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito parpa la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración de dichos alimentos. Es por esta razón que espera en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con este crédito y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca M. is a hardworking woman whose work is selling food, especially hot dogs that she makes herself. They are sold in the central market of the city of Chinandega.

Actually, she has emphasized she has made excellent hot dogs which her customers like a lot, and because of this they eat them sometimes. The reason she has now come to Ceprodel is to obtain a loan for the purchase of quality material for the elaboration of the aforementioned foods. It's for this reason that she hopes that Ceprodel will provide her with this loan and she will move forward in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy quality material

loans.name: Yanett Ela

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Llapanchik que significa Todos en quechua.
Yanet es soltera y tiene 29 años, Yanet tiene un Multiservicios en la casa de un familiar, en donde vende abarrotes, útiles de escritorio, regalos, brinda servicios de fotocopiado, actividad que realiza con el apoyo de su mama y hermana.
Yanet necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cuadernos.
Los sueños de Yanet es ampliar su multiservicio.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Llapanchik Communal Bank, which means "Everyone" in Quechua. Yanet is 29 years old and single. Yanet has a multi-service store in a relative's home where she sells groceries, desk supplies, gifts, and photocopying services, which she provides with the help of her mother and sister. Yanet needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of notebooks. Yanet dreams of exanding her multi-service store.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of notebooks.

loans.name: Antoinette

texts.en:
Antoinette D. is married and has one child. She has received schooling through senior high.

Antoinette sells food supplies like groundnuts, maize, and millet in Abura, which she has done since 2001. She also prepares beverages for sale. Antoinette uses her income to assist her husband with the housekeeping expenses.

Antoinette will use this loan as additional capital to increase her sales of food supplies like groundnuts, maize, and millet to meet the increase in demand from her customers. She will also buy more millet for the production of beverages. With the new profits from her expanded business, Antoinette plans to reinvest back for the expansion of her trade in food supplies.

loans.use: To buy food supplies like groundnuts, maize and millet to sell

loans.name: Souadou

texts.fr: Souadou B. est une veuve de 46 ans avec 7 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle s’adonne à la vente de pâte d’arachide et de fruits (orange) pour subvenir aux besoins familiaux. Elle voudrait avec ce prêt renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
Souadou B. is a widow of 46 with 7 children for whom she is responsible. She sells peanut butter and fruit (oranges) to support her family. She would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of peanut butter and oranges

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Shop businesses are very common in Tanzania and the rest of the African cities due to their accessibility and the availability and inexpensiveness of the business goods involved. Sofia C. runs a shop business in the Mbagala ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of goods, including cereal crop products. She purchases her goods from the wholesale shops and sometimes directly from the producers. She needs a loan of Tshs 600,000 to boost up the business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Рахимов Абдусаттор житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 56 лет, женат и имеет семенрых детей. Семья очень большая , и поэтому ему приходиться очень много работать для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже семь лет. Прибыль уходит на бытовые расходы его семьи. Для развития бизнеса он обратился за кредитом. Дополнительная сумма поможет ему разнообразить ассортимент и таким образом привлечет новых клиентов.
texts.en:
R. Abdusattor is a resident of the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 56 years old, is married and has seven children. His family is very large and because of this he has to work a lot in order to provide for his family. He has a store where he sells food products. He has been in this business for seven years now. The income goes to household expenses of his family. He has turned to us for credit in order to grow his business. The additional sum will help him to add variety to his assortment and to attract new customers this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio S. manages a small parcel of land. He is 53 years old already and has four children. He is a tenant of the land he is tilling. He gets a share from the harvest. He uses his harvest to feed his family and buy their other needs.

He wants to avail a loan of PHP 8,000. He will use the loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, insecticide and seeds. He believes that his loan will give him better produce compared to his last harvest.

CEVI helps small business grow. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother, full of hopes and dreams. She is married to Leonardo and they have six children: Jasmin - 26, Leorio - 23, Jun Leo - 21, Jordan Rey - 18, Nieves Leo - 16, and Gabriel - 5. Her two eldest children are newly graduated from college and the other four are still studying. She is proud of her children, for they really give attention in their studies. They live in the village of San Isidro Ilagan, Isabela. 

Susan wants to help her husband in providing for the needs of their children by venturing into RTW (ready to wear clothes) and blanket vending. She purchases her products in Baguio City and then sells in their village at a higher price in order to generate income. 

She is asking to borrow a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy more products to later sell in their village. Susan is also engaged in selling furniture, as her part-time business. She uses canvassed prices from different furniture business establishments and will contract buyers later on to have extra income. Susan and her husband promise to give their best to be able to give their children the education they require for their future. Susan never gives up, no matter how hard life is. Education is the best thing she knows to give to their children. She is very thankful to God, who is always there to guide her family.

loans.use: Business Capital.

loans.name: Aquilinia

texts.en:
Aquilinia L. is from the village of Anonang, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 48 years old. Aquilinia is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aquilinia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling crabs in the local community. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling crabs to tourists and local community members. Aquilinia has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine Pesos (about $62 US) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Aquilinia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aquilinia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional crabs to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Aquilinia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy crabs for resale

loans.name: Manuela Modesta

texts.es: Doña Manuela R. tiene 45 años de edad, es casada de oficios Artesana,  “Elaboración de fajas Típicas”, habita junto  a su esposo e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con tres empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de laborar en tejidos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Chisocop del  Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Manuela R. is 45 years old, married, and works as a weaver in the production of traditional decorative belts. She lives with her husband and children. Her and her husband both work in the same business and employ three people. She has worked as a weaver for twelve years.She lives in Paraje Chisocop de Cantón Poxlajuj, in the department of Totonicapán, in Guatemala.

Recently the demand of her clients has increased but economic consitions mean that she does not have sufficient funds to increase her capital. For this reason she came to Asociación ASDIR to ask for a loan in order to buy raw materials. In this way she hopes to increase sales in order to improve the situation of her family and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Cathy Coffman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying primary materials for weaving

loans.name: Raji

texts.en: Raji is 37 years old and married with three children. She sells second-hand clothes and shoes and has been in this business for the past ten years. Raji is a LAPO client, who is now requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more second-hand clothes and shoes to sell. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Anastancia Lima

texts.pt:
Anastância Lina M. nasceu em Sofala, tem 36 anos de idade, vive maritalmente é mãe de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre os12 aos 22 anos. Os dois mais velhos abandonaram os estudos a mais nova é que esta a frequentar a 9ª classe. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mãe, enviando lhe uma sexta básica no valor de 1.000.00MT mensalmente e consegue poupar 500.00MT por mês.

Anastância sai de Sofala com sua mãe ainda criança e passam a viver em casa do seu avo paterno. Inicia os estudos e quando freqüentava a 7 classe fica grávida do seu primeiro filho e teve que interromper os estudos e passa a viver em casa do seu marido, este que a maltratava dando batendo (violação domestica) e separa se dele.

Regressa para casa do seu avo e consegue arranjar um emprego na Escola Militar de Musica como praça e consegue se enquadrar no Ministério da Defesa apos a Desmobilização (Acordo Geral da Paz em 1994). Hoje e funcionaria permanente a mais de 6 anos como guarda fronteira trabalhando 24h( sendo um dia de trabalho e dois de folga)consecutivamente, auferindo um valor mensal de 5.200.00MT.

Aproxima se a Hluvuku e Kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00MT para dar continuidade da sua obra (compra de material de construção). Este é o  terceiro empréstimo de Anastancia na Hluvuu e primeiro com Kiva.
 O primeiro de 6.000.00MT foi usado para legalização do seu terreno, o segundo de 10.000.00MT para dar inicio da sua obra. E estes 15.000.00MT serão usados para dar continuidade do murro da sua residência.

Está confiante que vai pagar sem problemas, pois conta com ajuda do seu marido e irá pedir um outro credito para construir a casa do seu filho e um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Anastancia Lina M. was born in Sofala, she is 36 years old and lives with his husband and her 3 children, who are between 12 and 22 years old. The two oldest stopped studying, is the youngest who is still studying on the 9th grade. Besides her children she is responsible for her mother, and send her a monthly allowance of 1,000MT and is able to save 500MT a month. Anastancia left Sofala with her mother when she was still a child and went to live at her grandfather’s house. She started studying but left school when she gets pregnant of her first child on the 7th grade and moved to her husband’s house, he hit her constantly and because of domestic violence she separates from him. She returned to her grandfather’s house and was able to obtain a job at the Military School of Music as a soldier and was able to work at the Defense Ministry after the General Peace Agreement in 1994. Now she is a permanent frontier guard with more than 6 years working 24 hours (1 days of work and 2 days of rest) consecutively, earning 5,200MT monthly. She approached Hluvuku and Kiva to request a loan for 15,000MT to keep on building (to buy construction material). This is her third loan with Hluvuku and first with Kiva. The first 6,000MT was used for legal paperwork of her land, and the second for 10,000MT was used to start the construction. And this one for 15,000MT will be used to continue with the wall of her house. She is confident she will pay without any trouble, because she has her husband’s help and she will return to request another loan to build a house for her son and a commercial store.

Translated from Portuguese by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Perlas Y Diamantes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Perlas y Diamantes” están representadas por la señora Angélica y conformada por 12 miembros ellas van cursando su segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando responsabilidad, honestidad y ganas D. salir adelante para seguir creciendo con el apoyo económico que se les brinda la institución. La mayoría D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. productos como ropa, cotillones, pan, cosméticos, comida, dulces y al servicio domestico y a la atención D. cafés Internet. El esfuerzo que vienen realizando desD. su primer ciclo recién empiezan a tener frutos por lo que le nuevo requerimiento del crédito estar destinado al crecimiento D. sus negocios y al incremento D. su mercadería para ofrecer al mercado un producto D. mejor calidad y mas competitivo. Las expectativas D. las socias es tener un negocio productivo que les brinD. a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida y una mejor educación para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Angélica represents the Perlas y Diamantes group, which is comprised of 12 members. They are in their second cycle with the Institution. They demonstrate responsibility, honesty, and the desire to get ahead in order to keep growing with the economic support the Institution offers them. The majority of the members sell products like clothes, party favors, cosmetics, food, and sweets. They also are involved in activities like maid service and running Internet cafes. The effort they have been making since their first cycle is recently starting to bear fruit. The newly needed loan is for business growth and an increase in merchandise to be able to offer a better quality and more competitive product to the market. The members’ expectations are to have a productive business that gives their families a better quality of life and a better education for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene es socia del Banco Comunal Maria Antonieta.
Marlene es soltera, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Marlene viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende quesos y cereales que adquiere en los diferentes pueblos de la región de Ayacucho.
Marlene necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y quesos.
Marlene sueña con brindar una buena educación a sus hijos y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of the Maria Antonieta Communal Bank. Marlene is 28, single, and has two children. Marlene travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells cheese and basic grains, which she gets from different towns in the Ayacucho area. Marlene needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy basic grains and cheese. Marlene’s dreams are to give her children a good education and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and cheese

loans.name: Taiwo

texts.en: Taiwo is 43 years old and married with three children. She sells vegetables to make a living. She sells her vegetables in the mornings to her clients to enable them eat the vegetables fresh. She is requesting a loan of N60,000 to purchase more vegetables to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea T. was born in 1968 and she now lives in Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Heam Samnang, helps her with the farming. Although they try to work hard, they still do not earn enough income to support their household. Thus, Mrs. Sophea T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. All her children are married and living separately. Her husband is on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, desde hace cuarenta años  la señora Maritza O. se dedica a su actividad de elaboración y venta de tortillas las que son comercializadas por ella misma todos los días desde las cuatro de la mañana.
El negocio lo heredó de su mamá habiendo aprendido de ella la manera en que se elaboran las tortillas. Ella solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para continuar elaborando las riquísimas tortillas y así mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por su hijo y su mamá a la que tiene que mantener por su avanzada edad.
texts.en:
In the department of León, Sra. Maritza O. has been dedicated to her business of making and selling tortillas for 40 years. She sells her products every day starting at 4am.

Maritza inherited this business from her mother, who taught her how to make tortillas. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy ingredients so that she can continue producing her delicious products. This will enable her to support her family, which consists of her son and her elderly mother.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making tortillas

loans.name: Long

texts.en: Long L., 44, a local farmer who has been growing rice since 1985, is married to Keo La, 45, who owns a machine that provides a battery-charging service for neighbors. This couple has been married for many years and is blessed with three school-aged children. Long L.’s husband has gained much income from his service, but unfortunately the machine often breaks down, thus affecting his income. To solve the problem, Long L. is requesting a loan to hire a mechanic to repair it.

loans.use: To hire a mechanic to repair the battery-charging machine

loans.name: Mirna Guadalupe

texts.es: Mirna Guadalupe A. D. M. D. 45 años D. edad, resiD. en Mejicanos, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Vive junto a su hijo D. 13 años D. edad, el cual se dedica a estudiar y su madre la cual se dedica al trabajo del hogar. Mirna posee una venta D. verduras en una D. los mercados más grandes D.  San Salvador el cual es llamado Mercado Central, ahí las personas van a comprar los producto al por mayor. Es por esto que Mirna solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda contar con el capital necesario para comprar más productos, como granos básicos, más verduras y comprar fruta D. manera que tenga más que ofrecer a los clientes del lugar. Mirna se esfuerza día con día por su hijo y su madre, los cuales depenD. absolutamente D. ella, es por esto que Mirna desea poder aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirna Guadalupe Arnero D. Martinez is 45 years old. She lives in Mejicanos, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her 13 year old son. He is a student and his mother does the housework. Mirna has a vegetable stall in one of the biggest markets in San Salvador named the Mercado Central. People go there to buy products wholesale. It's because of this that Mirna is asking for a loan with which she can have the necessary capital to purchase more products, such as basic grains and more vegetables. Also, to buy fruit so that she can have more to offer her customers. Mirna works hard day after day for her son and her mother who depend totally on her. This is why Mirna wishes to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en:
Mrs. C. is 27 years of age, is married, and is the mother of a school-aged child. She works sewing clothes in the garment industry.

Mrs. C.’s husband (shown in the photo) is a military policeman and also a taxi driver. He has been using his older motor as a taxi many years. Unfortunately, his taxi has broken and this has affected his income. To solve the problem, Mrs. C. requests a loan to repair her husband’s old taxi.

loans.use: To repair her husband's old taxi

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: Karla Patricia tiene 40 años, ella tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 13 años de edad a su cargo. Su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de venta de recarga. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una mujer muy responsable y abnegada por lo que siempre está buscando la manera de proporcionar a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar, lamentablemente Karla no pudo terminar sus estudios y solamente finalizo el 6 grado de primaria a pesar de estos inconvenientes ella ha logrado salir adelante con este negocio que es su único medio de vida. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de suficientes recargas para su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes lo que le soliciten. El sueño de ella es agrandar su negocio para obtener más ganancias y ayudarle a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia, 40, has two children, 19 and 13 years of age, under her care. She sells phone card recharging services. She has been in this line of work for 4 years. She is a responsible, self-sacrificing woman who is always looking for ways to provide her children with the opportunity to study. Sadly, Karla wasn't able to finish school; she only completed 6th grade. Despite these inconveniences, she has managed to get along; this business is her only source of income. The funding will be used to buy sufficient recharges to meet the demands of her customers. Her dream is to enlarge her business so that her profits will increase and she will be able to help her children.
