Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy phone recharges.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge T. P., tiene 36 años de edad vive en el barrio Nuevo Milenio de Soledad en  el departamento del Atlántico, con su cónyuge y 3 hijos entre los 4 y 12 años actualmente  estudiando. 
Por iniciativa propia inició su taller de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas una vez se había capacitado con el  Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje  SENA en mecánica de Motos, desde entonces  su negocio ha progresado lo mismo que su clientela por la calidad  y la honestidad que caracterizan a  Jorge la cual aplica en su taller cuando presta los servicios que ofrece. 
Con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, ha recibido 4 créditos, los cuales ha invertido en adecuaciones de su vivienda y en el taller, del que ha vivido y sostenido a su familia, pues trabajando como mecánico  ha logrado superar muchos obstáculos en su vida.  En la actualidad aspira a obtener un crédito por valor de $1.800.000 que invertirá  en la compra de inventario como bujías, llantas rines cables, prensas pinzas y en general repuestos para la reposición y arreglo de las motos    de sus clientes.
Su sueño inmediato es lograr un mejor posicionamiento de su microempresa y ver a sus hijos convertirse en “grandes profesionales” y personas de bien. Su desafío más crucial es la innovación de algunos de sus procesos y tratar de sobresalir en su campo de acción, pues vive en un barrio deL Municipio de Soledad, donde consigue clientes de toda índole y nivel socioeconómico, rodeado  de otras comunidades, donde el medio de transporte principal es la moto, lo cual  hace que su negocio esté constantemente visitado por propietarios o conductores de estos vehículos que necesitan de su servicio.
texts.en:
Jorge T. P. is 36 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Nuevo Milenio in the city of Soledad, which is situated in the Department of Atlántico. He and his wife have three children between the ages of 4 and 12, all of whom attend school. Out of his own initiative, he started a motorcycle repair and maintenance shop. Jorge at one time trained with SENA (the National Learning Service) in a motorcycle mechanics program. Since then, his business has grown and his customers know him for his honesty and the quality of service he provides in his shop.

Jorge has received four loans with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which were invested in making improvements to both his home and his shop. Working as a mechanic, he has managed to support his family and overcome many obstacles in his life. He now hopes to obtain a loan valued at 1,800,000 COP in order to purchase inventory such as spark plugs, tires, rims, cables, screws, clamps, and other replacement parts needed to repair his customers’ motorcycles.

His immediate dreams are for his micro-business to be better positioned and to see his children become successful professionals and good people. His most crucial challenge is innovating some of his processes so that he can become more successful. Since he lives in a neighborhood within the city of Soledad, he has customers from all socioeconomic levels and from many of the surrounding communities where the primary mode of transportation is the motorcycle. Jorge’s business is frequently visited by the owners and drivers of these vehicles that are in need of service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase motorcycle parts to keep in stock

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: La Sra. Margoth vive en el Barrio San Martín de la localidad de El Torno, esta casada y tiene dos hijos  que se encuentra en edad escolar, su actividad es la venta de comida, donde vende almuerzos y tambien platos extras, su esposo se dedica al transporte, es chofer asalariado el destino del crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en su negocio, tiene domicilio propio, el cual le ha costado mucho tenerlo, y sus nuevas metas es llegar a tener un negocio de comida reconocido en la comunidad. Es una persona responsable y muy trabajadora, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sra. Margoth lives in the San Martín neighborhood of the town of El Torno. She is married and has two school age children. Her business is the sale of food. She sells lunches and small meals. Her husband is involved in transportation. He is a salaried driver.

The purpose of the loan applied for is to invest in her business. She has her own home which has cost a lot. Her new goal is to have a food business which is recognized in the community. She is a responsible and hardworking person and is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in making the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of food

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza.
Bernardo es conviviente, tiene 40 años y 2 hijos, Bernardo vende pasamanería como platos, ollas, en las diferentes ferias de la región, además vende ropa variada de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Nery García.
Bernardo necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de uniformes por la campaña escolar.
Bernardo sueña con tener un taller de confecciones de ropa y tener su empresa.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the Nobleza (Nobility) Community Bank. He is married, 40-years old, and has two children. He sells a variety of goods such as dishes and saucepans in various markets in the area. He also sells clothing in the Nery García market. Bernardo needs a loan of 2,500 soles to buy school uniforms to sell at the beginning of the school year. His dreams are to run a workshop making clothes and have his own business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy school uniforms to sell

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa’s long term goals are to build sustainable businesses and to fund her five children’s college education.  With the support of ASHI and Kiva, she is hopeful that her businesses will generate steady income to improve her financial stability and her family’s quality of life.

In 2009, Theresa joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. When she received her previous loans, she invested the money in buying and selling of RTW (ready-to-wear-clothes) and later expanded the business with more inventory. For supplementary income, she is also embarked in an Electronic Loading business such as Smart load, Globe load, and Sun load.

Now on her 3rd loan, she requested 10,000 PHP as additional working capital for her E-load business. She is positive that her businesses will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders from her RTW and solid clients of her E-loading business at home.

She dreams of having a permanent space in the marketplace where she can sell her RTW products as well as provide satisfactory E-loading to her customers. She hopes to have successful businesses that can provide her with a good life that is moving away from the poverty line. 

Theresa T. is a 47-year-old woman from town of Binangonan, Rizal Province in the Philippines. She is grateful to ASHI for offering her happiness in life and group support in achieving her goals.

loans.use: additional working capital for her E-load business.

loans.name: Battogtoh

texts.en:
Battogtoh, 48 years old, lives with his wife and five children in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in Uvs Province, Mongolia. His oldest daughter, Tsetseggerel, is 20 years old and a university student, while his oldest son, Altangerel, is 22 and helps in his parents' business.

Battogtoh and his wife operate two businesses in their town. In 2001 they started a raw material trading business that sells a variety of materials including sheepskin, wool, and cashmere. In 2005 they purchased 20 hectares of land to plant wheat, a seasonal business not operating in the winter.

Battogtoh is a great businessman and father. He says, “Me and my wife are working hard to purchase a house for my oldest son and to create a bright future for all of my children.” He is now requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~ 1830 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of wheat seed for his agriculture business and more wool and cashmere for his raw material trading business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh K. est un chauffeur  taximan qui a acheté sa voiture grâce à des prêts de l'institution .actuellement il sollicite un crédit pour réparer cette voiture qui est une source de revenu pour lui.Sans cette voiture il ne dispose d'aucune revenu pour faire vivre sa famille qui se trouve dans un village à 7 km de Mbour
texts.en:
Mr Cheikh K. is a taxi driver, who bought his car thanks to loans from the institution. He is currently asking for a loan in order to repair this car which is a source of income for him. Without this car he has no income to support his family, who live in a village 7 kilometers from Mbour.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car repair

loans.name: Rât

texts.en:
Rât R. is a 58-year-old resident of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She and her husband have five children: four are married and work, and the other is single. Rât R. earns a living by producing and selling cement jars for profit. She and her husband always help each other to produce their many sets of jars to sell. She also receives orders from middlemen, who then need to wait a week for their order.
Recently, Rât R. has built a pig pen where she hopes to raise pigs for extra income. As she does not have any capital yet, Rât R. has decided to request a loan of $1000 to buy pig food and ten piglets to begin breeding. Rât R. and her son are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig food and ten piglets

loans.name: Luch

texts.en: Mrs. Luch T. is 50 years old and a villager who lives in Kanlaeng Khla village in Takeo province.  She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice for a living.  Aside from farming, she also makes baskets to sell to earn a small income to support her family. In order to increase her income to improve the family, Mrs. Luch T. decided to ask for a loan to buy two piglets for breeding. Mrs. Luch T. is a widow with two children; one is a seamstress in a garment factory and the other one is attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy two piglets

loans.name: Hilda Rosa

texts.en:
Hilda Rosa R. S. is a 42-year-old pepper producer and mother of five who lives in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles de San Carlos, located in Northern Costa Rica. Hilda is a dedicated mother and producer. She plans to focus her efforts on the planting and harvest of Tabasco peppers. Hilda works in cooperation with her family to strike a balance between accomplishing the daily tasks associated with agricultural production and the completion of domestic responsibilities. In general, the work day is divided into mornings and afternoons. In the morning, the domestic tasks are carried out such as cooking, cleaning and caring for younger siblings. Afternoons are generally dedicated to harvest and planting – working the land as needed. The land they work is their own. 

Hilda´s husband works at a local orange producing factory as a harvesting labourer in order to supplement family income. The money he earns helps pay bills for electricity and buys food. The rural zone where Hilda and her family live is one of the few places in Costa Rica without running water; the family must pump water from a nearby well as needed. Hilda is working hard towards the sustenance of her family, striving to reap the maximum benefits from her land and labour. 

Although this is an individual loan, the community in which Hilda and her family live is very close-knit and interdependent. Neighbours help and support one another by sharing experiences and expertise acquired over the years. All individual members of the Coquital community are dedicated to the improvement of living conditions for the region as a whole.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Tabasco peppers. Specifically, the loan will be used to finance the purchase of a variety of seedlings and necessary agricultural nutrients, fertilizers and chemicals in order to ensure a healthy harvest. All labour and logistical tasks associated with production will be carried out by Hilda with the help of her family members in the region of Coquital de Los Chiles, located in the Northern Region of Costa Rica. Hilda will need roughly one year before her peppers will reach maturity and be ready for harvest. In the past, it has been difficult for Hilda to gain access to financial services and technical advice regarding farming practices. This has been a factor that has hindered his ability to be as productive as possible. 


Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Coquital, thus ensuring that their products will reach market. 

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity for Hilda, her family and community. By offering a source of start-up capital and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, there is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, Hilda wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; she wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in her neighbourhood.

loans.use: Fot the purchase of seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of peppers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is one of the many active clients of Juhudi Kilimo and a dedicated member of Chemitan Integrated group. She is 52 years old and married, with 3 children aged 12, 15 and 25. All the children attend school.

Esther is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for 10 years and employs one farmhand. Her products are maize and milk which she sells to the local market. She also owns and earns income from her rental houses in the same area.

Her primary challenge has been lack of good quality bull semen which in most cases is very expensive to access.

Esther has requested her third loan from Juhudi of KES 50000 to purchase a dairy cow. This loan will help increase the family’s' income through the sale of milk and improve the family’s living standards and ease the burden of paying school fees.

In future, she would like to improve the quality of her dairy animals and increase her rental houses. Esther suggests Juhudi should assist farmers find good breeds of dairy animals and educate farmers on the best ways to keep a productive cow.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de los cuales 1 estudia, Esperanza viaja a las ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales que luego vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades procesa los cereales. Además Esperanza teje chompas a mano de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes.
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Los sueños de Esperanza es mejorar su negocio y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Esperanza, 40, lives with her significant other and has two children one of whom is a student. She travels to the various regional markets to sell fruit and she buys grains there that she then sells in the city of Ayacucho's markets. Sometimes she processes the grains. She also hand knits sweaters based on prior orders from customers. Esperanza needs a 1600 sol loan to buy wheat and barley. Her dreams are to improve her business and that her son continues with his schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat and barley.

loans.name: Maxima Narcisa

texts.es:
Maxima Narcisa G. R., tiene 27 años.  Es soltera  y vive con los hijos, vive en Ventanas provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos, Mariuxi (6) y Antoni (11 meses).

Maxima es una socia de la ventanilla rural la “Valle Alto”, que está ubicada en el Recinto Voluntad de Dios a hora y media de Ventanas. Son 23 socios en total, que en la mayoridad se dedican a la agricultura. Esto es el segundo préstamo que ellos realizan en la Cooperativa San José.

Maxima se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arroz,  fréjol y maíz. Realiza sus compras cada mes en el la ciudad de Ventanas y vende los productos en el Comercial Peña o en la misma localidad.

Solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de semillas de  arroz, fréjol y maiz. Piensa que el crédito es una oportunidad para salir adelante. Sus sueños comprar un carro y  una casa en la ciudad de Ventanas. Enfrenta desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades.

Le gusta rendir homenaje a Dios.
texts.en:
Maxima Narcisa G. R. is 27 years old. She is single and lives with her children in Ventanas, a province of Los Ríos. She has two children: Mariuxi, age 6, and Antoni, age 11 months. Maxima is a member of the rural loan program, "Valle Alto," which is located in precinct Voluntad de Dios, an hour and a half outside Ventanas. There are 23 group members in total, and the majority work in agriculture. This is the group's second loan with the San José Cooperative. Maximo works in agriculture; she grows rice, beans, and corn. She does her shopping every month in the city of Ventanas, and she sells her products in the Peña market or the same place she shops. She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of seeds for rice, beans, and corn. She believes the loan gives her the opportunity to get ahead in life. Her dreams are to buy a car and a house in the city of Ventanas. She faces challenges like plagues and sicknesses. She likes to pay tribute to God.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds of rice, beans, and corn

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy S. is from the village of Bagnos. She is 45 years old. Nancy is married and has 5 children. To make a living, Nancy owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nancy has been engaged in her business for over 29 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nancy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nancy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Nancy is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Nancy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 40 años vive en San Martin D. Porres lima Perú, tiene 03 hijos ella antes atendía la bodega D. su madre  como ya tenia experiencia al mudarse a su terreno decidió poner su propia bodega, pensando que D. esa manera a la vez que trabajaba no descuidaba a sus hijos y realmente fue así los día que tiene mayor venta son los fines D. semana ella venD. todo tipo D. productos pero lo que mas le sale son las bebidas y comestibles, otro ingreso que tiene es el alquiler D. departamentos en el segundo piso D. su casa lo que hace con sus ganancias es terminar algunos acabados en uno D. los predios que alquilara, también apoya a sus hijos en sus estudios.
La Sra. Consuelo quiere estudiar cosmetología por que su sueño es poner su salón D. belleza en un ambiente D. su casa el cual acondiciona para ese fin, su préstamo actual le va a servir para hacer unos retoques en uno D. los departamentos que alquilara, por otro lado ella es la tesorera del grupo “MUJERES BUSCANDO UN FUTURO” el grupo esta formado por 10 socias.

* Consuelo esta sentada con ropa negra.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 40 years old and lives in San Martin D. Porres, in Lima, Peru. She has 3 children and used to work in her mother's small grocery store. With that work experience, when Consuelo moved to her own house she decided to run her own small store from her home. She thought that this would allow her to work without neglecting her children, and it has worked out well for her. Her best days in terms of sales are on the weekends. She sells all kinds of products but drinks and food items sell the best. Consuelo also has some additional income from renting out apartments on the second floor of her house. With the money she earns she is making some improvements to one of the units she will be renting out, and she also uses her income to support her children's education. Consuelo would like to study cosmetology because her dream is to set up a beauty salon in one of the rooms of her house, which she is remodeling for that purpose.She will use this loan to make improvements to one of the apartments she rents out. Consuelo is the treasurer of the “Mujeres buscando un futuro” [Women looking for a future] group, which has 10 members. * Consuelo is seated in the photo, and is wearing black clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish making improvements to rental apartments

loans.name: Densmaa

texts.en:
Densmaa T. is a 50-year-old married woman who  lives with her husband and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband works as a veterinarian in the province while her son is a monk who studies and lives in a monastery. Her family's standard of living was very poor so she used to sell meals standing near a gas station. 

She started her clothes sales business in a rented stall at the local market by selling children's clothes which is not profitable. Therefore, she began to sell a variety of pants and trousers in a rented stall in the local market and has built a successful operation. Over the years, she has gained much experience in her trade. 

Densmaa is a very hardworking woman and is requesting a  1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase products and supplies for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: La Sra. Edith desde hace dos años se dedica al comercio de zapatos, no cuenta con local propio ya que ella compra los calzados en la ciudad de Oruro y lo traslada a la ciudad de Cochabamba donde entrega la mercadería a personas que tienen un puesto fijo para su venta. En el mercado la paz,  Quillacollo y en sacaba. Solicita el monto para incrementar su capital de trabajo y de este modo tener mayores ingresos, muy aparte de dedicarse al comercio, ella estudia en la universidad la carrera de enfermería, es una señora bien trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superación, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: For two years, Edith has been dedicated to selling shoes. She does not have her own shop since she buys the shoes in the city of Oruro and transports them to the city of Cochabamba where she sells the merchandise to people who have fixed stalls for their sale in the markets of La Paz, Quillacollo and in Sacaba. She is requesting the amount in order to increase her working capital and, in this manner, have greater income. Apart from dedicating herself to this business, she is studying to be a nurse at the university. She is a hard-working woman, with a great desire to get ahead. She is very thankful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: Increase in working capital.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE LOS TEMBLORES II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Carmela; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella atiende desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 9:30 p.m y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar la tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos como azúcar,arroz,leche y aceite al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Carmela belongs to the Señor de los Temblores II Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

Carmela is 38 years old.  She lives with her life partner, and she has three children. 

She alternates her daily activities with work in her grocery store.  She works there from 7:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand her grocery store.  Carmela is asking for a loan to buy products wholesale like sugar, rice, milk, and oil.

She is grateful to all those who share in her dream through this forum, and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy products wholesale like sugar, rice, milk, and oil

loans.name: Jamineth

texts.es:
JAMINETH G. P.
La señora Jlamineth socia del banco comunal Pan D. Vida. Del distrito D. manantay  Departamento D. Ucayali, tiene 33 años D. edad  casada  con 4 niños menores.
Con los préstamos D. Manuela Ramos, se han dedicado a la crianza D. pollos y hacían parrilladas para así obtener  más ganancias.
La señora Jlamineth se dedica a la compra y venta D. ropa D. segunda, su esposo trabaja manejando el motocar que ambos compraron y el cual también les sirve como movilidad porque viven muy apartados D. la ciudad.
Su ultimo préstamo D. S/. 1,500.00 soles lo invertirá en la compra D. algunos repuestos para su motocar, comprara S/. 500.00 D. ropas con lo demás comprara algunas pinturas para hacer algunas aplicaciones a los polos para poder venderlos a mejor precio.
Jlamineth  está contenta porque tiene el apoyo que necesitaba departe D. Manuela Ramos para seguir trabajando y mejorando sus ingresos con el cual sustenta su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Jamineth is a member of the Communal Bank “Pan D. Vida” (Bread of Life), which is in the District of Manatay, Department of Ucayali. She is 33 years old, married, and has four young children.

With the loans from Manuela Ramos, she used the funds to raise chickens and then grilled them to earn more income. Sra. Jamineth buys and sells secondhand clothing. Her husband drives a motorcar that both of them purchased, which they also use for personal transportation since they live far from the city.

This latest loan of 1500 PEN will be invested in the purchase of spare parts for their motorcar. She will use 500 PEN to buy clothes and a few paints for making appliqués to polo shirts so that she can sell them at a better price. Jamileth is pleased because she has the assistance of Manuela Ramos so that she can continue working and improving her income to support her family.

loans.use: Purchase clothing, appliqué paints, and parts for her husband's motorcar

loans.name: Ismael

texts.en:
Ismael is a 50-year-old man from Palestine, a father of four sons and two daughters. Ismael owns a sweets shop where he makes local sweets out of Semolina dough, cheese and sugar, such as Kunafa. Ismael started his shop three years ago.

Ismael wanted to double his production due to an increase in demand and business prosperity, so he came to FATEN and took a loan to purchase sugar, coconut, nuts, cheese and fat. Ismael has long experience making local sweets and has a good number of clients.

Ismael appears in the picture here in his shop.

About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for sweets

loans.name: Cheyech

texts.en:
Cheyech is 33 years old and has been doing mixed farming for eight years, producing milk, eggs and vegetables, and selling to the local market.

She has applied for this loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, her third loan, and plans grow her income from the dairy business and make life better for her family. She gets additional income from her money-transfer business with the leading communication firm in the country. She wishes to have four cows in five years' time.

Her challenge is frequent food shortages and animal diseases.

loans.use: Purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loans.name: Afouchata

texts.fr:
Née le 31 Août 1987  à Sikasso, Afouchata B. est une femme mariée et mère de 2 enfants résidant avec son époux et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Bougoula Ville Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après mener beaucoup d’activités sans succès, Afouchata s’est initiée à l’activité de vente de pagnes et d'encense il y a environ 7 ans. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux ans. Après un prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel, le précédent ayant été correctement remboursé. Ce deuxième prêt lui permettra d’acheter 5 balles de pagnes et  quelques paquets d' encense à Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Faso) et sur place à Sikasso qui seront vendus de façon ambulante à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Afouchata B. was born on August 31, 1987 in Sikasso. She is a married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in a large traditional extended family in Bougoula Town Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

After having unsuccessfully tried a few activities, seven years ago Afouchata learned to sell pagnes [colorful traditional wrap around fabric] and incense.

In order to better meet her ever-increasing customers’ demand, two years ago she decided to join Soro Yiriwaso. After a solidarity loan (group loan) in a neighborhood woman’s association, she is on her second individual loan. The first one was fully reimbursed. This second loan will allow her to buy five bales of pagnes and a few packets of incense in Bobo Dioulasso (Burkina Fasso) and locally in Sikasso. They will be sold door to door to customers who are mostly women.

With this loan, she is planning on making a monthly profit of 100, 000 Francs CFA that will be mostly used to increase her working capital, covering the family’s expenses and to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of pagnes

loans.name: David Enrique

texts.es: El señor David Enrique León V. tiene 48 años y vive con su esposa y tres hijos en Barranquilla. Se dedica a vender en un puesto estacionario del centro de Barranquilla ropa y calzado usados. Está vinculado a este oficio desde los 16 años cuando ayudaba a sus padres en la misma actividad. Al fallecer su padre, él se convirtió en la mano derecha de su madre y al morir ésta, quedó al frente del negocio. El señor David les compra la mercancía a varios proveedores que se dedican a cambiar en algunos barrios de Barranquilla ropa y calzado usado por utensilios de cocina como ollas, sartenes, calderos y vasos. Sus principales clientes son personas de escasos recursos de la ciudad y campesinos de zonas rurales. El siempre tiene el cuidado de comprar ropa que esté en buen estado, sin rotos, remiendos o manchas. Algunas veces le toca lavar y planchar las prendas para mejorar su apariencia. En su local tiene también un pequeño taller de zapatería en el cual repara el calzado que compra y lo deja como nuevo. Alrededor de su negocio hay otras personas que se dedican a lo mismo, pero cada uno tiene sus proveedores y su clientela habitual. Este es el tercer préstamo que el señor David tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar más ropa y calzado usado. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 100.000 y su margen de utilidad es del 35%. La temporada decembrina es la mejor del año y necesita aumentar su capital de trabajo. La esposa del microempresario también produce diariamente algunos almuerzos que vende a comerciantes del sector. La mayor satisfacción del señor David es haber podido criar sin penurias a sus tres hijos y lograr que el próximo año su hija menor se gradúe de enfermera superior. El dice con mucho humor que,  vendiendo ropa  y calzado usado,  es que su familia puede comprar ropa y calzado nuevo.
texts.en: Mr David Enrique León V. is 48 and lives with his wife and three children in Barranquilla. He sells used clothing and shoes in a stall in the center of Barranquilla. He has been doing this work for 16 years. He started off helping his parents with this work. When his father passed away, he became his mother's main source of support. When she passed away, he became the owner of the business. David purchases merchandise from various providers in Barranquilla neighbourhoods who trade used clothing and shoes for cooking utensils such as pots, pans, bowls and glasses. His main customers are people with few resources from the city and peasants from rural areas. He always takes care to buy clothing that is in good condition, without tears, patches or stains. Sometimes he washes and irons them so that they are like new. Around his business there are other people who do the same work, but each one has their own providers and customer base. This is David's third loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest it in purchasing more used clothing and shoes. His daily sales average $100,000 and his margin of utility is 35%. The December season is the best of the year and he needs to increase his working capital. His wife also daily produces various lunches that she sells to merchants in the sector. David's greatest satisfaction is having been able to raise his three children without hardship, and having achieved the fact that next year his youngest daughter will graduate from nursing school. He says, with a great sense of humour, that selling used clothing and shoes allows his family to buy new clothes and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing and shoes

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Doña Ana, tiene 58 años  D. edad, resiD. en Chinameca departamento D. San Miguel, donD. vive con su esposo y tres hijos D. 32, 28 y 23 años D. edad, D. estos solo dos dependen aun D. sus ingresos económicos, ella se dedica a la venta D. comida desD. hace 15 años en el mercado municipal D. Chinameca, donD. trabaja D. lunes a sábado, este negocio es la mayor fuente D. ingreso con la que cuenta su familia.
Ella actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. materiales para preparar los alimentos, tomates, maíz, condimentos, carnes, verduras y refrescos, este préstamo le ayudara a su negocio para ser más competente y dar abasto a la demanda D. comida que presenta, así mismo le dará mayor seguridad económica para cubrir las necesidades y gastos familiares.
Sus aspiraciones son con respecto al negocio, tener las condiciones adecuadas para atender a los clientes D. la mejor manera, ofrecerles los platillos favoritos dando gusto a sus demandas, también desea ver que sus hijos culminen sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Mrs Ana, age 58, lives in Chinameca, in the San Miguel department, with her husband and three children ages 32, 28 and 23. Only two of her children still depend on her income. She has sold food for 15 years in the Chinameca municipal market, where she works from Mondays to Saturdays. This business is the main source of income for her family.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials to prepare her food: tomatoes, corn, condiments, meat, vegetables and drinks. This loan will help her business to be more efficient and to satisfy the demand of her customers. This will also proviD. her with greater economic security to cover her needs and household costs.
Her goals, with respect to her business, are to have the necessary conditions to better attend to her customers, and to offer the most popular dishes based on demand. She also wants to see her children finish their university studies.

loans.use: the purchase of tomatoes, corn, condiments, meat, vegetables and drinks

loans.name: Iris Marianela

texts.es:
Iris de 36 años, comenzó criando pollos hace varios años atrás. Por la buena administración que le dio al negocio ahora es una microempresaria que vende y comprar pollos. 

 Ella realiza el trabajo con los pollos en la parte delantera de su casa, los comprar pequeños los cría con balanceado y después los mata para venderlos. Uno de sus otros ingresos es la venta de productos de belleza. Una de sus complicaciones es que en ocasiones sus animales se les enferman y tiene que comprarles vitaminas para que se mejoren. Pero ese no es impedimento para que ella continúe trabajando por eso quiere comprar para el negocio maíz, balanceado y vitaminas. 

En el futuro quiere tener un gallinero y espacio suficiente para construir una casa en la parte de frene donde vive.
texts.en:
Iris, who is 36 years old, began raising chickens several years ago. Through the good management she applied to the business, she is now a small businesswoman who buys and sells chickens. She does her work with the chickens in the area in front of her house. She buys them when they are small, raises them on feed, and then kills them to sell. 

Another source of income for her is the sale of beauty products. One of her problems is that sometimes her animals become sick and she has to buy vitamins to make them well. But this does not deter her from her work, and therefore she wants to purchase corn, feed and vitamins. 

In the future she would like to have a henhouse and space enough to build a house in front of her current dwelling.

loans.use: Purchase feed and corn.

loans.name: Leoncio

texts.es:
Leoncio tiene 52 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Leoncio es director de una agrupación musical, èl también tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son 16 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Leoncio invertirá el dinero del préstamo para comprar mercadería para la tienda  y también para comprar instrumentos musicales. El sueño de Leoncio es ser famoso con su agrupación musical. 
 
Leoncio pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Leonicio is 52 years old, married, has three children, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru. He is the director of a musical group and also manages a small grocery store in his home. Leonicio has had this business for sixteen years and has done very well as a result of the effort he puts into his work. He will invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise for his store as well as the acquisition of musical instruments. His dream is to become famous along with his musical group.

Leonicio belongs to the Communal Bank “Yahuar Maqui”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for his store & acquire musical instruments

loans.name: Ada Maria

texts.es:
Ada de 39 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Morazán junto a su esposo y sus hijos, es comerciante de zapatos, sandalias, vende tortillas y también tiene un molino de nixtamal, ella comenzó con el molino y la venta de tortillas hace dos años, hace poco tiempo comenzó a dedicarse al comercio de zapatos y sandalias.
Ella necesita un préstamo para invertir un porcentaje a cada negocio, comprando leña y maíz para las tortillas, zapatos y sandalias en caso que le alcance, con esta compra quiere mejorar sus negocios, realizar más ventas. La aspiración de Ada en expandir los negocios, tener buen número de clientes, en un futuro tener ahorros para mejorar su condición.
texts.en:
Ada is 39 years old and lives in Jiquilisco, in Morazán department, together with her husband and children.  Her business is selling shoes, sandals and tortillas.  She also has a corn mill.  She started out with her mill and selling tortillas two years ago and has only recently started selling shoes and sandals.

Ada needs a loan to invest a percentage in each business, buying firewood and corn for her tortillas, and also shoes and sandals if the money stretches far enough.  With this purchase, she hopes to improve her businesses and make more sales.  Ada's aspirations are to expand her businesses, to have a lot of customers and, in the future, to have savings so that she can improve her situation.

loans.use: To buy firewood, corn, shoes and sandals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build a wall in front of her home which will keep her home and children safer

loans.name: Liza Abelidas Group

texts.en:
Liza is from the village of Naga, Jimenez, Misamis Occidnetal. She is 41 years old and is the group leader of this Four-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

Liza is married and has four school-aged children. She owns and operates a retail business, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and used towards working capital.

Liza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase dried fish to expand her business offering. This will be her third loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish for her retail business.

loans.name: Faridun

texts.ru: Салимов Фаридун проживает в районе Восеъ. Ему 28 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Живет вместе с родителями. Его отец пенсионер, а брат работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Фаридун занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Целью кредита является закуп семян и минеральных удобрений для посева капусты.
texts.en: Faridun S. lives in the region of Vose. He is 28 years old. He is married and has two children. They live together with parents. His father is retired and his brother works in the collective farm. Faridun does agriculture, he rents out a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He has been in this business for seven years. The purpose of this loan is to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing of cabbage.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for sowing of cabbage

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is four. 

Rosalinda is a farmer. She has been growing rice for 18 years. Each month, she earns 5500 Philippine pesos (PHP) from doing this farming. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. 

In the future, Rosalinda hopes for her children to finish college and have bright futures. She also hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ladies' bags and dresses for her business.

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is now 47 years old and married with three school-aged children. Bernadette is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns PHP 7,000 per month. 

Bernadette is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Bernadette has been growing rice for almost 15 years.

In the future, Bernadette hopes to have a large production of rice in order to earn more income to finance the schooling of her children who are now in college. She believes that with the continuous support of the Kiva lenders, she can achieve her business goals through her patience and strong determination.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, aged 32, is a single mother of one child. She has been selling clothes door-to-door for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of KES 25,000.

This is Juliana's first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the funds to buy more clothes for resale. Juliana intends to use the anticipated profits to educate her child and hopes to have a classic boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes for sale

loans.name: Ravasco

texts.en:
Ravasco is a married man with seven children, all of whom attend school. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six months, Ravasco has operated a soap making business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He also sells paraffin as another source of income. Ravasco faces a major challenge of high transportation costs in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. Ravasco plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase paraffin for sale and to start a charcoal sales business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase paraffin for sale and to start a charcoal sales business.

loans.name: Fatu

texts.en:
Fatu is 48 years old and lives in Congo town. She is married and her husband is a mason. They have three children ages 19 to 28, all of whom live on their own. 

For the past fifteen years Fatu has been selling frozen pig feet and meat in the local market. Sometimes she buys at a very high price and then realizes a very low profit. Fatu is requesting a loan to purchase one carton of pig feet and one carton of frozen meat along with oil and spices for her business. In the future she plans to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one carton of pig feet and one carton of frozen meat along with oil and spices for her business

loans.name: Pauteñitas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Pauteñitas está formado por 12 socias quienes viven por el cantón Paute, este cantón es el mayor productor de flores, cuenta con una amplia gastronomía propia del sector, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura. Nuestras socias son mujeres luchadoras y trabajadoras quienes día a día laboran en sus diferentes actividades que les permiten ayudar y mejorar la economía de sus hogares y salir en adelante con sus familias.

Una de las socias es la Señora. Jessica, vive por el cantón Paute, Tiene 35 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 2 hijas de 17 y 15 años de edad quienes estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Nuestra socia está muy  contenta ya que se encuentra embarazada de 8 meses. Su esposo labora en la construcción, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en una hacienda donde cuidan. 

Doña Jessica por el momento se encuentra laborando en la hacienda, cuida de sus hijas y se dedica a la cría de gallinas las que son para su consumo y venta.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su tercer ciclo al cual fue invitada por una amiga. Con el dinero de su crédito lo va a compra pollos para iniciar con este negocio.

Su meta es crecer en la cría de animales. 

Las fotos pequeñas adjuuntas son de tres socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Pauteñitas Communal Bank is comprised of 12 members who live in the canton of Paute.  This canton is a major flower producer and the sector offers a wide variety of its own gastronomy.   Its people are engaged in trade, agriculture, and raising animals.  Our members are struggling, hard-working women.  They work day to day in various activities that enable them to improve their household finances and help their families get ahead. 

One of the members is Jessica.  She is 35 years old and lives in the canton of Paute.  She is in a common-law relationship and has 2 children, ages 17 and 15, who are students at the city school.  Our member is very happy as she is 8 months pregnant.  Her husband works in construction.  They do not have their own home because they live on a farm where they work.

At present, Jessica is working at the farm, caring for her children, and raising hens for consumption and sale.

Her friend invited her to join the communal bank and she is in her third loan cycle with the institution. She will use the funds from the loan to buy chickens to start this business.

Her goal is to increase the number of animals she is raising.

The attached photos are of three members that could not be present when the group photo was taken because they were working.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofia: Tiene su negocio de confeccion de prendas de vestir y tambien se dedica a la venta de telas en el mercado de su comunidad, ella le da Gracias a Dios que sus ventas a crecido esta solicitando este credito para la compra de telas para la confeccion de prendas de vestir,ya que le hace falta mucha tela para poderlo trabajar, el sueño de ella es tener un local mas grande y darles lo nesesario a sus hijos para que en un futuro tengan mas oportunidades.
texts.en: Sofía has a business making clothes and also sells fabric in her local community market.  She thanks God because her sales have increased.  She is requesting this loan to buy material to make fabric because she needs quite a bit of fabric to work.  Her dream is to have a larger shop and to provide what‘s necessary for her children to have more opportunities in the future.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para la confeccion de prendas de vestir

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  lives in Uganda. She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Justine lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.   

Justine has a business of selling used shoes. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days out of every week.  

Justine sells her products at the market by means of retail.  

Justine has requested a loan of 40,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of used shoes.   

The main business challenges for Justine include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start importing shoes and also to be a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Hayotjon

texts.ru:
Хаётчон целеустремленный, ответственный и добрый человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Хаётчон занимается купля продажей продуктов питания. Когда он ездит за товарами помогает ему его жена по бизнесу. Раньше у него был бизнес маленьким, а сейчас развивался. Теперь он продает широкий ассортимент продуктов, такие как растительное масло, чай, макароны, конфеты, рис, мука соль и т.д. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес, и прибыль, который он планирует получить, он хочет покупать автомашину для перевозки продуктов. Хаётчон запрашивает займ 3000$ США для покупки нового ассортимента продуктов с целью расширения бизнеса. Он заранее благодарит вас за вашу поддержку и поощрения. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Hayotjon is a purposeful, responsible and kind man. He is married and is a loving father of one child. Hayotjon buys and sells food. When he goes out to buy the food his wife helps him with the business. Before that he had a small business and now it has grown. Right now he sells a wide variety of groceries such as vegetable oil, tea, spaghetti, candy, rice, four, sold and etc. He wants to expand his business and plans to use the profit to buy a vehicle for transporting the produce. Hayotjon is asking for a loan in the amount of $3,000USD to buy a new assortment of food and groceries with the purpose of growing his business. He is thanking all of you in advance for your support and encouragement.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy food

loans.name: Eun

texts.en:
Eun is 51 years old and has been running a grocery store at home for ten years.  Her husband Nhak who is 54, is a farmer.  They have seven children, five sons and two daughters.  One is married and lives outside the family home, two have full-time employment, one is learning hair dressing skills, and the others are in school.  They live in a village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Eun is requesting her first loan of $500 to expand her grocery store by buying additional grocery items.  She will also use a portion of the loan to launch a hair salon for her daughter when she finishes her training.

loans.use: to expand her grocery store by buying additional grocery items and to launch a hair salon for her daughter who is learning hair dressing skills.

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married. 

Reggie has a shop that sells assorted fruit like mangoes & bananas. He has had this business for two years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fruits to sell.

Reggie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Reggie hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fruits to sell.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 42 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. 
Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through Kiva partner NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her store. She has borrowed and paid back seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for six years and also earns an income from offering manicure and pedicure services.
Marites aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Benjamin Muthui

texts.en:
Benjamin is a 33 year old married man. He has two children, ages 2 and 5.  He describes himself as quiet, cooperative and determined. 

He operates a fruits and vegetables business where he sells oranges, capsicums and other groceries.  He has been involved in this business for 3 years and employs 1 staff member. His business is located in a busy shopping center. 

He says his biggest business challenge is a lack of finances.  He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more fruit to sell.

His business goal is to grow his business into a wholesale operation within 5 years.  He also hopes to buy a plot of land in which he will build rental units.

loans.use: to buy more fruits.

loans.name: Subira Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Subira Group in Western Kenya! Ridah is the facilitator of the Subira group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Ridah takes care of 10 children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Ridah had a very good maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 1.5 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Ridah was only able to harvest one bag of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Ridah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Subira group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Rosa Adilia

texts.es: Rosa Adilia vive sola en su propia casa ya que la única hija que tiene ya es mayor de edad y está haciendo su propio hogar.  Rosa se caracteriza por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo muy emprendedora. Hace varios años que logro establecer una pequeña tiendita en su hogar de residencia y gracias a Dios y a su arduo trabajo y dedicación el negocio es muy reconocido en la zona por lo que ya cuenta con mucha clientela. Para Rosa es muy importante mantener activo este negocio ya que es su principal fuente de ingresos. Para ella lo más importante son los clientes ya que sabe que manteniéndolos satisfechos con el servicio que presta seguirán prefiriéndola y su negocio seguiría siempre activo tal como es su sueño. Es por esta razón que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de mercadería para la tienda tales como: huevos, golosinas, azúcar, arroz, leche, frijoles, pan dulce y de más artículos que parezcan atractivos para los clientes. De esta manera espera lograr su sueño de seguir mantenido activo su negocio y por consecuencia seguir trabajando por un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Rosa Adilia lives alone in her own home as the only daughter who has come of age and making her own home. Rosa is a woman characterized by being honest, hardworking and above all very entrepreneurial. Several years ago she managed to establish a small convenience store in her home, and thanks to God and her hard work and dedication the business is well known in the area with many customers. 

It is very important to Rosa to keep active in this business as it is her main source of income. For her, the most important thing are her customers because she knows that keeping them satisfied with the service will have them continue to prefer her business.  This way, her business would always be active and that is her dream.  It is for this reason Rosa has decided to apply for this loan to INTEGRAL to invest in the purchase of merchandise for the store such as eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, pastries and other articles that seem attractive to customers.  With this loan, Rosa hopes to achieve her dream of continuing her business and therefore continue to work for a better future.

loans.use: to buy eggs, candy, sugar, rice, milk, beans, etc.

loans.name: 030802-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Huệ has a tailoring business. She is requesting a loan to maintain her tailoring shop.

Huệ is 28 years old, and she is married with two dependent children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 030802-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoằng Hóa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2010, Huệ joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid two loans from FPW. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, and the main hardship that she faces is a lack of capital.

In the future, Huệ hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain a successful business, and to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: to maintain her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel works as a farmer in his village.  He is providing for his two children and wife through this occupation.  He is proud to have this occupation because he can buy what he wants as well as provide the needs of his family.  At the age of 30, he is very capable in the farming business but he knows as time passes by he could also lose money. So he has promised himself, now that he is still young, he will save for the future of his children.

At this point, he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the improvement of his business.

He knows that as his business gets better, his profits will also progress.  By then, he will save for the future necessities of his family.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as corn seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for the improvement of his business.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah, aged 24 years is married to Samuel and they are blessed with one child, age three years. Fridah sells clothes and has been doing that for three years. The business earns her a monthly income of Kes.10,000.

This is her second loan with KADET and she has repaid the previous loan successfully. She will use the funds to buy more clothes for sale. Fridah hopes to educate her child and own a large boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Yurley Yohanna

texts.es: La señora Yurley Yohanna a sus 30 años, posee un puesto de comidas rápidas que pone al frente de su casa y con el cual se gana el sustento para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y de sus dos hijos. La actividad la aprendió gracias a una amiga suya y desde entonces esta ha sido la labor con la que todos los días busca progresar y brindarle a sus hijos la mejor educación posible. La señora Yurley Yohanna sueña con tener un restaurante grande y reconocido, que le pueda generar mayores ingresos y en el que pueda emplear a una gran cantidad de personas en situaciones vulnerables. Actualmente requiere de la reparación de su fritadota y realizar algunos arreglos locativos al frente de su casa, como también comprar una carpa para que su puesto de comidas rápidas sea mas atractivo para los clientes de su sector.
texts.en:
Sra. Yurley Yohanna is 30 years old and manages a fast food stall in front of her house. This enables her to earn an income to cover the household expenses for herself and her two children. She learned this business from a friend of hers. Since then, she has worked every day in order to make progress and provide her children with the best education possible.

Sra. Yurley Yohanna dreams of having a large and well-recognized restaurant so that she can generate more income and employ many people who are in vulnerable situations. She currently wants to repair her deep fryer and also make a few structural improvements to the front of her house. Yurley will also buy a tent to protect her food stall and make it more attractive for her local customers.

loans.use: to repair her deep fryer, purchase a tent for her food stall, and make a few repairs to her house.

loans.name: Doris Sonia

texts.es:
Doris Sonia es muy alegre y a pesar de las adversidades ella logra tener un buen semblante y no se amilana ante nada, ella es madre de 3 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 6, 17,19 años de edad el menor  cursa el primer año de educación secundaria, y los dos mayores estudian en la universidad, a los cuales ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo; a Doris le encanta preparar dulces y cocinar en sus tiempos libres, por ello siempre prepara su palto favorito el cual es el “Arroz con pollo”, ella nos comenta que sus hijos aman su manera; es por ello que le hubiera gustado estudiar gastronomía, pero debido a los pocos recursos económicos con los que contaban sus padres no lo pudo hacer, por ello ella lucha cada día porque sus hijos sean profesionales y no descansara hasta lograrlo.

Doris actualmente tiene su negocio de venta de abarrotes, ropa y bebidas gaseosas y cervezas, labora alrededor de 12 horas diarias y atiende de 15 a 20 clientes en el día, puede ganar hasta S/.40 y en un día muy bueno puede ganar hasta S/.60, ella cree que su negocio tiene buena acogida gracias a que brinda una buena atención a sus clientes.

Doris agradece mucho a los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más mercadería para su negocio (abarrotes, ropa por pedido)y con ello tener mas variedad en sus productos tendra mayores ingresos y con ello seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su mas anhelado sueño: “Hacer de sus hijos unos profesionales de Éxito y mejorar su calidad de vida.”
texts.en:
Doris Sonia is very happy, and in spite of the adversities, she succeeds in putting on a good face and is not afraid of anything. She is the mother of three children, whose ages are 6, 17, and 19. The youngest is in the first year of education. The two oldest, whom she has raised with much effort, study at the university. Doris likes to prepare sweets and cook in her free time. For that reason, she always prepares her favorite dish, which is "chicken with rice." She tells us that her children love her way of cooking. For that reason, she would have liked to study gastronomy, but because of her parents' limited economic resources, she was not able to do it. Thus she struggles every day so that her children can have careers, and she won't rest until this is achieved.

Doris now has her own business where she sells groceries, clothing, soft drinks, and beer. She works about 12 hours every day and waits on 15 to 20 customers in a day. She can earn up to 40 PEN, and on a very good day she can earn up to 60 PEN. She believes that her business does well because she offers good service to her customers. 

Doris is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business (groceries and sample clothing for ordering), and with it she will have a greater variety of products and greater income, so that she can continue saving to be able to fulfill her most desired dream: to have her children have successful careers and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (groceries and clothing) for her store.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 36 years old, married to John, and they are blessed with four children. Sarah runs a retail shop in an area known as Malaa. She has been in this business for the last seven years and earns an income of KES 15,000 per month.

Sarah is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD of KES 20,000, which she plans to use to buy stock such as salt, sugar, rice, and flour. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children.

She hopes to have a supermarket and be able to meet the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase stock such as salt, sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Silivere

texts.en:
Silvere is 34 years old. He is married with 3 children aged 1 and 8 years. 1 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 4 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Don Mauricio de 45 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cinco hijos, el se dedica desde hace 11 años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de güisquil, cuando ya está su cosecha la comercializa en los pueblos aledaños gracia a su trabajo es como ha podido solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el está solicitando nuevamente otro crédito para la compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. ya que le va muy bien con las siembras y es asi como puede obtener mejores ingresos economicos.

loans.use: compra de mas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc.

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en: Mr.Shaban is a retired teacher, married with 3 Children. From his retirement benefits, Shaban started a cattle selling and butchery business which kept him busy by moving around markets in Teso, Bungoma and Mt Elgon Districts.  The loan of $575 from PEMCI will be used to open up two butcheries to enable him meet his wide customers demand. The income coming from these sales enabled him to open and support adult education in the community where he is the principal of the school- Alemuna Adult school in Malakis.From he has also been able to  bring a variety of quality meat nearer to the community . We are proud to be associated with the good work that Shaban is doing out of our initiative of PEMCI.

loans.use: To expand his enterprise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two cows for her dairy business

loans.name: Abdul Latif

texts.en: A. Latif lives in district 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he lives with members of his family. He graduated from university and he has a retail shop. He wants to make it into a food market. For this reason, he needs money and he wants to take a individual loan to buy extra materials like shampoo, powder, baskets and milk. He wants to expand his business and make a better future for himself and also for his family. Now he is very happy and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy inventory

loans.name: Sandra Myriam

texts.es:
Sandra lives in Santa Catrarina, Nuevo Leon. She is a hard-working woman. She is single with 2 children. About 12 years ago, she decided to start her own business by offering school transportation to all the schools in her community since it was desperately needed. She only had a few clients at first, but later with time and with her good customer service, her business began to grow.

With school out for the summer, she wants to make sure her van is well-maintained in order to avoid any type of accidents (disrepair) once school is back in session. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $750 USD. She commits to repay this amount within 6 months. Sandra thanks you for giving her an opportunity to improve her business!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catrarina, Nuevo León vive Sandra, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Desde hace 12 años, observando las necesidades de su colonia, decidió iniciar su propio negocio ofreciendo su servicio de transporte escolar, empezó con muy pocos clientes pero con el tiempo se dio a conocer y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece pronto logró hacer crecer su negocio.

Aprovechando el periodo vacacional ahora desea invertir en el mantenimiento de su vehiculo y evitar cualquier tipo de accidentes en el regreso a clases, para lo que está solicitando un crédito por $ 750 dólares, que se compromete a devolver en seis meses. Sandra agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu ayuda de mejorar ya hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Maintenance for school transportation

loans.name: Elsevar

texts.en:
Elsevar is from Gahramanli village in the Beylagan district of Azerbaijan. 
He is married with 2 children. Elsevar has been rearing cattle and sheep for a few years. He is a first time borrower, and is asking for $400 to buy a cow. He believes that this cow will help boost his business with the calves she will bear.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Sieli

texts.en: Sieli is a married lady of thirty three years of age with three children. Her business is the selling of cooking foods such as chop-suey, curry with rice and Samoan taro at offices in town, school and the village. Her $300USD loan was used to buy all the materials like pots and containers, and ingredients needed for making the foods. She earns $125ST net profit per day with four working days but if she needs more money at a particular time she works six days. She believes this program is very useful to her, because without it she could not do it. She can also afford to make the repayments.

loans.use: To buy materials for her fast food stall

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es:
Señor Fausto G. lives in his own home in the neighborhood of Alto Llojeta on the western side of the City of La Paz with his wife and three children. He works for a woodworker in the neighborhood. With a previous loan, he purchased land with a permit to build a home on it. He is asking for a loan now to use for the construction of a house which will provide his older children with a more comfortable place, primarily for the development of their studies. This is the second time Senor G. has asked for a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis that was completed is favorable and suggests that he can afford the loan. His previous loan has been paid in full.

Translated from Spansih by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva volunteer

El señor Fausto Gómez vive en casa propia en la zona de Alto Llojeta ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y su tres hijos; el señor Fausto trabaja como empleado en una ladrillería de la zona. Con los créditos anteriores realizaron la compra del terreno y la habilitación de una habitación en la misma. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción una habitación que le dará a sus hijos mayor comodidad principalmente para el desarrollo de sus estudios. Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito. El crédito anterior ha sido cancelado en su totalidad.

loans.use: Construction of a home

loans.name: Daryani
