texts.en: Daryani is a 44-year-old mother who has 2 sons. She supports her family by selling home appliances, earning about US$ 5 a week. She is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan of US$ 100 to expand her little business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of her little home appliances business

loans.name: Hamidu

texts.en:
A. Hamidu is a trader who buys slippers and sells to her costumers. Hamidu is married and has 1 child. She wishes to expand her business and increase her sales.

She is asking for $225 to enable her to buy more slippers for sale.

loans.use: To buy more slippers for sale.

loans.name: Zuwena's Bustani B Group

texts.en:
Zuwena is a single woman. She owns a small beauty salon, which she started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her little salon.

In the past, Zuwena has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more supplies for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, who has a business dealing in livestock raising.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 30 years old, divorced, and has 2 children. She supplies goods to other businesses, and began her business in 1994. She works everyday at 6 AM to 3:30 PM. She earns a total of $140 in profits from her sales every month.

She now would like a loan to increase the number of goods in her business.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her business.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily U. is 38 years old; she is a married woman with 3 children. Emily sells provisions and clothes, and this was a business she started in 2000. She has been borrowing from LAPO micro finance for 7 years. She is requesting a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and cloth for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and cloth

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria E., 73, is married with 4 children.  She has 3 years of experience in running a shop. She sells to the village people and the public 2 days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (approximately 208 USD).  SPBD loans are Maria’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for house repairs. Her husband does the farming.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en: Nazim (his brother is pictured) was born in 1967. He lives in Khachmaz region. He is married, has two children, and has been in the cattle breeding business for 10 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 US to buy four calves to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy four calves

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Born September 29, 1976 in Tsévié in the Zio prefecture, Mr. Yao A. is a bachelor who works in upholstery in the Agoè neighborhood of Lomé. He purchases foam, cloth, wood and other materials with which to make armchairs, chairs and handbags. He has just received an order for 24 cushioned chairs and is requesting this first loan to purchase the tools of his trade—sixty units of foam, four rolls of fabric and pots of glue. With the completion of this project, he will earn income that will allow him to provide for himself.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 29 septembre 1976 à Tsévié dans la préfecture de Zio, monsieur A. Yao est un célibataire et a crée une tapisserie dans le quartier d’Agoè à Lomé. Son activité consiste à acheter des mousses, des tissus, du bois et autres accessoires afin de fabriquer des fauteuils, des chaises et des sacs. Il vient de recevoir une commande de 24 chaises à assises bourrées et sollicite ce premier pour acheter des outils de travail tels que 60 mousses, 4 rouleaux de tissus et des pots de colle. Ainsi après la livraison de ce projet, il pourra gagner un revenu qui lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins.

loans.use: Achat de mousses pour confection de fauteuils

loans.name: Fatuma Namale's Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is the leader of a 4-member group. She is 29 years old and married with 3 children aged between 15 and 4. All of her children go to school. She also takes care of three orphans, children of her late sister. She owns and resides in a four-roomed house living with eight people There is electricity but the house has no piped water. The family gets two meals a day.

Fatuma resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Fatuma goes to Kampala for shopping three times a week. She rents her business premises at 40,000/= per month and works seven days. She deals in second-hand clothes and sells to all categories of people.

Fatuma sells to an average of 20 people per day. She buys her products from Owino Market, one of the busiest markets in Kampala City, and she uses public transport back to her business. Fatuma has been in this business for over eleven years and doesn't have any other business.

Her main challenges include limited capital and high transport costs to and from her place of work. She has been working with MCDT for over 11 years and is servicing her eighteenth loan, working all this long period with the same group-mates. She wants to use this loan to increase the inventory in her business. She aspires to build her own rental rooms. .

loans.use: To increase the inventory of her business

loans.name: Kalabi Elom

texts.fr:
Né en 1983 à Lomé, monsieur A. Kalabi Elom est un jeune dynamique qui est né dans une famille dans laquelle la plus part de personne sont des commerçants. Après avoir quitté, les bancs scolaires, il s’est lancé dans la vente des cartes de recharge. Il est revendeur ambulant et vend de quartier en quartier. Avec cette activité, il arrive à satisfaire ses besoins quotidiens. 
Alors il a toujours une ambition qui est d’agrandir ce commerce pour vendre en gros afin de réaliser des choses autre que de se nourrir seulement.
A cet effet il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter 2 petits cartons de cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Kalabi Elom A. was born in 1983 in Lomé. This young, energetic man was born into a family, most of whom have commercial businesses. After leaving school, he started selling mobile phone cards. He sells door to door throughout various neighborhoods. With this business he is able to meet his daily needs.

He has always had the goal of increasing his business and eventually selling wholesale, in order to raise his living standard above a basic subsistence level.

Therefore, he is requesting his first loan to buy two (2) small boxes of mobile phone cards.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of mobile phone cards

loans.name: Phon

texts.en: Mrs. Phon Y., 62, lives in the Chek village in the Kandal province. She is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory. She is a farmer who cultivates rice on a 2-hectar field. She now faces a small problem because she does not have an animal to plow the rice field. So she decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field.  She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel in order to make her crop more productive.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field; and to buy fertilizers, pesticides and fuel.

loans.name: Clayton

texts.es:
En el Mercado Central de  la ciudad de Chinandega, el señor Clayton se dedica a su negocio de pulpería el cual lo comercializa desde hace varios años en dicho mercado.   

Es importante destacar que el señor Clayton es el único sustento de su hogar por lo que se ha preocupado por mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia. Por este motivo es que él ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito que le permita la compra de los productos como granos básicos para continuar con la comercialización de estos en el mercado de Chinandega.
texts.en:
In the Central Market of Chinandega, Clayton has a grocery business which he has run for various years in the Market. It is important to not that Clayton is the only economic provider for his home, which is why he is concerned about bettering the economic conditions of his family. Because of this, Clayton sought assistance through Ceprodel to obtain a loan that will permit him to buy the basic products, like grains, to continue offering these items in the market in Chinandega.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of Staple Goods.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Lê Thị H. năm nay 33 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2004. Hiện nay ngaòi chăn nuôi, hai vợ chồng chị H. đều làm nghề buôn bán thịt lợn. Hàng ngày chồng chị đi mua lợn thịt về giết mổ còn chị H. bán lẻ tại chợ cho thu nhập bình quân 100.000đ/ ngày. Với mức thu nhập ổn định này gia đình chị H. đang ngày càng có thêm điều kiện để nâng cao chất lượng cuộc sống.
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 5.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư cho việc buôn bán thịt lợn.
texts.en:
Mrs Lê Thị H. is 33, she is a TYM fund member since 2004. She and her husband raise livestock. They also sell pork. Everyday her husband would buy pig from a supplier, butchers it and H. would sell it at the local market. Their make 100.000 VND a day. With a steady income her family living condition improves eveyday. This round of loan Mrs H. is requesting 5.000.000 VND to invest in her pork retail business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in her pork retail business

loans.name: Yasmeen M. Wakeel Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen baji is 30 years old and married. She has lived in the city of Vehari, Pakistan for the past 12 years. Her husband's name is M. W.. He is a loader by profession, and loads various items (e.g. cement and sand) on his donkey cart. He has been doing this work for the past four years.

Yasmeen baji is the mother of two sons. Her eldest son reads in 3rd standard and her youngest son reads in 2nd standard. Yasmeen baji is a hard working lady. She gets up early in the morning to help her boys get ready for school. She prepares them breakfast and takes them to school. Fortunately, Yasmeen baji runs a canteen in the same school. She does this work to pay for the school expenses of her sons and to share the financial burden with her husband.

Yasmeen baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). She is now applying for a new loan to buy material (chips and biscuits) for her canteen.

Yasmeen baji is a group leader of some women in her locality. Amna baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Razia baji wants a loan to buy material (sugar and tea) for her tea stall. Zahida parveen baji wants a loan to buy switch boards and wires for her electrical shop. Shazia latif baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and creams for her parlor.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy chips and biscuits to resell

loans.name: Mrs. Mai Sen Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank, which consists of nine members, is located in Lor village in the Kampong Chhnang province. The members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Mai S. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more grocery goods to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Seth El, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Mai S. is 45 years old and the mother of four children, one of whom has immigrated to Korea to work as a laborer while another helps with the parents' work and the others are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods to resell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
Vicenta es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun que significa Crezcamos en quechua.
Vicenta es casada, tiene 56 años y 6 hijos, Vicenta tiene un puesto en el mercado central en donD. venD. carne, los animales los compra en las ferias D. la región y luego los beneficia, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo.
Vicenta necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cerdos, carneros.
El sueño D. Vicenta es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Vicenta is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, which means "Let's Grow" in Quechua. Vicenta is 56-years-old and married with 6 children. Vicenta has a position in the central market selling meat. She buys her livestock at regional fairs and later sells them. She is assisted in this activity by her spouse. Vicenta is requesting a loan of 1000 soles that will be invested in the purchase of pigs and rams. Vicenta's dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of pigs and rams.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy F. is 50 years old. She is married, with three children. Her first child has completed senior high school and  is working. The rest of her children attend school. She lives with her family in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. For the past 30 years Lucy has been taking care of her household and baking bread and pastries. She bakes bread and pastries and sells them to the villages around her. Demand for her products has increased as a result of constant supply and just in time delivery. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come in, there order is ready. She says the price of supplies is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. However, the daily demand of bread is still high. She says she bake 500 loaves of bread in a day together with other pastries. Lucy needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood etc to restock her inventory. She said your assistance would be much welcome and helpful to her. She says she would be grateful for that assistance. Lucy belongs to a village bank called ‘One touch’.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood etc

loans.name: Diouromfouk Hussel 1 Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/mlomp.php

Après avoir reçu un premier prêt qui a été renouvelé, nous sommes revenues pour demander à ce que le prêt soit reconduit, car les autres membres de notre association n'avaient pas bénéficié du premier. Cependant, nous tenons à remercier Kiva qui a fait de nous des femmes conscientes de leur capacité de production et de travailleuses qui arrivent à gagner leur vie grâce à la sueur de leur front. Nous allons donc acheter des produits bruts (huilles de palmes, pâte d'arachide, crevettes fraiches, poissons et huître) que nous allons transformer et vendre dans les grandes villes. Nous voulons aussi acheter des fruits , puisque c'est la saison pour en revendre en ville et subvenir ainsi aux besoins de nos enfants et de nos familles.
texts.en:
After receiving a first loan which was renewed, we are coming back to ask for another loan, because the other members of our association did not benefit from the first one. Nevertheless, we want to thank Kiva for making us aware of our capacity of production, and for turning us into working women who manage to provide for themselves. We will buy raw products (palm oil, peanut butter, fresh shrimps, fish and oysters), to transform them and sell them in the big cities. We will also buy fruits since they are in season, to resell them in the city. We will thus be able to provide for our children and families.

http://sem-fund.org/mlomp.php

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw food products, to transform and sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel G. is forty-eight years old. He is married and has three children who are currently in the basic school. Samuel lives with his family in a community called Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. A sizeable number of the inhabitants are engaged in farming activities. However, quite an appreciable number of the women are engaged in palm oil production. Samuel identified this as a business opportunity and bought three sets of palm nut milling and processing machines to run a commercial palm nut processing business in his community. 

He has one set of machines that pounds the cooked palm nuts and another one that extracts the oil from the palm nut fibre. His services have greatly reduced the drudgery that was previously associated with palm oil extraction and processing.

Since palm oil production is assuming a greater scale in his community, he seeks loan assistance to enable him to buy additional milling and processing machines and accessories to provide satisfactory, timely production service to his clients. He believes the loan assistance would enable him to scale up production to serve a larger market and eventually, to help improve his family’s finances. He is a member of a Trust Bank group called Zion Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee one another as social collateral to access the loan and to support themselves in handling repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To procure milling machines and parts for palm oil production.

loans.name: Zarina M.sher Group

texts.en:
Zarina baji supported her husband when he lost hope and became discouraged, and he is proud of her because, through her supportive behavior, he was able to start driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is applying for a loan to service the auto-rickshaw, because its engine is in urgent need of repair.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (eggs and bread) to sell. Khursheed begum baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike-rental business. Razia sultana baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Kouami

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a ouvert en 1992  une imprimerie, il reçoit des commandes  pour la production de calendriers, cahiers, enveloppes et divers. Actuellement il a reçu une commande pour fabriquer les feuilles d’examen, ne disposant pas suffisamment de papier, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des papiers et du matériel d’imprimerie afin de pouvoir exécuter la commande et satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
This gentleman opened a print shop in 1992. He gets orders to produce calendars, notebooks, envelopes and such. Presently, he has received an order to make exam booklets. Not having enough paper on hand, he is asking WAGES for his first loan which will allow him to buy paper and other material for printing so as to execute this order and satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of paper and other printing necessities

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli P. is from the village of Damayuhan, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Arceli is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Arceli owns & operates a business buying & selling green bananas and coconut fruit. Her husband is a fisherman. Arceli is supporting this business to expand. Arceli and her husband have been engaged in these businesses for over 20 years and earn approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Arceli joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Arceli has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase a motor for their pump boat. Arceli is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP to be used to purchase additional fishing nets and to finance her buying and selling business. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Arceli from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets and to finance her buying and selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional stock of fish for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: la sra. Maria del Rosario A. tiene 55 años de edad, se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, este producto lo vende en su casa y en diferentes mercaditos, pulperias y restaurantes de la ciudad capital,  tambien vende por encargo para reuniones. tiene mas de 25 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, gracias a este negocio logro darles estudio, alimentacion y salud a sus hijos, este credito lo necesita para comprar mas materia prima al por mayor para poder abaratar los costos de produccion, su meta es poder tener un negocio grande en el cual pueda contratar varias mujeres y asi contribuir con empleo para gente que necesita trabajar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria del Rosario A. is 55 years old, and works making tortillas, which she sells out of her house and in various markets, corner grocery stores, and restaurants around the capital city. She also caters large events. She has worked at this for the past 25 years, and thanks to this business she has been able to provide food, schooling, and health care to her children. She needs this loan to buy her raw materials in bulk in order to reduce her production costs. Her goal is to be able to have a large business which will be able to employ several women and in that way provide jobs to people who need them.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of lime, water, firewood, and flour

loans.name: Kuy's Group

texts.en: A group consists of five members led by Mrs. T., 45, a mother of six children whom all of them are still young and attend school. She is a farmer on a plot of farming land derived from her parents. T. married Pheang, 42, who runs a service of motor repairing in the village since 2000. T. could earn a good income and good living standard with her growing. Recently, she plans to buy hundreds kilos of fertilize stocking in her stall for farming because the next wind-dry season of Monson is coming soon. And the other joint borrowers are: A., 45, a local farmer is taking a loan to buy piglets for her stall. M., 29, who runs a service of clothes sewing is looking for a loan to buy a more convenient sewing materials. T., 41, a local farmer is asking for a loan to buy a cow for plowing. And L., 58, who is also a local farmer is looking for a loan to buy piglets for her stall.

loans.use: to buy hundreds kilos of fertilize stocking in her stall for farming

loans.name: Gagnaglo

texts.fr: Monsieur Gagnaglo a fait des études d’agronmie à l’Université. Après ses études, ne trouvant pas un emploi à son goût, il a décidé d’élever des races améliorées de porcs. Cette activité lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa femme et de leurs 03 enfants. Elle achète les porcins du Bénin, où il les élève pour la vente. Son parc d’élevage se situe à Agbata, à quelques kilomètres de Lomé. Actuellement il sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 20 races de porcins améliorées ; ce prêt lui permettra également de rénover les lieux d’élevage pour accueillir de nouveaux porcins. Il a débuté son élevage en 2007 mais compte déjà beaucoup de clients
texts.en:
Mr. Gagnaglo studied agronomy at the University. Afterwards, since he found no work to his liking, he decided to raise pigs of improved varieties. This business enables him to provide for his wife and three children. He buys pigs from Benin, where he raises them to sell. His pig pens are located in Agbata, a few kilometers from Lomé. Currently, he’s requesting a WAGES loan to buy 20 improved pigs. This loan will also allow him to renovate the places where he raises them in order to accommodate some new pigs. He started his husbandry in 2007 but already has many customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy improved varieties of pigs

loans.name: Damaris Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora Damaris del Carmen A. A. tiene la edad de 45 años, su estado civil es casado, Doña Máxima tiene 5 hijos  y todos trabajan de manera independiente pues esto es lo que ella les ha enseñado. Sus propósitos son de engrandecer su negocio con el fin de mantener este trabajo porque es lo que más le ha gustado. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación, hace mas de 4años que tiene este medio de vida. Ella dio inicio por cuenta propia pero no poseía mucha experiencia en la venta y trato de buscar la posibilidad de aprender pero no le fue tan difícil, ya que cuando ofertaba el producto lo hacía con timidez pero logro desenvolverse en este negocio y al paso del tiempo tomo cariño de  esta actividad. el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo propuesto para los productos necesarios como golosinas, refrescos naturales, pan, galletas y granos básicos.
texts.en:
Sra. Damaris del Carmen A. A. is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children who are all independent. She greatly enjoys her work, so she is proposing to expand her business. Sra. Damaris operates a grocery store out of her home and has been doing so for the past 4 years. Even though she is self-employed, she did not have much sales experience and used this business as an opportunity to learn these skills. She quickly discovered that it was not so difficult and was able to overcome her shyness. Now she absolutely loves what she does.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase necessary products such as candy, natural beverages, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, natural beverages, bread, cookies, and basic grains.

loans.name: Echeverie

texts.en:
Echeverie S. is a 35-year-old wife of a fisherman. She wanted to augment her husband’s income to be able to sustain the needs of their five children, whose age range is from six months to 17 years old. Last month (September), Echeverie joined ASHI to be able to have an opportunity to request a loan, which she will use for supporting her husband’s fishing business. Through her requested loan, she hopes to buy a boat of their own to be managed by her husband, and to buy another bigger one with her next loans to increase the volume of fish she can sell.

Through the loans she requests through ASHI, Echeverie believes that together with her husband, she will be able to rise above poverty.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat and necessary materials needed for fishing

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba C. is currently in the business of selling bread and charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. She is 47 years old and is married to a soldier. She has seven children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Di

texts.en: Mr. Di S. is a 53-year-old farmer who lives in Pursat Province. Di S. is married to Kam Khim, age 50. This couple, who work together in the farming business, has given birth to six children: two of the children are married and four are single. Due to the coming harvesting season, Di S. wants to have a cultivating machine to provide a tapping rice service for other farmers. As he lacks money to buy one, Di S. has decided to request a loan from Kiva. Di S. will use these funds to buy a machine to begin providing his service.

loans.use: To buy a machine to begin providing rice harvesting service.

loans.name: Ayaba Rosine

texts.fr: B. Ayaba Rosine est née le 11 Mars 1976 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Ayaba Rosine est mariée à BOKO Anselme, un mécanicien. Le couple à quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent avec leurs parents. La famille vit depuis deux ans à Cocotomey, non loin de Cotonou. Ayaba Rosine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pour cela, Ayaba Rosine vend des divers (conserves, lait, sardines, mayonnaise, pâtes alimentaires, savons, couscous, papier hygiénique, huile végétale, etc.) dans sa boutique se trouvant dans son domicile. Ayaba Rosine s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Ayaba Rosine n’a jamais obtenu de crédit à ALIDé. Pour accroître davantage son activité et satisfaire la demande de plus en plus nombreuse de sa clientèle, Ayaba Rosine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Ayaba Rosine B. was born on 11 March, 1976 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Ayaba Rosine is married to Anselme Boko, a mechanic. The couple have four children in their care, of whom three are their own. All of the children are in school and live with their parents. The family has lived in Cocotomey, not far from Cotonou, for two years. Ayaba Rosine came to the aid of her husband in providing for the family. For this, Ayaba Rosine sells various items (canned food, milk, sardines, mayonnaise, pasta, soap, couscous, toilet paper, vegetable oil, etc.) in her store, which is located in her home. Ayaba Rosine gets her supplies at Dantokpa, the international market in Benin. Ayaba Rosine has not obtained any loans through ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners) so far. To further increase her business and satisfy the demands of her growing clientele, Ayaba Rosine is seeking a loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 5 boxes of soap, 3 cans of vegetable oil, 3 boxes of sugar, and cans of milk

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is a focused hard worker. She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. She sells clothes and has been in the business for the past 6 years. She would like to get a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase a variety of clothing items and will significantly expand her clothing trade. Stella believes that having an assortment of women's outerwear that is both practical and good quality will increase her sales. She is a member of LAPO and has a good repayment report. She says thank you to all kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina V. is from the village of Silongon in Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Esterlina is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Esterlina raises and sells pigs. Esterlina has been engaged in her business for over 24 years and earns approximately 3,400 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2004, Esterlina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esterlina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. She used her previous loan to buy piglets to raise and sell. Esterlina is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Esterlina's 12th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her immediate family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Nigeria Group

texts.en:
Jambo (hello) from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania!

This is Dafrosa N. and the Nigeria loan group. Dafrosa is 42 years old, married, and has three children. Her son is the eldest at 21 years old, and her daughters are 17 and 10. All three of them are in school.

Dafrosa is a butcher by trade, and has been in the business since 2007. Her butcher shop opens at 7 a.m. every day, and closes whenever she runs out of meat or the stream of customers has ended. She estimates that she makes about 240,000 Tanzanian shillings per month, or about $180 dollars.

This will be Dafrosa's first loan from Tujijenge. She will use it to purchase more beef ("nyama ya ng'ombe" in Kiswahili), and a refrigerator that will help her preserve meat for longer and therefore reduce the amount she has to throw away. She hopes this will help her increase her profits.

In the photo, Dafrosa is standing in the back row on the left wearing a pink scarf. She is shown with the other members of her group, most of whom are food vendors in nearby markets. The Nigeria loan group thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To buy more beef and a refrigerator

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago A. C. tiene 50 años de edad, su estado civil es casado, y tiene 5 hijos: Valeria de 13 años, Gladys de 11 años, Alex de 9 años, Lenin de 7 años, y Diana de 5 años.  Vive en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.
El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Yagui Grande.  Son 38 socios en total, los cuales la mayoría se dedican a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores.
Santiago trabaja en la agricultura desde hace algunos años como actividad económica de su familia.  Los cultivos principalmente de la zona son maíz y papas.  También Santiago se dedica a la crianza de animales en pequeña cantidad.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas e insumos agrícolas.  Su sueño para el futuro es mejorar la posición económica de su familia.  Los mayores desafíos que enfrenta son las enfermedades a los hijos y problemas de la producción agrícola lo que bajan los precios.
En su tiempo libre, a Santiago le gusta jugar el deporte en la comunidad y también el carnaval que lo celebran todos los años en febrero, el cual es la unión de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Santiago A. C. is 50 years old. He is married and he has five children: 13 year-old Valeria, 11 year-old Gladys, 9 year-old Alex, 7 year-old Lenin, and 5 year-old Diana. He lives in the canton of San Miguel, in Bolívar Province. He is a member of the Yagui Grande communal bank. There are 38 members in total, the majority of whom work in agriculture and raise small animals. Santiago has been working in agriculture for a few years as an income-generating activity for his family. The main crops in the area where he lives are corn and potatoes. Santiago also raises a small number of animals. He is requesting the loan for the purchase of seeds and agricultural inputs. His dream for the future is to improve his family’s economic position. The greatest difficulties he faces are when his children become ill and also problems related to agricultural production that lower prices. In his free time, Santiago likes to play sports in his community. He also likes the “Carnaval” celebration, which is celebrated every February and brings the community together.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Víctor Samuel

texts.es: Víctor Samuel E. H. de 39 años de edad, reside en Ciudad Arce, en el departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a una extensa familia la cual esta conformada por su esposa, y seis hijos, los cuales le ayudan en el negocio. Víctor posee una ladrillería, la cual esta ubicada en su casa de habitación, en donde él se encarga de hacer los ladrillos junto a sus hijos, los cuales posteriormente reparte con los clientes o comercializa en su casa. Víctor posee varios años de experiencia en este oficio, logrando de esta manera hacer ladrillos de muy buena calidad, razón por la que cuenta con muchos clientes, así mismo él se destaca por ser un señor muy amable y responsable con su familia quien trabaja muchas veces incluso de noche para poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo y de esta manera tener una ganancia asegurada. Él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración de los ladrillos, así mismo para comprar repuestos de los instrumentos que utiliza para realizar su trabajo. Víctor desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio y de esta manera poder brindarles una mejor vida a sus seis hijos, los cuales depende del trabajo de su padre.
texts.en:
Víctor Samuel E. H. is 39 years old and a resident of Ciudad Arce in the Department of La Libertad. He lives with his large family, which includes his wife and six children who help him with his business. Victor manages a brickwork operation located outside of his home. Together with his children, he is responsible for making bricks to sell and deliver to his customers. Victor has many years of experience in this business and manufactures bricks of fine quality, which explains why he has many customers. Likewise, he is known for being a very caring man who takes responsibility for his family. He often works at night so that he can deliver his orders on time and guarantee a steady income.

The loan he is requesting will be use to buy all of the raw materials used for manufacturing bricks and also parts for the instruments he uses in his work. Victor wants so much to improve his business because his work allows him to provide a better life for his six children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for making bricks

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sabana La Marino 1 Group

texts.en:
Sandra is the coordinator of her group, Sabana la Marino (Sabana the Sailor). Her story is representative of her group and generally representative of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. Her group is located in a coastal town in the province of Hato Mayor, where the economy is dominated by agriculture and fishing, and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their four children.

Sandra is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business of running a cafeteria by purchasing necessary supplies, such as beans, rice, cooking oil, meats, sugar and fruits. She will use the profits to invest in her short-term goal of improving the home she currently lives in by adding another room to better accommodate her children. She will also save towards her long-term goal of selling her current home and purchasing a larger one. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her cafeteria

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza tiene 35 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en dos cuartos alquilados junto a su esposo Alex de 29 años y sus 3 menores hijos; lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su puesto de comida es el más concurrido del mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, todos los días sus clientes se dan cita en su puesto para degustar los deliciosos menús que prepara. Ella es una cocinera muy hábil y es que desde muy pequeña le nació el amor por la cocina y ahora se siente muy feliz realizando este trabajo.
Lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todas las personas que entran a su restaurante, ya que muchas veces tiene que trabajar sola. Con el paso de los meses, espera mejorar la infraestructura de su puesto y así tener más clientes.

Es el sexto préstamo de Maritza con MFP, espera ser muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, ya que desea acceder a más créditos. Ella es parte de un banco comunal, donde participa activamente. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará nuevas ollas y utensilios, ya que los que usaba se han deteriorado con el paso del tiempo.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old. She is a loving mother and hard-working. She lives with her 29-year old husband Alex and their three children in two rented rooms. She dreams of improving their quality of life. Her food stand is the busiest in the market in the city of Tarma. Every day her customers make plans to enjoy the delicious food she prepares. She is a great cook and has loved to cook since she was a child. She feels very content with her job. She has been working as a cook for ten years and her biggest challenges is serving all her clients because a lot of the time she works alone. In the coming months, she hopes to improve her locale and attract more customers. This is the sixth loan Maritza has had with MFP. She plans to be punctual with her payments because she hopes to apply for future loans. She is part of a community bank, of which she is an active participant. With the 1,500 new soles from this loan she will buy new pots and cooking utensils because her current utensils have gone through a lot of wear and tear.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils

loans.name: Help Together Group

texts.en: For over 19 years, Victoria K. has been selling fresh fish and charcoal in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She is 43 years old, married, and has seven children who range in age from 9 to 25 years old. Victoria was only able to attend school through 8th grade because her mother passed away and there was no one else to support her. Victoria says that because she sells a variety of fresh fish, customers are attracted to her business. She plans to use her 10,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) portion of this 48,000 LRD group loan to buy more fish and charcoal. Victoria is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Help Together". In the photo that accompanies this profile, Victoria is in the center of the photo. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, this non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women. Join Team LEAP - Liberia lending team on Kiva today: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=10019

loans.use: To purchase more fish and charcoal

loans.name: Julia Ay

texts.en:
Julia is a 58-year-old married woman. She is part of the “Unidos para el Truinfo” community bank, a name that translates to “United for Triumph”. She and her husband have three adult children who all have families of their own and no longer live with their parents. Julia has supported herself and her family for years working in the candle business. She sells candles in a shop that she has owned and operated for over fifteen years. 

Julia is asking for a Kiva loan to buy materials to make candles so that she can increase her revenue. She is appreciative of and thankful for the loan, and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: Candles

loans.name: Mario

texts.en: Mario P. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. He is 31 years old and is single. Mario owns and operates a clothing business, selling ready-to-wear clothes and other garments to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Mario joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Mario is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding his business. This loan will be his 3rd from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Chin T. is a 60-year-old wife and mother. She has been farming for years, cultivating rice. Her husband, Phol Phorn, aged 61, is a domestic ox trader. He buys oxen at reasonable prices and fattens them for a while before selling on to gain an income. The couple lives with two single children, while another two are now married and live separately. Chin T. is currently planting a rice crop, which she will harvest when mature. She sees that her husband's ox trade is the main source of family income, and this is why she has applied for a loan of $1,100 for her husband to increase his business capital.

loans.use: To increase her husband's business capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose T. is from the village of Barandias, Pangantucan Bukidnon. She is 35 years old. Rose is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rose owns and operates a business making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Rose has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rose joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rose is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rose from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Mrs. Sim N. is a 37-year-old married woman and local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Cham Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy two sacks of fertilizer and to hire a domestic laborer to plow the rest of her farmland so that she can plant crops. Sim N. and her husband are picture at their field.

loans.use: To buy two sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Renand

texts.en:
Renand I. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 29 years old. Renand is single and has 1 infant. Renand owns & operates a motorela, or habal-habal, transportation business. Renand has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Renand joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Renand is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken out by Renand from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: 03.01.33-Dien Bien Group

texts.en: Thanh T. T. (168) is a 61-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Thanh is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 33-Dien Bien (03.01.33 -Dien Bien). Thanh is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Thanh runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Thanh has been engaged in this business for more than five years and earns approximately 2.400.000 Vietnamese dong (VND) a month from it. In 2010, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Thanh is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting 4.248.000 VND, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Thanh plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it. About the other borrowers in the group: 1. L. T. Lan (167) is a 26-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business of making and selling food. 2. N. T. N. Giau (169) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her food stall business. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Thanh T. T. (168) là 61 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Thanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 33-Dien Bien (03.01.33 -Dien Bien). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương. Thanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Thanh kiếm được khoảng 2.400.000 VND. Vào 2010, Thanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Thanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. L. T. Lan (167) là 26 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. N. T. N. Giau (169) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. ."

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marcia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Marcia Del Socorro es una mujer de 42 años de edad, comerciante de una pequeña pulpería que ha venido invirtiendo con dinero propio pues no es el primer financiamiento por lo que con ellos ha podido salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida. Pues ha logrado mantener estable su negocio, solo que algunas veces no tiene el capital para seguir invirtiendo, por lo que con el tiempo y la experiencia han sido los factores fundamentales para continuar. 
Con este préstamo invertirá en granos básicos, que es el alimento principal, lácteos, carne, golosinas, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcia Del Socorro, 42, operates a small corner shop which she has developed, in part, with her own money. However, this isn't her first loan and she has used past loans to get ahead and improve the quality of her life. Although she has managed to stablilize her business, there are times when she doesn't have enough to cover her operational expenses and she has to rely on time and experience to go on. She will use this loan to buy the products she sells: staple grains, dairy products, meat, candy, cold drinks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Bolinao. She is 29 years old. Veronica is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Veronica owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Veronica from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace M. is from the village of Bunawan, Calamba. She is 36 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Grace is engaged in the buying and selling of rice and corn. She has been operating her business for five years and earns a monthly income of approximately 1300.00 Philippine pesos (PHP). In 2007, Grace joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Grace has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Grace is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Grace from PMPC. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Phiona

texts.en:
Phiona A. lives in the Kawala neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (relatives). Phiona has a business selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for many years, and she works seven days out of every week. Phiona sells her products at the market by means of retail.

Phiona has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. She also generates additional income through owning a small retail shop at which she works in the evenings. The main business challenges for Phiona include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own permanent business premises and also to start importing secondhand clothes.

Phiona lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es: Evangelina, es una madre de familia muy noble y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Las actividades a la que se dedica Evangelina, es la costura y la venta de productos de belleza, es así que sus días los organiza de la siguiente manera: durante las mañana borda polos de algodón en su casa y por la tarde recorre las calles de su distrito, ofreciendo sus productos de belleza. En este último trabajo ella demuestra ser toda una experta, ya que tiene la facilidad de convencer a sus clientes de escoger tal producto, motivo por el cual venden muy  rápido los perfumes femeninos, joyas, por lo que tiene que abastecerse constantemente, de este modo hace que su negocio le sea muy rentable y así puede brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que deben usar, disfruta mucho de su negocio, aunque eso implique que tenga que caminar mucho. Con el tiempo anhela poner un  bazar de ropa en un mercado que sea muy concurrido. Es su 21avo crédito con MFP y esta feliz de poder obtenerlo, manifiesta que lo invertirá todo en el negocio, ya que quiere mejorar su calidad de vida. Con el crédito solicitado, incrementará sus productos de belleza, asimismo desea llevar su maquina de coser al técnico para darle mantenimiento.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a very good mother and worker.  She lives in her own house with her husband and 4 children. Evangelina sews and sells beauty products and arranges her days in the following manner:  during the morning, she embroiders cotton t-shirts at home, and in the afternoon, she sells beauty products through the streets of her town.  It is through her sales ability that she proves herself an expert, since she has the knack to convince her customers to choose specific products.  It is because of this that she sells her products quickly - products like perfumes for women and jewelry, and it is because of this that she constantly has to restock her inventory of products so that she can keep her business profitable and continue to provide a good living for her children.  Evangelina loves advising her customers about which products to use, and enjoys this aspect of her business even though it sometimes means having to walk far.  Her long term goal is to sell clothes in the town's crowded market bazaar.

Evangelina is happy to get this loan and wants to invest it mainly in her business in order to improve their quality of life. This loan will enable her to increase her beauty product inventory, and she also wants to bring her sewing machine in to a technician for maintenance.

loans.use: Incrementar productos de belleza para tener en stock.  (to purchase beauty products to increase her inventory)

loans.name: Francisco René

texts.es: El Sr.  Francisco René G. H. él es trabajador activo de la empresa CEMEX de Nicaragua desempeñándose como Mecánico industrial tiene veinte años de trabajar para esta institución es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  tres  créditos con CEPRODEL y cada uno lo  ha realizado para la compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo está solicitando para gastos personales y médicos,  los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en: Francisco René G. H. is married, works as an industrial mechanic for the CEMEX company in Nicaragua, and has been doing so for 20 years.  He has had three previous loans through CEPRODEL and has used each one to buy construction materials with which to make improvements to his home.  He is requesting this loan for personal medical expenses.  The CEPRODEL loans have benefited him greatly because they have allowed him to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Rosa Enriqueta

texts.es: Rosa Enriqueta tiene 66 años, esta emprendedora Señora se dedica a una pulpería. No es la primera vez que solicita créditos con fundación, pues ha sido necesario para que su negocio avance. Hace más de 9 años que todos sus clientes llegan a su vivienda en donde está ubicado el negocio, por lo que tiene que levantarse temprano para atender a todos sus clientes que llegan en busca de diferentes productos. Inicio con muy poco capital pero la buena administración que ella realiza ha logrado tener lo que posee. Este crédito es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, refrescos, galletas, detergentes, fideos, sopas fósforos entre otros.
texts.en:
Rosa Enriqueta is 66 years old.  This enterprising lady runs a general store.  This is not the first time she has asked for a loan with Fundación, since it has been necessary to help build her business.

For more than nine years all her customers have come to her house, where the business is located.  For this reason, Rosa must wake up early to take care of all her customers, who come looking for different products.  She began with very little capital, but her good business administration has allowed her to earn what she now has.

This loan is for purchasing resources like snacks, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, pasta, soups and matches, among other items.

loans.use: Business capital to buy snacks, soft drinks, cookies, detergents, pasta, soups, matches, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es socia del  Banco Comunal “Bartolina Sisa”, ubicado en el distrito D. Ilave, provincia D. EL Collao, Departamento  Puno, tiene 42 años D. edad,  D. estado civil casada, con dos hijos y grado D. instrucción secundaria completa.
La señora está trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace diez años, el primer préstamo solicitado fue D. S/. 300. 00 nuevo soles, dinero que utilizó para incrementar  el capital  D. su negocio (engorD. D. ganado vacuno), actualmente tiene una tienda D. abarrotes donD. se pueD. adquirir diferentes productos. 
Con éste préstamo D. S/ 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará productos diversos para incrementar su stock.
Su sueño es tener un restaurant.
Lo  que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es conversar, bromear y las charlas facilitadas por la promotora.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the “Bartolina Sisa” community bank which is located in Ilave district, in El Collao province, in the department of Puno.  She is 42 years old, married, and has two children.  She completed her secondary education.

Juana has been working with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for ten years.  Her first loan was for 300 nuevos soles and she used that money to increase the working capital of her business (fattening cattle).  She currently has a grocery store where people can buy different products.

She will use this loan for 1,500 nuevos soles to buy products to increase her stock.

Her dream is to own a restaurant.

What she most likes about her community bank is the chatting and joking amongst the members and the talks which they are given.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is a resident of a city named Lahore in Pakistan that is known for its history and culture. She is 37 years old and has been living there in the area named Mughalpura for over 15 years. She is married to Z. I. who is a rickshaw driver. He provides transport services to his passengers and earns income by dropping them off at their desired destinations.  

Nargis is a caring lady, preferring to stay at home and carry out her responsibilities of a housewife. She has given birth to 2 sons. Both are enrolled in a local school and studying in class grades 9th and 4th. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan, he will purchase his own rickshaw, because currently he drives a rickshaw on rent. After struggling much in a full day, he has to share half his income with the rickshaw owner, and the remaining income becomes insufficient to meet the financial needs of the family. Nargis hopes that a loan investment will enable him to drive the rickshaw as long as he wants and earn good income by providing his transport services to the maximum number of passengers. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah, and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. Note: In the photo, the lady with hand up is Nargis.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Irongul

texts.en:
K. Irongul has been a farmer for 5 years.  He is dedicated to the production of potatoes and onions. He is married and has 6 children. His wife is a housekeeper and Irongul's business is the sole source of income for his family. His onion harvest is about to come in and that is why he is requesting a loan of 6500 Somoni to acquire agricultural products to apply them to his harvest. With part of the loan, he will also buy young cattle to raise and sell. Irongul wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his business will bring.     


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer, and young cattle

loans.name: Tita Paula

texts.es:
Tita Paula Z. A. tiene 32 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto el Caimito, perteneciente a la parroquia puerto pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, fréjol gandul , esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Tita Paula se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial García y Comercial López y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener una casa propia y terreno..

Le gusta realizar quehaceres domésticos.
texts.en:
Tita Paula Z. A. is 32 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and children in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  She has 2 children.

The members of the JERUSALEN community bank are located in Caimito district, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton.  The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this line of work for many years.

Tita Paula is a farmer who grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She buys her products in the García and López shopping areas and sells her products in the Vaca shopping area.  She is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for her corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own home and plot of land.

Tita Paula enjoys doing her household chores.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Sofia has a business of selling fruits and vegetables, which she has had for 2 years.  She rears animals  

To help expand her business, Sofia has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sofia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Sofia hopes to own a plot. Sofia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning how to work together.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Marie Irene

texts.fr:
Mama Irène pour les autres membres de la Baco enfants unis ,est une  femme qui a été de beaucoup pour l’aboutissement du cycle 1 du premier prêt, âgée de 48 ans , célibataire, mère de 5 enfants, elle est dans la vente des divers tels que : Ustensiles de cuisine en plastiques, slips, bonbons, biscuits chips, sandales, mèches et casseroles.
.
Avant le premier prêt, elle avait des ventes qui allaient jusqu’à 20.000f par jour, ses revenus et ses bénéfices ont aussi connus une nette amélioration, grâce à l’expérience acquise en gestion de stock, Mama Irène, espère vendre plus avec le second  prêt pour augmenter ses revenus. Elle va acheter pour ce second prêt Des douzaines de slips de tout âges et sexes confondus, 10 cartons  (de bonbons  et  biscuits) de toutes les marques, des sandales pour les hommes, femmes, enfants, et les mèches de toutes les  qualités et des casseroles .
Dans l’espoir  de continuer avec le système des micro-finances, elle veut   générer des revenus pour accroitre son activité.
A l’avenir, elle  veut contribuer à l’éducation de ses enfants et leurs construire une maison.
texts.en: For the other members of Baco enfants unis, Mama Irène is a woman who has by far done a lot for completing Cycle 1 of the first loan. She is 48 years old, unmarried, and the mother of five children. She sells a variety of goods, such as: plastic kitchen utensils, undergarments, candies, cookies, chips, sandals, hair extensions, and pots and pans. With the first loan, she had sales as much as 20,000 francs a day. Her revenues and profits have also experienced a clear improvement, thanks to the lessons learned from managing inventory. Mama Irène hopes to sell more with the second loan in order to increase her revenues. She is thus going to buy: dozens of undergarments for any age and gender; 10 boxes of candies and cookies of all brands; sandals for men, women, and children; hair extensions of all qualities; and pots and pans. Hoping to continue with the micro-finance system, she wants to generate revenues for growing her business. For the future, she wants to help with educating her children and to build a house for them.

loans.use: Buying pots, pans, boxes of sweets, cookies, hair extensions, plastic utensiles

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es:
Cinthia, tiene 22 años de edad, tiene una hija y vive  en la ciudad de Cusco, Perú. Cinthia y su esposo Abelardo tienen un taller de planchado y pintado de carros llamado “Planchado y Pintura Ancashiño”. Ya son tres años que se dedican a este negocio y le va muy bien. Cinthia requiere el préstamo para comprar un taladro. El anhelo de Cinthia es tener su taller bien implementado con maquinarias modernas. 
   
Cinthia pertenece al banco comunal “Yahuar Maqui” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Cinthia is 22 years old, has a daughter and lives in Cusco, Peru.  Cinthia and her husband Abelardo have an auto body and paint repair shop called "Planchado y Pintura Ancashiño".  They started their business three years ago and it has been very successful so far.  Cinthia needs the loan to buy a drill.  Her dream is to furnish her shop with all the latest tools and machinery.

Cinthia is a member of the "Yahuar Maqui" communal bank which belongs to the Arariwa Association.  She is grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a drill

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco de 55 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, tiene casa propia, y vive junto a su esposa y tres hijos de 33, 25 y 21 años de edad, él se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas desde hace 11 años, estos cultivos le han ayudado a mantener el hogar.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales para sembrar nuevamente, ya que como esta actividad es la que le provee ingresos, él no quiere dejar de cultivar, por lo que necesita adquirir semilla, abono y fertilizantes.
Las aspiraciones de don Francisco es realizar cada vez mejor las cosechas, continuar produciendo la tierra para que también su familia siga contando con esta fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Francisco, 55, lives in Jiquilisco, Usulután department.  He has a house of his own and lives with his wife and three children who are 33, 25 and 21 years of age.  He has been a vegetable farmer for the last 11 years.  These crops have helped him support his household.

He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies to plant again because, since this activity is what generates income, he does not want stop farming.  He needs, therefore, to acquire seed, manure and fertilizer.

Francisco’s hopes are to produce better crops each time and to continue farming the land so that his family will continue to have this source of income.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Elva

texts.es: Elva, de 34 años, vive al lado  de sus jóvenes hijos; pues es separada y juntos buscan progresar cada día para salir adelante. Desde hace 2 años, esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta de zapatos, para todo tipo de época, actualmente ella se encuentra vendiendo sandalias, ya que este verano amerita el uso de esta prenda por el excesivo calor que hace, es por ello que Elva viene obteniendo buenas ventas. Ella compra al por mayor las sandalias, en variedad de diseños, así cuando va a ofrecerlas tiene para diversidad de gustos y colores. Además paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica al bordado en prendas de vestir y trabaja para una intermediaria que le da las prendas y ella se las entrega semanalmente bordadas. Todo este tiempo su trabajo ha hecho que ella se sienta independiente y con mucha fortaleza para seguir mejorando su  negocio, es así que ella quisiera tener un puesto fijo en una zona muy concurrida para así poder ofrecer más cómodamente su mercadería.
