Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar con su labor. Elva tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de  pedrería de diferente variedad pues desea empezar a trabajar sin intermediarios para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Elva, 34 years old, lives alongside her young children; she is separated and together they seek to make progress each day in order to get ahead.

For some 2 years, this enterprising woman has sold shoes for every season.  Presently, she sells sandals, since it is summer and that is what people are using due to the excess heat.  For that reason, Elva is enjoying good sales.  She buys the sandals at wholesale in a variety of designs, so that when she sells them she can satisfy diverse tastes and colors.

In addition, parallel to this, Elva embroiders women's clothes and works for an intermediary who gives her the articles of clothing, then she returns them weekly embroidered.  All this time, her work has made her feel independent and very determined to continue improving her business.  For that reason, she wants to have a fixed post in the most active zone, so she can offer her merchandise more comfortably. 

This is Elva's 4th loan through MFP and she promises to make her payments punctually; she doesn't want to alienate those who make it possible to continue her work.  Elva plans to invest the solicited loan in buying stones of different types, and she wants to begin working without intermediaries in order to obtain better earnings.

loans.use: TO BUY DECORATIVE STONES TO  USE IN NEEDLEWORK ON LADIES CLOTHING

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch K. (pictured above) and her husband, Mr. Kosal Oem, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have four sons and two daughters. Four are in school and the other two help their aunt sell food in Phnom Penh.

Touch is a weaver. She is requesting her third loan of $250 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving; she will also use part of the loan to repair the house where she lives.

loans.use: to purchase weaving materials and repair her house

loans.name: Salamti's Group

texts.en:
Salamti belongs to Khanewal which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Shanti Nagar for the past 10 years. She is a housewife and spends most of her time at home doing her household work. She is a mother of one daughter who is 6 years old and has yet not started getting an education due to financial constraints. 

She is married to S. who is a farmer by trade and involved in agriculture. He grows different seasonal crops and sells them to his clients after harvesting, for a profit. 

Salamti has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides, etc. to grow crops and earn better profits. 

He has been operating this business for the past eight years and Salamti is hopeful that an investment will help him getting maximum profits from his hard work. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Salamti.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria K. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has eight children, one of whom attends school. Victoria has a poultry business.  She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days a week. Victoria sells her products from home by means of retail.  Victoria is requesting a loan for 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy to buy more bags of chicken feed and drugs.  She also generates additional income by raising pigs. The main business challenges for Victoria include thieves, transportation of chicken feed, and increasing prices of chicken feed.  Her goals for her business are to own 2,000 chickens and a delivery van to ease transportation. Victoria lives in a home, which she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food, and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed

loans.name: Maria Bertha

texts.es:
María  tiene 57 años de edad, vive con conviviente y sus 2 hijos, vive en casa propia que esta ubicada en un caserío llamado  Huáscar  en el distrito de Tambogrande, este caserío es  mediano con deseos de superación.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de cerdos y  animales menores y aves de corral, el cría gallinas, patos, pavos y gallinas , en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Ella cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el rubro 

María desea adquirir alimentos balanceados  para sus cerdos y aves, ya que la demanda ha aumentado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

María es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María is 57 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband and two children in her own home which is located in a village called Huáscar, in Tambogrande district.  This is a medium-sized, developing village.

María raises and sells pigs, young animals and poultry.  She raises hens, ducks and turkeys in an area behind her home and, when the animals have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the traders who usually visit her area.  She has more than five years experience in this line of work.

María would like to acquire balanced feed for her pigs and poultry since her demand has increased.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

María is a mother who is committed to her family and always watches over their well-being and development.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to acquire balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is married and has business making ice cream in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family and has run her business for 20 years now.

Evelyn is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients to make ice cream to sell. In the future, she would like to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a hairdresser selling hair products in Ankwanda, a village near Elmina. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a laborer and Rita helps him in providing for their home. Her loan will be used to buy creams, hair extensions and other items. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a salon.

loans.use: to buy creams, hair extensions and other items.

loans.name: Luisa Del Rosario

texts.es:
Luisa del Rosario tiene 42 años, es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Denilson 10 años, Nayely 9 años y Lady 7 años. Vive en El Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos.

Esta Ventanilla se llama V.R.C. 26 DE NOVIEMBRE, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Las Blancas, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla tiene 10 socio los cuales se dedican a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz y frejol gandul.

Luisa se dedica a la agricultura en especial a la siembra de maíz,  arroz y frejol gandul. Las comprar las realiza en Ventanas cada mes y las vende en la feria de la misma localidad.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y darles la educacion a los hijos.

Le gusta mucho escuchar musica y bailar.
texts.en:
Luisa del Rosario is 42 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and her children: 10 year-old Denilson, 9 year-old Nayely and 7 year-old Lady.  They live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.

This community bank is called '26 de Noviembre' and it is located in Las Blancas, in Ventanas canton.  The group has 10 members who all work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Luisa is a farmer.  In particular, she grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  She makes her purchases in Ventanas each month and makes her sales in the street market in the same town.

Luisa is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs and increase her production.  Her dream is to continue working and to provide her children with an education.

Luisa really enjoys listening to music and dancing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Steven

texts.en: Steven is a twenty nine year old hardworking man with three children.  He owns a house in Kasese,Uganda. He is the sole breadwinner of the family and his wish is to educate his children.  For seven years he has been selling house hold utensils such as cups and plates and this has helped him in maintaining the family. His challenge is high transport costs and breakages during transportation. Steven's vision is to own a wholesale shop dealing in the same merchandise. Steven needs this loan to buy cups and plates for sale.

loans.use: To buy cups and plates for sale.

loans.name: Dany Robert

texts.es:
Dany de 34 años, es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con los servicios de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Nueva Arica que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Zona de actividad comercial y crianza de animales menores.

Dany cuenta con su negocio propio de preparación y venta de comida, la cual a colocado en su domicilio, actividad que realiza desde  hace algunos años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocido en la zona donde vive por la limpieza, la atención y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá solventar sus gastos  personales.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 3000 nuevos soles para comprar utensilios e insumos para continuar preparando su comida, para  seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir su crédito otorgado y mejorar su calidad de vida.  Dany con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga un restaurante grande con una gran variedad de platos para seguir ayudando económicamente a sus padres.
texts.en:
Dany, age 34, is single and lives in his parents' home. They have running water and electricity, and live in the Nueva Arica district which belongs to the Chiclayo province. This is a commercial zone where small animals are also raised.

Dany has his own business preparing and selling food in his home. He has done this for several years. He has his own customer base and is known in the area in which he lives for his cleanliness, the care he puts into his food, and for the good flavours of his dishes. With the ingredients that he will acquire, he will be able to cover his personal costs.

He has requested a loan of 3000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of utensils and supplies in order to continue preparing his food and to continue offering a good service to his customers. With his earnings he will be able to pay off the loan and improve his quality of life. With his work and desire to get ahead, Dany has gained the confidence of his customers. His goal is to have a big restaurant in the future, with a large variety of dishes so that he can continue to help his parents economically.

loans.use: to purchase utensils and supplies to continue preparing food.

loans.name: Maria Francisca Alicia

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta D. ropa americana, sodas, golosinas, productos D. la canasta básica, ella es V., vive con dos nietos, inicio junto a su esposo ofreciendo únicamente pan, poco a poco con la ayuda D. sus hijos tuvo la oportunidad D. crecer en el negocio, su horario D. trabajo inicia a las 8:00am a 8:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra D. artículos D. consumo como bebidas, jugos, huevos, azúcar y demás mercadería, con el préstamo podrá cubrir la necesidad D. mantener en el inventario todo lo relacionado al hogar.
Su aspiración es hacer un mejor negocio D. cada inversión, cuidar las ganancias para ahorrar y ofrecer a su familia un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María has a business selling used American clothes, sodas, snacks, and staple products. She is a widow and lives with two grandchildren. She and her husband began their business selling bread, and little by little with help from their children they were able to grow their business. Her business is open from 8:00 A.M. to 8:00 P.M.

She is currently seeking a loan to buy products for her store like drinks, juices, eggs, and sugar. The loan will allow her to maintain an inventory of goods for her customers. Her goal is to improve her business through investment, to use her profits wisely, and to proviD. her family with a better future.

loans.use: purchase staple products like drinks, eggs, and sugar for her store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Teresita has a flower shop that sells a variety of flowers like orchids and baby's breath. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for flowers to sell.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2002. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for flowers

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 33 года. Замужем. Имеет четверых детей. Ее муж предоставляет услугу, такси. Сама она тоже предоставляет услугу. Мукаддас занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Этим видом деятельности занимается два года. Кредит берет для закупа новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Mukaddas lives in the town of Vahdat. 33 years of age. Married, with four children. Her husband provides taxi services. Mukaddas is also in the service business. She sews traditional national clothing. She has been doing this work for two years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Furkatchon

texts.ru: Фуркатчон целеустремлённый и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Он хочет устроит своего ребенка в хорошую садик и хочет чтоб он вырос хорошим и умным. Более 4 лет Фуркатчон занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур. В основном он сеет и выращивает семена лука, пшеницы и кукуруза. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота. В сегодняшний день он имеет 2 голов коров и 8 голов овца. Фуркатчон хочет расширить свой бизнес и получит максимальный прибыль. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 2600$ США для покупки семена и оплата за аренду земли.  Он заранее благодарит всех, кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Furkatchon is a goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of one child.  He wants to place his child into a good kindergarten and wants him to grow to be good and smart.  Furkatchon has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over four years.  He primarily sows and grows seeds of onions, wheat and corn.  Besides this, he is involved in raising livestock.  Today he has two cows and eight sheep.  Furkatchon wants to expand his business and maximize his profits.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $2600 for the purchase of seeds and payment for land lease.  He thanks everyone, who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for land lease

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 24-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. He has owned a shoe shop since 2009. He also sells women bags. Mohamad is considered a new business owner but due to his high competency at work, he was able to noticeably develop his business and even hire a full-time employee working as a salesman. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional merchandise for his business. The winter season is about to begin and he needs to get the new winter shoes and bags collection to satisfy his customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for his business

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She works hard to support her family. 
Anabelle has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Kiva partner NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice and charcoal.
In the future, Anabelle would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat is a 27 year old married man. He has a one month old child.  He describes himself as quiet and polite. 

He operates a restaurant where he sells food to the local people and has been in business for a year.  Josephat's restaurant is located in a busy shopping centre. 

Josephat says his biggest business challenge is high commodity prices due to inflation.  He will use the Kes 15000 loan to increase his stock of food items.  

His business goal is to open a bigger restaurant within 5 years. He hopes to educate his children and put up a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, detergents etc

loans.name: Federica

texts.es: Doña Federica tiene 58 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos pero ya todos casados, ella se dedica a hacer costuras desde hace poco mas de 10 años dice que su mama fue que le enseño hacer las costuras como almohadones, servilletas, manteles, etc. ella ofrece sus costuras casa por casa en su localidad y a veces se va a los tianguis a venderlas, doña Federica esta pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material ella comprara tela, hilos, aros, agujas, estambre etc. dice que esta muy contenta por que con el crédito podrá tener material, la meta que tiene la señora es invertir en frutas y verduras para vender.
texts.en: Federica is 58 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all of them married. She has done sewing for a little more than 10 years. She says that her mother taught her to sew and embroider things like pillow cases, napkins, tablecloths, etc. She offers her embroidered items from the locale she has in her house and sometimes she goes to sell it in street markets. Federica is asking for a loan to buy materials. She will buy fabric, thread, rings, needles, worsted yarn. etc. She says she is very happy with the loan because with it she will be able to have materials. Her goal is to invest in fruit and vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to do artisanal embroidery.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 32-year-old married man. He describes himself as a hardworking businessman. He has been operating  a quarrying business for the last ten years to support his family. His potential customers are local residents. In the next 5 years, Paul wants to expand his business. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a piece of land for quarrying. Since Paul joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To buy a piece of land for quarrying.

loans.name: Altynai

texts.ru:
Алтынай 46 лет, замужем. Муж Касым занимается скотоводством.  В поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 1997 году Алтынай начала свой бизнес в торговле овощами и фруктами. Стартовав с суммы 8,000 сом (KGS), Алтынай благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  10,000 сом (KGS). Фрукты, такие как мандарины, виноград, хурма она привозит из Таджикистана, также закупает продукцию в виде яблок, помидоров, перца у местных производителей по оптовой цене, затем продает на местном рынке.  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Алтынай обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Алтынай планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en:
Altynai is a married forty-six year old. Her husband is an animal breeder. 
In 1997, in need of an additional source of income, Altynai began a business selling fruits and vegetables. Altynai had a starting capitol of 8,000 soms (KGS) but, due to her persistence and hard work, she now manages a business with a monthly profit of 10,000 soms (KGS). 
She imports fruits like mandarins, grapes and date-plums from Tajikistan while purchasing apples, tomatoes and peppers from local farmers. This is then sold at the local market. In order to expand her business further, Altynai came to 'Bai Tushum and Partners' for a loan of 100,000 soms (KGS) needed to broaden her assortment of goods. She plans to invest the profits from this loan into expanding her sales point.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.en:
Jane is the facilitator of Baraka group. Jane and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

 Jane takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, she had a good maize yield harvesting 7 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  she was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on ½  acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jane and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Jane will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing. 

In 2012, the members of Baraka group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land. Jane is pictured with her group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, oil, and condiments.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
At her age of 63, Esterlita can still manage a farming business. Esterlita has managed a rice farming business for 45 years. With her long duration of experience in farming, she is proud to say that she is already an expert in planting rice. She is married and has one child.

Since she is managing their farm, Esterlita admits that her income from every crop is not enough to finance her expenses in farming. Esterlita wishes to have enough capital to maintain the business. She is requesting a loan of P27,000 to buy seeds of rice, fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost in farming.

Esterlita hopes that she will earn higher income from the business and save some of it for her family's future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, and to pay for the labor cost in farming.

loans.name: Lucia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lucía se ha dedicado por mas de 20 años a las actividades agropecuarias. En la finca que es propiedad de su esposo tiene gallinas, pollos y ganado bovino, con los ingresos que le genera esta actividad ha podido mantener a su familia y a sus tres hijos. Con la aspiración de poder incrementar sus ingresos y de que su negocio se consolide, la señora Lucía aspira a incrementar su cantidad de gallinas y que en un futuro pueda tener un negocio avícola, el cual le genere una estabilidad económica. Para poder cumplir su sueño, requiere de la compra de gallinas que le aumenten el negocio de la venta de huevos, y así seguir progresando en su negocio y brindándole una mejor calidad de vida a su esposo e hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Lucía has engaged in farming activities for more than 20 years. On the farm that her husband owns, Lucía raises chickens and cattle. The income generated from this business helps to support her family, which includes her three children. She aspires to increase her income and strengthen her business, so Lucía aims to acquire more chickens in order to have a full-time poultry business that can provide financial stability.

To fulfill this dream, she needs to buy hens so that she can sell more eggs. As a result, she can continue to make progress in her business and provide a better quality of life for her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy hens so that she can increase her egg sales.

loans.name: Simamao

texts.en:
Simamao is a 44-year-old woman living in the town of Salelologa.  She is married and has five adult children.  To make a living, Simamao owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops.  The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting coconuts for sale.  Simamao has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 600 WST (approximately 280 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2011, Simamao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Simamao requested her first loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.    Simamao plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Faizullo

texts.ru: файзулло  молодой парень 31 года, содержит  семью из троих детей, занимается услугами маршрутного такси. Имеет 10ти летний стаж в вождении.  Он развозит людей по городу и за город.   В нашу организацию обратился 1,5 года назад на ремонт своей арендованной автомашины и получил  кредит. Тогда он был наемным водителем и брал свою автомашину в аренду.  Накопил достаточную сумму денег на покупку собственного автомобиля и осуществил свою мечту.  Получая небольшие кредиты он купил первый микроавтобус.  Этот  микроавтобус немного требует ремонта и Файзулло планирует подготовить его на зимний период.  На полученный кредит хочет купить некоторые запчасти и зимних покрышек.  Заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Faizullo is a young man of 31 years, who is supporting a family of three children through offering a "marshrutka" taxi service. He has 10 years of experience in driving. He takes people around and out of the city. He turned to our organization 1.5 years ago for repairing his rented vehicle, and he received a loan. At that time he was a hired driver and was renting his vehicle. 

Faizullo saved up a sufficient amount of money to purchase his own vehicle and realized his dream. Receiving a small loan he bought his first minibus. This minibus is in need of some repair and Faizullo plans to prepare it for the winter period. For the loan he would like to purchase some spare parts and winter tires. He thanks for your support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase winter tires for his minibus

loans.name: Hibaq Abdalle

texts.en: Hibaq is 22 years old and single. She studies at Adisababa Medical University College Faculty of Nursing. She needs a laptop to read her lessons, prepare assignments, and use university wireless to search for books and video tutorials. Kaaba provided her with a laptop that she can pay for in installments. After finishing the university, Hibaq hopes to work as a Hargeisa Hospital nurse.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 61 years old and is married with 4 children. 

Anita is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock.

Anita has been raising livestock for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Anita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco manufactures drawers, shelves and book cases. This is the family business passed down to him by his father. Francisco was born in Guayaquil, but his family moved to the Galapagos Islands when he was 10 years old in search for work. After getting married and opening his own business, he and his wife decided to move back to Guayaquil where both of them still had a significant amount of family.

Francisco has always relied on this business to support his family. He makes most of his products after receiving an order because he cannot afford to manufacturer in advance. He has requested this loan in order to buy a new rotary tool that will help him sand and polish his finished products.

Francisco has two children who are already independent. His wife cares for his two grand children and Francisco pays for their meals while the children’s parents are working during the day. This loan will help him continue to support his family.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: He has requested this loan in order to buy a new rotary tool that will help him sand and polish his finished products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace owns a butcher shop selling beef and goat meat. She started this business three years ago. She wants to improve the business by  buying a meat grinding machine and a glass display. She noticed that her competitors do not have such equipment and believes this will make her products more attractive, thus giving her a competitive advantage. She also wants to increase the amount of her working capital in order to run her business more effectively. She needs USD 550 to execute her plans.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Rusmini

texts.en:
Rusmini is 42 years old,and is married with two children, both of whom are girls. Rusmini and her husband, Empuh, buy waste material like plastic cups, plastic bottles, cardboard and paper from her neighbors and other houses in the village. Her husband uses a cart to collect scrap metal and other waste material. 

Households do not just give away waste material because there is demand and therefore economic value in recycling. With more capital, they can purchase more scrap to recycle. Rusmini and her husband are the first link in this chain, buying waste and scrap materials from households, sorting and cleaning them before selling them to an intermediate dealer. This dealer comes around in a small truck, collects the sorted  material and takes it to the warehouse dealer. There, the different materials are weighed in front of Rusmini’s husband, who then gets paid by the intermediate dealer. The warehouse dealer in turn sends the waste materials to various processing factories which in turn produce clean and reusable recycled paper, cardboard and plastic recycled raw materials. Waste recycling undertaken by Rusmini and her husband thus helps clean the environment by reusing waste material which otherwise would go to the landfills. In a day Rusmini can earn $60. She needs a loan of $75. With this loan, she can buy more waste material and thus more or less double her income. Rusmini very much wants to earn more money for her childrens’ education and to give them a better life.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials

loans.name: Wilfrido

texts.es:
Mr. Wilfredo A. is married, his wife’s name is Andresa and they have 6 kids, they all live together, four of them are studying on high school in the city and the other two are already working helping therefore the family. Mr. Wilfredo has a small carrier for more than 9 years, where he sells fast food at the Bus Station in the city, his specialty is grilled meat and shish kebabs of beef and chicken. Mr. Wilfredo is very well known in the city, has several clients who love his products, he works from 10pm to 2am during the week and from 8pm to 6am during the weekends, because most of his clients are also people who goes out to eat after a party. Wilfredo wants a loan to buy pork meat in large quantities, to vary his products and sell also pork shish kebabs, buying large quantities he will get good discounts that will help him obtain a better profit.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Wilfrido A. es casado, su señora se llama Andresa y tienen 6 hijos, todos viven juntos, 4 de ellos están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad y los otros 2 mayores ya trabajan aportando así con los gastos de la casa. Don Wilfrido hace más de 9 años que tiene un carrito ubicado en la Terminal de Ómnibus de la ciudad donde vende comida rápida, su especialidad es el asadito o brochetas de carne vacuna y pollo. Don Wilfrido es bastante conocido en la ciudad, tiene muchos clientes, a quienes les encantan sus productos; entre semana trabaja desde las 10 am hasta las 2 am y los fines de semana desde las 8 pm hasta las 6 am, pues muchos de sus clientes también son personas que salen de las fiestas a esa hora a comer. Wilfrido desea adquirir un préstamo para comprar carne de cerdo en gran cantidad, para variar sus productos y vender también brochetas de cerdo; al comprar al por mayor también obtendrá importantes descuentos que lo ayudara a obtener mayores ganancias.

loans.use: Buying pork meat in large quantities

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a 31 year old local resident of the town of Khachmaz located in the north-east part of Azerbaijan. He is married and has one child. Two years ago he built a small shop in Khachmaz where he sells fruit and vegetables there. He has repaired some part of the shop but he has no own funds to finish the repairing. He applies to Normicro for a loan in amount of $300 to finish repairing.

loans.use: To repair the shop

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Amelia is single, but she lives with a man who has 3 children. Amelia's husband is unemployed. He lives from small jobs. And that's why Amelia decided to join the credit program. She wants to use the money to invest in her business to see the business grow, and she can use the profit to help her husband pay household expenses and the children's schooling.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Amelia e solteira, mas vive com um homem de quem tem 3 filhos. O marido de Amelia nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expedientes. E por isso que Amelia decidiu entrar para o programa de credito.Ela quer usar o dinheiro para investir no seu negocio para ver se o negocio cresce e ela possa usar os rendimentos para ajudar o marido no pagamento das despesas da casa e da escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Amelia wants to use the loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nuryati

texts.en: Nuryati is 34 years old, married and has a 12-year-old child. She makes a living selling flowers, and usually earns about $5 per week. Her husband, I., sells waste and scrap materials and earns $2.50 per day. Nuryati has applied for a loan which she will use to grow more flowers to sell to her customers, and also to expand her husband's business. She will repay the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To grow more flowers to sell to her customers and help expand her husband's business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti, 26, is the mother of 2 daughters aged 6 and 1. She has a small grocery store at her house, earning about US$ 26 a day. She is asking for a loan of US$ 75 to expand her little store so that she can provide tuition for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: to expand her little grocery store so that she can afford her children's school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her cereals business with a permanent location

loans.name: Gnima

texts.fr:
Gnima was born in 1960, and is the mother of a family. She has been a member of the Village Bank in Ziguinchor for 7 years and has always repaid her loans without incident. She sells brooms made in the traditional fashion from saplings. She is asking for this loan to strengthen this business, which she has managed for several years and allows her to meet her needs. Gnima intends to repay this loan at the end of six months in one payment.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Gnima est née en 1960, mère de famille. Elle est membre du BV de Hathioume à Ziguinchor depuis 7 ans et a toujours remboursé ses prêts sans problème.Elle vend des balais produits de façon artisanale à partir de tiges d'arbres. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer cette activité qu'elle mène depuis des années et lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins.Gnima propose de rembourser au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: To buy brooms

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun M. and her husband married in 1986. They have three children: one son and two daughters. One of her daughters is a hairdresser and other two children are in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Savun has been selling groceries since 1999 and has been a silk weaver since 1982. It’s a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished product to a middle man in the village who sells it in Phnom Penh. 

Mrs. Savun is requesting a loan in the amount of $200 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a cripple since infancy and, therefore, his father failed to support him. A nurse in his village came in to support him to become a cobbler. She gave him the initial capital to start his operation.

Francis is thirty years old and he needs additional capital to buy more leather and glue to make shoes and slippers. He hopes to start savings to help with his three children’s education and also to register and become a member of the Government’s health insurance scheme. Francis is a member of the group called Nyame ne ye Boafo (meaning "God is our Helper"). Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more leather to make shoes and slippers

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi:
From the first days that the Fund was announced in her hometown, Mrs. K. Thi Mai had started planning with her husband, Thanh Van Nguyen, to join the Tinh Thuong Fund which focuses entirely on agricultural ventures. From then on the couple decided to borrow money to invest in raising livestock. In every funding round the couple had used the money to invest in livestock. With this focus, the family’s finances have improved markedly and they have been able to afford more conveniences. Mrs. Mai’s son earns an average of 2,500,000 VND per month from his work, and this amount is used to make the weekly payment to the Fund. Extra income is put towards larger and more important uses. In this round of funding the family is requesting 13,000,000 VND to invest in raising pigs. The family’s average income is 4,000,000 per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Chi Nguyen, Kiva volunteer.

Ngay từ nhưng ngày đầu Quỹ triển khai trên địa bàn thôn nhà, chị Mai Thị Kiềm đã bàn bạc cùng chồng là anh Nguyễn Văn Thanh, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương, với một địa phương thuần nông nguồn thu nhập chính hoàn toàn phụ thuộc vào nông nghiệp. Từ đó việc vay vốn sử dụng vào mục đích chăn nuôi được anh chị lựa chọn đầu tiên. Các vòng vốn vay của Quỹ anh chị đều đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Với việc lựa chọn mô hình chăn nuôi kính tế gia đình anh chị phát triển rõ rệt, sinh hoạt gia đình đã được cải thiện hơn, mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị, con trai chị đi làm thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ/ tháng, số tiền này gia đình dùng vào việc trả tiền tuần cho Quỹ, thu nhập từ dự án được gia đình sử dụng vào các việc lớn. Vòng vốn này gia đình xin vay 13.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi L., aged 44, joins TYM Fund so that she can take out a loan and invest it into breeding poultries including chickens and ducks. Mrs. L. has been using all the loans from TYM Fund very effectively, and thus making good profits. Before joining TYM Fund, it was an extremely rough time for Mrs. L. and her family. But since joining TYM Fund, her family’s income has become more stable than ever. They have been able to purchase motorbike, refrigerator and other necessary furniture. The quality of life has been improved as a result. Mrs. L. is currently breeding 100 ducks, 100 chickens, pigs. She has three children, one of whom is married and lives independently. The other two are still in school and lives with her. In the next loan level, Mrs. L. wishes to borrow 10 millions VND ($ 600) to continue investing into poultries. Her family’s monthly income is 4.5 millions VND.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Hà Thị Luyến 44 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương gia đình chị vay vốn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gia cầm, loại gia cầm chăn nuôi là vịt, gà. Các vòng vốn đều được gia đình sử dụng hiệu quả và cho thu nhập cao, lúc trưa tham gia vào Quỹ gia đình chị kinh tế còn khó khăn, đến nay kinh tế đã phát triển rõ dệt. Thu nhập từ dự án gia đình chị đã tích lũy mua sắm được nhiều tiện nghi có giá trị trong nhà như xe máy, tủ lạnh .....Hiện tại chị đang nuôi 100 vịt thịt và 100 gà thịt, ngoài ra chị vẫn chăn nuôi lợn, chị có 3 con, 1 con đã xây dựng gia đình và ra ở riêng, 2 con hiện đang sông cùng chị và đang đi học. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gia cầm. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.500.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Raising

loans.name: Las Rositas Group

texts.es:
Silvia is partner and president in the “LAS ROSITAS” Communal Bank, a group comprised of 12 partners total. Silvia is unmarried and has two children. Silvia's principal economic activity is the sale of American clothing. She is a very responsible partner. Her objective in obtaining a loan through Kiva partner AGROCAPITAL is to increase her inventory of American clothes as well as to increase her income and to improve both her and her family's quality of life.

The partners of the “LAS ROSITAS” Communal Bank are from the San Antonio district, and the majority of the partners have small businesses in the local market. Cristina remarks that, with the loan proceeds, she is going to increase her merchandise inventory since buying in bulk is more economical and allows her to turn over her stock more frequently. In this way, she can improve income for the group and for their families.

Marco Antonio is a taxi driver and has worked in this capacity for 3 years. Julieta sells clothes and like Silvia has 10 years of experience. Evelin has been offering cleaning services for the last 2 years. Walter has been a messenger for 2 years. The other partners all work in commerce with experience averaging 3 years.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Silvia es socia y presidenta D. la Banca Comunal “LAS ROSITAS” , grupo conformado por 12 socias (os). La señora es soltera, y tiene 2 hijos. Su actividad económica principal es la Venta D. ropa americana. Es una socia muy responsable, el objetivo D. obtener el crédito con AGROCAPITAL, fue el D. incrementar el stock D. ropa americana e incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. ella y D. su familia.

Las Socias D. la Banca Comunal “Las Rositas” pertenecen a la zona del barrio San Antonio, la mayoría D. las socias tienen sus pequeños negocios en el mercado D. la cuchilla. Cristina comenta que gracias al crédito D. nuestra institución va a incrementar su mercadería puesto que comprar en cantidad le resulta más económico y le permite lograr una rotación mas frecuente D. su mercadería, D. esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para ellas y el D. sus familias.

Marco Antonio es taxista y trabaja en este rubro desD. hace 3 años, Julieta venD. ropa y al igual que Silvia tiene una experiencia D. 10 años, Evelin se dedica a ofrecer servicios D. limpieza desD. hace 2 años atrás, Walter es mensajero desD. hace dos años y las otras socias todas se dedican al comercio con una experiencia promedio D. 3 años.

loans.use:
Operating Capital
Capital de Operaciones

loans.name: Sonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sonia is 29 years old, married and has 3 children, ages 8, 6 and 1 ½ years. Her husband was dedicated to the sale of garlic when he was still single. Upon marrying Sonia the business was administered by the couple, Sonia being also dedicated full time to the sale of garlic. Already they have 13 years of experience in this business, although Sonia has less time, but has acquired sufficient knowledge for the development of this process. These days there are more difficulties in selling this product since the prices are more expensive and the clients do not demand garlic so much as before. At present they have little inventory of this product. That is why they will buy boxes of garlic with the loan, in order to continue with the business and to reinforce sales. Sonia hopes that their business will always be stable, and will also work hard to bring in more clients.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Sonia tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 8, 6 y 1 ½ años. El esposo de Sonia se dedicaba a la venta de ajo cuando aún era soltero, al casarse con Sonia el negocio es administrado por la pareja, estando también Sonia dedicada de lleno a las ventas de ajos. Ya son 13 años de experiencia en este negocio, aunque Sonia tiene menos tiempo, pero ha adquirido el suficiente conocimiento para el desarrollo de este proceso, aunque ahora presenta más dificultades para la venta de este producto ya que los precios están más caros y los clientes no los demandan tanto como antes. Actualmente cuentan con poco inventario de este producto, es por eso que con el crédito comprará cajas de ajos, para así seguir con el negocio y reforzar las ventas, Sonia espera que su negocio siempre se mantenga estable, y también trabajará duro para captar más clientes.

loans.use: To buy boxes of garlic for resale.

loans.name: Edgar Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo trabaja como chofer de servicio publico en el Trufi 88 (Sindicato Eduardo Avaroa), es su principal fuente de ingreso con lo que cubre los la manutención de sus dos pequeñas hijas que están estudiando en la escuela estatal, la esposa sólo se dedica a las labores domesticas. La pareja paga el alquiler de una casa ubicada en la zona de  Satélite de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para transformar el sistema de gasolina a gas natural comprimido de su automóvil, se estima que podrá ahorrar un  40% de lo que gastaba en combustible.

Es su primer crédito con IMPRO, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarla solicitud de Reynaldo.
texts.en:
Reynaldo works in public transportation as a driver for the Trufi 88 route (trufis are taxis that operate like buses, with fixed routes). He belongs to the Eduardo Avaroa union. This is his main source of income, with which he supports his two young daughters, who both attend public school. His wife only works at home. The couple rents a home in the Satellite City neighborhood of El Alto, Bolivia.

Reynaldo plans to use this loan to convert his trufi to run on compressed natural gas instead of gasoline. He estimates that by doing so, he will save 40% of what he currently spends to fill his tank.

This is his first credit with IMPRO; he has been approved for the loan based on a credit evaluation conducted by the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert vehicle to run on natural gas

loans.name: Insaf

texts.en: Insaf is a 52 year old woman. She lives with her husband and their child in Saida, southern Lebanon. She sells clothes in a small shop and she wants to expand her business. Insaf has requested a loan of 600 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase school bags for her shop. She has paid back all of her previous cycles on time.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for her shop and also expand her inventory

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Cruz D. Cacorco” , vive en el Sector Cacorco del Distrito D. Copani, Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno
Tiene 55 años, es casada y madre D. 6 hijos que trabajan en la ciudad D. Lima, junto con su esposo se dedican al negocio D.  compra y venta D. ganado. Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compro 2 ovejas para engorD..

Actualmente viaja a  Bolivia a comprar ganado vacuno que trae en barco desD. allá., Hace 5 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos.

Con este préstamo que solicitara D. S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles comprara 01 ganado vacuno para engorD..
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the Santa Cruz D. Cacorco Community Bank, and lives in the Cacorco sector of the Copani district in the province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 55 years old, is married and is the mother of six children who work in the city of Lima. Together with her husband she earns a living buying and selling livestock. With the first loan of S/. 300 she bought two sheep to raise. Currently she travels to Bolivia to buy livestock that she brings back by boat from there. She has worked with Manuela Ramos for 5 years. With this loan that she is seeking of S/. 2500.00 she will buy one head of cattle to raise for sale.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase one head of cattle to raise for sale

loans.name: Tit's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group that consists of three members. Tit L. is 28 years old and sells fish in the market. She purchases fish from fishermen or wholesalers for re-sale, earning an income of around US$ 5 each day. This is a business she started in 2006. She is the mother of two children, both still small, and her husband is a farmer who grows rice and vegetables in their farm field.

L. is a women who sacrifices and works hard to earn money to sustain her family, especially to allow her two children to go to school. To expand the business, L. has applied for a loan to purchase extra fish for sale. L. is the leader this group. The other group loan members are:

Mrs. Yem Y., 57, a local farmer who grows corn and rice. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds for planting her field.

Mrs. Or A. is 60 years old and makes a living selling vegetables. She needs a loan to pay for vegetables, plowing a field, and vegetable seeds.

They all live in Wata Mem Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To buy seeds to plant another crop

loans.name: Ama Déla

texts.fr: Madame K. Ama déla, est une femme veuve qui a perdu son mari, actuellement, elle exerce dans le commerce de sacs de céréales et de charbons de bois dans le quartier d’adidogomé Awatamé à Lomé, elle travaille durement pour pouvoir nourrir ses 03 enfants. Elle a déjà obtenu un prêt de WAGES et sollicite ce deuxième crédit pour s’approvisionner avec dix sacs de maïs, 06 sacs de charbons et 10 haricots. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2000.
texts.en:
Ms. Ama Déla K. is a woman who lost her husband and is now a widow. She does commerce in grain and charcoal in the Ddidogomé Awatamé district in Lomé. She works hard to feed her three children. She has already had a WAGES loan and is requesting a second loan to supply herself with 10 sacks of corn, 6 sacks of charcoal, and 10 sacks of beans. She has been in this business since 2000.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grain and charcoal

loans.name: Meas' Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of three members, all residents of Kok Chork Commune, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. T. has been selected to be group leader by the group member. T. was born in 1982 and is a married woman who has given birth to two children; both of them are young and are enrolled in the local primary school.

T. currently earns an income by providing the national lottery service to villagers, and she can make around US$ 3 each day. To help provide more food for the family, her husband is working as a local electrician for a company located in Siem Reap Province. To reduce the cost of transportation, T. is asking for a loan to purchase a second-hand motorbike that will be used ride to work and for family needs.

The other two group members are:

S., 58, a domestic wedding decorator who needs a loan to repair her old house ( S. was not available for photographing so her father is in the photo instead);

C., age 27, who earns a living providing a lottery for neighbors. She is requesting a loan to enlarge her investment.

loans.use: To purchase a second-hand motorbike

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es: Lázaro H. A. vive en San Luis Talpa, departamento La Paz; junto  a su mamá y su hijo. A Lázaro se le ha sido muy difícil sostener a su pequeña familia ya que Lázaro solo cuenta con un nivel educativo básico, solo ha logrado conseguir trabajos eventuales, los cuales no han sido de mucha ayuda para los gatos fijos que representa su hijo al ir a la escuela;  pero con el apoyo de su madre Lázaro se decidió a poner una pequeña tienda, que es atendida por su madre y el. Lázaro pretende que  con el crédito, podrá surtir su tienda. Como se puede ver en la foto la tienda de Lázaro cuenta con muy pocos productos, en su mayoría golosinas que el margen de ganancias de estas apenas es de $0.05ctvs. por unidad. Lázaro solicita un crédito para comprar mercadería que le permita lograr ganancias visibles para el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Lazaro Hernandez A. lives in San Luis Talpa, department of La Paz, with his mother and his son. It has been very difficult for Lazaro to support his small family because he only has a basic educational level and can only get temporary work, his jobs have done little to help cover the fixed costs of his son's education. With the support from his mother, Lazaro decided to open a small store which both of them work in. Lazaro claims that with the loan he can supply the store. As can be seen in the photograph, Lazaro's store has very little merchandise, mostly candy which have a very small profit margin, barely $.05 per piece. Lazaro is requesting a loan to be able to buy merchandise that will allow him to make more visible profit for the growth of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to supply his store.

location.town: San Luis Talpa,  departamento de La Paz.

loans.name: Saymiddin

texts.ru: Клиент Юсупов Саймиддин 34 - ёх  летий мужчина, проживающий в районе Абдурахмони Джоми.Имеет среднее образования, женат, имеет одного сына.Клиент занимается животноыодством  более 6 лет на полученные деньги хочет купить несколько молодых телят с дольнейшей перепродажей.От продажи скотом, клиент  имеет прибль, это прибыль поиогает ему содержать свою семью.
texts.en:
Client Saymiddin Y. is a 34 year old man living in the Abdurahman Jami district. He has a high school education, is married, and has a son. He has been practicing animal husbandry for over 6 years and would like to use a loan to buy a few calves for future resale. The income earned from sale of livestock will help him to support his family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is married to Nebaseeh George Neba. They are both GHAPE beneficiaries and have four children; she lives in the heart of metropolitan town of Bamenda, Cameroon.  She plans to invest this loan in dressmaking and cultivation of ginger and cassava.  Precisely she will purchase cloth (textile) for dressmaking, ginger seed and pay for clearing and hoeing of farm for planting of ginger and cassava. Her ginger and cassava farm is located outside the main town whereas her dressmaking workshop in the town. 
 
This is Rachael’s second loan; she has been a GHAPE member since 2007.  Ginger is a medicinal plant that is very profitable, while cassava can be used to process many other products such as garri and waterfufu for marketing. She is a long time fashion designer and has many customers. 
 
With the profit from this loan, Rachael plans to buy a piece of land for her family to construct a house.  She also plans to take care of her family, ensure that they eat well and buy their medication.  She knows she will be able to repay this loan because of the low interest rate and the small repayment installments.
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Cloth, Ginger Seed and Clearing of her Farm

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga and her husband have two children: King Anthony - 19 years old and Janine - 17 years old. Both of them are already in college. Her husband is working in a distant place to support their family.

Her sari-sari store (community based store) has been operating for five years. Her weekly net income of 700 Philippine Pesos (about US $14) is being use for the allowance of their children. She hopes that her business will continue to grow so they can save something for the needs of her family. She therefore requests a loan of 13,000 pesos to buy additional merchandise for her store. She said that her determination to succeed drives her to work hard.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Bozorqul

texts.ru: Холниезов Бозоркул житель района Хуросон . Возраст 35 , женат и имеет троих детей.Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков для откормки . После откормки он продает их на рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
H. Bozorqul lives in the Khuroson region. He is 35 years old, is married and has three children. He raises large, horned livestock. He purchases young bulls to fatten. After fattening them, he sells them at the market. He plans to get a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. This will help him to improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Benkadi  1 De  N’Tjila Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi 1 est composé de  dix femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et de 5 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux dans le village de N’tjila qui relève de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues par des relations d’activités agricoles. Elles comptent exploiter pendant cette campagne hivernale, 4 hectares d’arachide et 2 hectares de riz. 
Afin d’augmenter leur productivité pour satisfaire leurs besoins alimentaires et pécuniaires, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur troisième prêt agricole et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt ces femmes comptent acheter,  des semences (100kg de graine d’arachide et 70kg de riz non décortiqué), 10 bidons d’herbicides, 15 sacs d’engrais (dont 10 sacs d’urée et 5 sacs de complexes). Les semences et les intrants sont achetés auprès des commerçants de Bougouni.
La production attendue est de 2 tonnes 640 kg de graine d’arachide  et 5 tonnes de riz Les produits sont vendus sur le marché de Bougouni à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, en gros, en détail  et au comptant. 
Avec ce prêt, les membres du groupe Benkadi 1 envisagent réaliser un bénéfice de 35 000 FCFA chacune à la fin du cycle qui leurs permettra  de faire face aux frais de santé de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
The group Benkadi 1 is composed of six married women who have an average age of 28 and five children. They live in traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children, and husbands in the village of N’tjila, which belongs to Bougouni prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women know one another through agricultural work. In this crop year, they intend to plant four hectares of peanuts and two hectares of rice. To increase their productivity for satisfying their financial and food needs, they decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third agricultural loan. All the preceding loans have been repaid. With this new loan, they intend to buy seeds (100 kg of peanuts and 70 kg of unpolished rice), ten drums of herbicides, fifteen sacks of manure (including ten sacks of urea and five sacks of complexes). The seeds and other supplies are purchased from Bougouni merchants. The harvest expected is 2.64 tonnes of peanuts and 5 tonnes of rice. The produce is sold retail and wholesale at the Bougouni marketplace to customers composed of men and women, in cash transactions. With this loan, the group members each envision realizing a profit of 35,000 francs CFA at the end of the cycle, allowing them to address the health care costs for their children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and agricultural supplies

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um S. is 30-year-old grocery seller--selling cooking ingredients, sweets, and candies for kids in her village. She currently earns around $2 a day. Her husband works to cover the family’s expenses by cultivating rice. This couple lives with one lovely kid in the rural area of Pursat Province. Um S. requests a loan to purchase more grocery items to sell. This will provide her with extra income.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to sell

loans.name: Susma

texts.en:
Susma M. lives in Sundhara, which is located in the Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses. She lives with her extended family, which includes her mother-in-law, sister-in-law, husband and one daughter, who is eighteen months old. Her husband works in a snack-making factory.

Susma is engaged in the weaving of woolen sweaters, gloves, caps and similar items. She takes orders from the dealers and she gives work to the local people. She took two months of training for this work. Now she is requesting a loan of 20000 NPR to buy wool for her business.

loans.use: To buy wool for her weaving business

loans.name: Cristina Angelica

texts.es: Doña Cristina originaria de la comunidad de Totonicapán  su principal fuente de ingreso lo obtiene en la venta de productos para dama en las diferentes plazas municipales en Salcaja, Totonicapán Chimaltenago, lo biene ejerciendo  desde cuando tenia doce años hoy necesita de un credito para incrementar su negocio para poder ser competitivo en el mercado  y tener una variedad de producto para la satisfaccion de su clientela.
texts.en:
Doña Cristina is originally from the community of Totonicapán. Her main source of income is from selling products for women in the different municipal markets in Salcaja, Totonicapán, and Chimaltenago. She has done well for herself these past twelve years, but now she needs a loan to expand her business so that she can be competitive in the market and offer a variety of products to satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase operating capital

loans.name: Mat

texts.en: A garment factory worker, K., 24, is married to Math, 27. Math runs a service as a local construction provider. K. has two children who are still young and attend school. In addition to their savings, K. and Math are looking for a loan of $ 500 to buy wooden poles and supplies to renovate their house. Koryass was not available during the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To buy wooden poles and walls to renovate their house.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur habite le quartier Avépozo à Lomé. Ce quartier est spécialisé dans la culture des produits maraîchers pour exportation. Cet homme exerce comme activité la revente d’emballages de ces produits exotiques. Les maraîchers achètent auprès de lui des paniers avec des couvercles en gros et en détail. Le monsieur s’approvisionne au Bénin et revend ensuite ces paniers. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour lancer une nouvelle commande de 560  paniers, 600 couvercles et le reste du prêt servira à couvrir ses frais de transport vers le Bénin. Cet homme est marié et a un enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Avépozo district in Lomé that is a district specialized in market gardening for export. He has a business reselling packing materials for this exotic produce. The market gardeners buy covered baskets from him wholesale and retail. He stocks up in Benin and then resells the baskets. He’s requesting a WAGES loan to order anew: 560 baskets and 600 lids. And the rest of the loan will be used to cover the costs of transport to Benin. This man is married and has one child in his care.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baskets for keeping and exporting exotic produce

loans.name: Anatolio

texts.en:
Anatolio B. owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products and scrap materials in his community. He is 59 years old, married and living in the village of Santiago, Iligan City. Anatolio has been in his business for over six years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Anatolio joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Anatolio is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offerings. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering
